When my son starts moving his feet around the rattles are hanging off or just come off altogether.- Rattles are a bit too quiet.- The wrist rattle cuffs are a bit on the small side.- The foot rattles are a bit on the large side.~CONCLUSION~I think the it is a great concept, but definitely could be executed better.Unfortunately, my son does not really pay attention to any of rattles.  This is strange because he loved looking at and touching similar looking toys.  But he does enjoy chewing on the wrist rattles.I would not recommend these and would recommend spending your ~$20 on something else.

I will not be ordering again because it does not have the slanted edge- which really helps when trimming babies nails. They are also very small in size which makes it difficult to maneuver. I find these over priced for the quality.
summary: Worth a shot but not again

reviewText: This is the best double stroller out there to date.  I LOVE this stroller!  I've tried so many doubles that I've lost track, and I've hated them all.  They're too long, too wide, too hard to steer, etc.  Not this one!The Chicco Together looks stylish and cool.  I have the cubes pattern, and I really like it.  The stroller frame seems to be sturdy and stable, and there aren't a lot of pieces on the stroller that will break.  The stroller is tall, which makes it easy to get into the basket underneath.  The adjustable handle is great.  I put it on the middle setting and my husband puts it on the tallest setting and we're both comfortable pushing the stroller (I'm 5'5", he's 6'3").  We can both push the stroller without kicking the wheels.  The wheels on the stroller have a little bit of cush to them - they're not completely hard, which makes for a nice ride for the kids.  It is very easy to push, and the steering is phenomenal.  The seats are on the smaller side, 14" wide, which I prefer.  My 45 lb 4 year old would fit in them, but they're not huge.  The weight recommendation is 40 lbs per seat, and a 40 lb child would easily fit in the seats.  I like a smaller seating area for the kids.  In some of the other strollers, my kids seemed to slop around in the huge seats.  They are 6 months (23 lbs) and 2 1/2 years (28 lbs) and they are very comfortable in the seats.  I like the five point harnesses, and the buckles seem to be good and sturdy.  The front seat has the option of two cupholders or a bar.  I opted to put the bar on, and was pleased to see that the bar is covered in fabric, rather than foamy material.  The baby can chew on the bar (and she does!) without me being afraid she's going to bite a piece of foam off.  The stroller is easy to fold and unfold, and I really like that when you fold the stroller, it stays folded.  You don't have to flip a switch or a lever to make it stay.  The stroller is not as long as lot of the doubles, which I love.  I hate to feel like I'm pushing a train, and this stroller is definitely not a train.  I believe it is 47 inches from the bar on the front to the handle.  It is compact, while still having enough space for kids and bags.  The fabric is well stitched and feels like it will hold up really well.Overall, I am absolutely loving this stroller.  Easy to push, easy to steer, sylish, comfortable, and great!  I recommend it to anyone and everyone!
I'm happy with this purchase.  It is good looking, works well with the stroller and provides enough room to stick a blanket inside as well.

These bags are terrible.  I thought they'd be such a great idea but they're NOT, DON'T WASTE YOUR MONEY!-They don't actually hold 5 ounces unless you fill it all the way to the ziploc then spill some closing it-The measurements on the bag are so far off it's not even funny, what it says is 5 oz is more like 3-The ziplocs are terrible, you think it's closed but really it's only 1/2 closed.  I make kid lunches every night, I know how to use a ziploc, these are terrible-Milk gets above the zipper area, probably ok for pumping and feeding the next day, but not for longer term storage-5 ounces is not enough, need to be bigger (and as stated above they don't hold 5 ounces anyway)These seem like a great idea and maybe if they were made a bit better they'd be worth it, but they're not.  Don't buy.  I wish I could return but it's too late now.

We never figured out how to swaddle our baby in a blanket so he couldn't wiggle out, but the HALO SleepSack keeps him content and contained. We found that it works best when his arms are straight at his sides and the first flap is wrapped tightly around both arms (not just one, as shown in the diagram). With a lightweight cotton sleeper underneath, he stays plenty warm in our 66-degree bedroom.
summary: The easiest way to swaddle a baby!

reviewText: easy to install, it keeps my daughter from drinking supplies under the kitchen sink.  i also bought the magnetic lock set, not worth it, actually it didnt even work.
summary: they do what they supposed to do

reviewText: A little awkward, but works just fine.  Saving my 10 year old leather seats, for sure!  I guess it is really more like a 5 star if you consider that it has to conform to many cars and car seats.
summary: Necessary for saving you car's upholstery!

reviewText: The swaddleme sleep sacks were my favorite while I was swaddling my baby. they are simpler than all that velcro on halo, and when you're up at 3am, I was very thankful for simple. Also a nice bonus is that you fold the velcro over when you wash them and they don't snag on everything. GREAT price for a happy baby :)  OH, they run a little small so get a size up!
This is the cutest and most baby friendly item I have seen in awhile. I Love this :) The baby loves it and everyone of course enjoys the music :)
summary: I Love this: ) The baby loves it and everyone ...

reviewText: This did not work for me at all.  I wanted something to carry my son around the house in when he was just a few months old (under 12 pounds).  He was not comfortable in it, and it did not feel good when I was wearing it.  I would not buy this again.

I love this swaddle because there are multiple ways to use it. You can swaddle both arms, or just one, or even convert to not swaddling arms at all. I like that the legs are free to move around, but they stay warm as they are still covered by the sleep sack. The fleece material is good for a winter baby.

My son has three different Lamaze cloth books and they are far superior to any other brand (sassy, bright starts, infantino etc) of soft books we have had (I returned or donated all the other ones actually). So I was really excited to replace his old car seat hanging toys with a Lamaze brand toy for baby #2... but this is WAY too big to use on our car seat handle. The rings at the bottom basically smack my one month old right in the face. I'm sure it is super annoying, so we had to take it down and replace it with a sassy brand toy.Overall, this toy is superior to the others. It has every "gadget" you could want on a newborn toy. Different textures, contrasting colors, a teether, a hide and seek pocket, a peek a boo mirror, a squeaker, a pull tail ... really it has everything!  I just don't know how much my daughter is really going to get to play with it, considering it's main function should be to hang from a car seat handle.
summary: Love Lamaze, actually wish it was smaller tho

reviewText: Fisher Price has been known for awesome baby toys and the Fisher-Price Piano Gym is no different. There are actually 3 different versions of this great baby gym. The basic Kick and Play, the Grow and Discover, and the Kick and Play in Pink.The Fisher-Price Piano Gym, Kick and Play comes with 5 busy activity toys some of which include hippo teether, elephant clackers, rollerball frog and a large mirror. You can convert the gym into 4 different ways for various play time experiences.  Lay and play or the basic set up for kicking; Tummy time; Sit and play which allows your infant/child to sit upright and smash/play on the keys to their hearts content & Take along where the piano detaches and you are able to take it along as a car seat/travel toy.The Mat itself easily detaches and is machine or hand washable.  My son absolutely loves this mat and get plenty of smiles and exercise from kicking the piano keys. I absolutely love it and would highly recommend it to any parents out there.
summary: My Baby Loves to play with his Feet!

reviewText: Nice sling, well made with very pretty fabric BUT IT DOESN'T FIT! I measured myself with a tape measure and according to the official Hotslings size chart I measure a 24" from shoulder to hip which is 2" below the maximum size for their regular size sling.when it arrived it barely fit over my frame at all- let alone with the baby in it! I had it adjusted so the buckle's cinches were all the way out and it was as big as it would go. It was way too small. So irritating!
summary: Come on Hotslings, make your size chart accurate!

reviewText: First of all, these are a great concept!  To have something to keep sippy cups and toys from falling to the floor in a restaurant or outside is great, but this one is not a good choice.  There are better ones!  I have only used this strap a hand full of times.  On the first attempt, the button was so difficult to punch through the hole that it took more time than it was worth.  Then there was the removal...which took even longer.  I do like that the strap has a removable piece, where you can attach it to let's say a high chair and remove it with one touch of a clasp.  After using this product for approximately the fift time, I went to put the button through the hole, and it came off.  I tried to re-attach it, but it required glue...too much trouble, so it got tossed.  This is a good product in theory, but too much to it.  There are simpler products similar out there.
summary: Very impractical, poorly made, and hard to use

reviewText: Its a well made and sturdy potty seat.  I lile how it folds to become smaller so you can travel with it.  It fits well on top of our toliet seat.  overall I'm happy with this.

I hesitated to buy this warmer based on some reviews and comments here but I could always return it, right? I had the Firstyears bottle warmer model before this auto one. Measuring the water with a little vial each time was a pain in the rear! Having the water tank on this model is very convenient. Some reviewers said the beep alert was loud - they must have bionic hearing! The beep alert is just 8 chirps, and if I'm not in the room, I can't hear it at all. It's the same type of chirp/beep as an old 80's style digital watch. I really like the exact settings - ounces, starting temp (room, fridge or frozen), bottle type (standard, wide like my Medela bottles, disposable, and jar food) and type of milk or food; formula, breastmilk or jar food. When I had the other warmer I was always concerned with how much heat was used as breastmilk needs to be warmed slowly to preserve the antibodies. While it can take 5-6 minutes for a 5 oz bottle to warm up it's by steam so bottles aren't submerged in hot water and no worries of overheating. In standby mode the center button is solid and the selection buttons flash. 3 clicks of the on button are needed from this stage to start the heating - directions weren't clear on this. I don't touch any buttons at the conclusion of a cycle btw - so 3 clicks and it's on if the settings are the same. It comes with a basket to lower jar food and a top ring over the chamber to keep the steam in and bottle centered - only wish it could be tightened as sometimes it pops off when removing my wide bottles. Overall, I am very happy with this warmer! It's compact, holds enough water for 2 days of bottle warmings, and is quite reliable. Only improvements could be a longer cord and maybe a count down screen so you know exactly how long the wait is; I'd pay more for that feature. This warmer will definitely grow with us when solid foods are introduced with the jar setting! DO give this one a try if you need a compact warmer with specialized settings that won't break the bank! ;-)
summary: Fantastic bottle warmer, no more guess work at 3 am!

reviewText: I have never been disappointed with a Kid Co product.  They tend to make very quality, functional safety equipment.  The same goes for this cabinet lock.  Easy to use, but not so easy that a kid can get past it.  This is the only cabinet lock that you should buy.
summary: another quality product from kid co

reviewText: I love this crib! I've only set it up and not used it so I'll update review eventually. Me and my sister put this up in a night by ourselves. Did take some serious effort and time but it is a very sturdy, beautiful crib. The espresso color is even nicer in reality than in the picture.

Baby #3 loves to sit in his car seat and hold his own bottle. This sling just assists him. It tilts the bottle at a nice angle so that milk doesn't drip out, but baby can still grab it and bring it to his mouth if he wants. I use the Playtex Ventaire bottles. Not sure how others would work. I tried a fat Avent and it didn't work as well. I think the Playtex work nicely because they are angled. We used to put a blanket prop under him but the bottle would always get knocked over by him. We bought this just to try it. It's ok here and there. I pretty much keep it in the diaper bag and use it maybe if we are in the mall and he's in the stroller. I don't use it often, but it was only $25 so I don't feel I wasted my money. For people who want to bash moms who use this product, grow up! This is a useful item to have when it's needed. I never use it while driving in the car and would not recommend other moms/dads do that. Baby could choke and that's not good. But if I'm eating dinner and baby wants to sit in his car seat toying around with his bottle, break out the Bebe sling!
first couple of days it was constantly falling down, but something happen later on ...it doesn't fall anymore, keeps all the toys inside.
summary: doesn't stick to the wall that well

reviewText: This is my baby's new favorite toy. It's a tether and rattle in one. Perfection! And the teething end is soft so when she gets excited and whacks herself in the head it doesn't hurt as much as a regular rattle. LOL!
They break easily (never ask a man to fill these)! You can't put them in the microwave to unthaw. Useless.
This bag is a very nice size and stays secure on our tiled shower wall. It holds a good number of bath toys and allows air to flow freely to let everything dry.

I am trying several different diaper sprays including Kissa's Lotion Potion, Booty Luster and California Diaper Wash.  This has a sweet vanilla-y smell to it, does a good job along with cloth wipes (babykicks) of getting poo off my little one's bum, and does not irritate his fragrance-sensitive skin.

Like other reviewers, I also have theFisher-Price Rainforest Jumperoo, and both of my kids have enjoyed playing in it--though my daughter tends to bounce until she pukes, which can be a problem...Anyway, I expected this jumperoo to be pretty similar to the Rainforest one, and in a lot of ways it is. It's colorful and happy, and it has lots of fun stuff to play with. As a jumper, I think it's great. I like the three height settings (Rainforest has this, too), and it is easy for my kid to bounce. The toys are fun, though I think there may be a bit too much going on here. Still, I do like the look of everything.Unfortunately, that's about all that impressed me, and here's why. First off, the plastic parts feel cheaper and more flimsy than the same (or similar) parts in the Rainforest jumperoo. I was really surprised by the difference in seat quality, especially; the Step N Play's plastic seat is much thinner than my other one and feels less durable. Moreover, my seat cover doesn't fully button to the plastic seat. The buttonholes are too loose, so the seat cover, no matter how I maneuver it, becomes detached at parts. I got around that by attaching the seat to as many buttons as I could and then quickly snapping the seat into the base so the material was locked into place, but still. The craftsmanship could be better.Second, it was actually difficult for me to put this jumperoo together. I don't know why I had such a tough time snapping the legs into place, but they kept getting stuck, not wanting to move down into the shortest position. That was never a problem for me with the Rainforest jumperoo. Eventually I got everything where it needed to be, but, again, I couldn't help feeling like the craftsmanship wasn't as good as it could have been.Third, as far as what makes this product different from other jumperoos--namely, its capacity to become a walker--I'm just not sold. I wasn't sure how this feature worked at first, but after testing it out a bit, I realized that the bars (hidden by the large green toys on either side of the jumperoo) extend--and once you extend them, your baby can take a few steps forward and a few steps backward. I suppose this is a cool feature in theory, but, honestly, how fun or interesting is it to take a few steps straight forward or straight back? Moreover, this unimpressive feature adds a lot of bulk to an already HUGE piece of baby gear--not to mention a higher price tag.I realize that every kid is different. (Mine certainly are.) And though I'm still not impressed with the quality, size, or price of this jumperoo, if your kid could benefit from practicing some basic and limited steps, maybe you will find this jumperoo to be more useful and impressive than we have. For our needs, though, this seat missed the mark, and I would still recommend theFisher-Price Rainforest Jumperooover the Step N Play.
summary: Lots to play with, but the added walker feature isn't worth the price.

reviewText: These fit great on a 5" mattress.  It can be hard to find mini crib sheets that have the right depth.  These work nicely even after machine washing & drying.
This works great for a child that does not need to be buckled it.You can wipe the surface clean so easily.I love the bold, fun color.
summary: Love this chair for our older son

reviewText: This carrier is extremely comfortable and doesn't hurt my back even after wearing it for a long time.  It distributes the weight of the child evenly and allows me to have my hands free the entire time.  Also, the fabric is easy to care for.  It is resilient enough that I can just wipe it down with a wet cloth to remove most things but it is still soft and comfortable enough against baby's skin.
summary: Super comfortable and easy to care for

reviewText: I was surprised to see all the negative reviews saying this didn't work or didn't fit. I've been using this on my daughter since she was around 7 or 8 months old. We have no problems with water getting on her face - you do have to hold it against their forehead so that the flexible part forms a "seal". It doesn't seem to be uncomfortable for her. We have a sprayer attachment for our shower and this visor allows me to rinse all the shampoo out of my baby's hair in just a few seconds with no tears or fuss. This is honestly one of the most useful baby items we own.

It ended up being more of a hassle to use this then just jump in the bath with her. Plus I had more control over her in the bath versus struggling with this giant thing. She  kept sliding down, even when we used a  towel under her. I used it a couple times, now a year later it sits in our closet.

This bouncer is great for the price. I kind of wish that I would have gotten one with more music/sounds, but aside from that, I really like it. I love the colors and I was surprised to find that my newborn is not too small for it. I didn't think I'd be able to use it for at least a few weeks, but she has been perfectly fine in it from the beginning and really likes to look at the butterfly and flowers -- its one of the first things that really grabbed her attention. The bouncer also moves really easy when she kicks her legs. The one thing that I really dislike about the bouncer is the little tune that plays when you pull on the butterfly. It is really tinny and annoying but it does distract the baby occasionally.

My son loves this soft panda snuggly blanket (only about a foot long or so).  It is very soft babies love the highly contrasting black and white colors.  It also has little arms and legs and ears to play with, which is perfect for a young baby learning textures and starting to grab at small toys.
summary: Black and white contrasting colors perfect for a baby

reviewText: I ordered this for my 10 week old because he was getting very fussy in the evenings and his limbs would flail all over when he got overtired.  The blanket is great.  I LOVED the color and it's a very nice material - stretchy and soft.  It was extremely easy to put on and I love the double zipper feature.  Unfortunately it didn't work for us.  My son hasn't been swaddled since a week old and now likes to suck his hands to self soothe.  He got very upset while in the blanket because he couldn't find his hands, so I'm returning it.  But I think if we had gotten it when he was a newborn it would have worked great.  Oh, it was also a little big for him.  I ordered the 14-19 lb size and he's 12 lbs 5 oz and 23 3/4" long.
summary: great product, unfortunately not for us

reviewText: Light weight, easy to put up/take down, great carrying case – just brought baby home 3 weeks ago and have been using this so he can stay in our room with us. The mattress is thick enough and firm enough that he's comfortable. The sides are high and there is plenty of space inside. A standard crib sheet does fit the mattress, however I'd recommend purchasing the crib sheets made specifically for this product as the standard sheet is a bit too deep. This will be fantastic as he grows up and we begin to use it as a pack & play instead of only a crib.

I LOVE these sleepsacks!  My newborn twins sleep soundly in them and I don't have to worry about them getting out of them, which they do when I swaddle them with just about anything else.  They're nice and warm and have easy access for changing.

I have had this for maybe a year or so and I really do like it.  It works well for both infants and larger kids.The only complaint that I really have is that it can be difficult to get your infant in and out, as the mattress is literally on the ground and you have to position yourself awkwardly to be able to reach the bottom over the sides.  My parents have a pretty difficult time with it for this reason.  Once your child starts sitting up, etc. it's no problem.  But being that infants are laying flat, and that sometimes you are putting them into the crib while they are asleep, it can be a bit difficult and awkward.But, it is super light, easy to unfold and fold (once you get the hang of it), and I think my babies like it better than the 'regular' pack and play.I didn't want to spend the money on the organic cotton sheet.  I got a jersey 100% cotton portacrib sheet and if fits great (nice stretchy material with a snug fit).
summary: Light, easy to use, very low to the ground

reviewText: My inlaws recently bought us this stroller and I am in total love with it. I also have one of the frame strollers (that the car seat snaps into) and it is nice for quick trips to the store, but for walking and longer days in the stroller, this is the way to go. I originally didn't register for this as I thought it was too expensive, but if you can afford it (or get one as a gift) then I highly recommend this stroller.I bought the Graco car seat adapter even though it states a child can ride in this after 8 weeks (walking only). I tried to put my 16 week old in it without the adapter and the straps would not get small enough. The adapter makes the stroller kind of monstrous, but it rides like a dream.Worth the money!!

I had such a hard time breastfeeding until I discovered this product. My very small baby used to look like she was suffocating in my very large breasts (34N). The only time she was able to feed was when I was so full of milk I thought I was going to explode and then my nipple would be pushed out and solid enough for her to get a good latch, but after a few minutes she would give up when things started to soften up. I wasn't sure if she was going to be able to do it after four days of misery. Once I put this shield on she was going at it like a pro. I like the contact version with space for her nose. She doesn't seem to like her nose against the material. The 20mm is a great size. I had a 24mm and it was so big my daughter would end up sucking air in from time to time.I have three, one for upstairs, one for downstairs, and one for the diaper bag. I don't know what I would do without it.
summary: The one item I can't be without!

reviewText: Our baby is 9 weeks old and loves to look at both sides of this toy - the black and white side and the side with the face. It hangs perfectly in her jungle gym so when she lies down she can grab the rings on the bottom of the firefly. I expect she will only love this toy more as she ages.

These were a complete hassle to pry apart just to install them.  My mom and I each held a side and pulled, but nothing.  I finally had to shove in the latches as far as I could to get them apart.  Since that seems to be the only way to take the cover off, I had to leave the latches pushed in, defeating the purpose of keeping kids from pulling them off.  Definitley something I would use as a permanent fixture.  It's too much of a hassle to take it off every time you need to plug something in.  I plugged in what I needed to and have not intention of switching them up.
summary: They're okay once you pry them apart to install.

reviewText: This does it's job.  I have to scrub the seat with a Magic Eraser because a normal wash cloth sometimes will not remove the food.

These are a pain to clean, but I love the design.  The wide neck design is easier to hold, for me and my daughter.  The wider nipple also seems to mimic the breast and a more natural form of feeding.I started using these around four weeks with my daughter and didn't notice any difference as far as gassiness and fussiness were concerned.  However, my daughter was never labeled "colic" and did not cry excessively.  She did have an occasional bout with gassiness which caused her discomfort, but nothing gas drops or a soothing tummy massage couldn't fix.My daughter is now six months and this is still her preferred bottle.

I tell everyone about this crib. It takes 1 minute to set up and maybe 2 minutes to fold away. We used it on every trip we take. We also use it when we leave him with my sister's. He sleeps fine in it. My son was about 6 months when we started using it.i'm thinking of using it for a ball pit for my one year old hehe!

If you are looking for a gift for a friend's new baby, or one for your own baby this is the best toy ever! It covers all the senses and provides hours, even months of enterainment. It was the 1st toy my infant was interested in and now 5 months later she still loves the toy.

I loved this product when I first got it and used it several times before it stopped working one day. I think it was left on the side of the bathtub, on a wet surface overnight. The next morning it was still shining blue and since then it would not register temps correctly. So, lessoned learned....dry off the sensor at the bottom after EVERY use.
summary: Loved it at First, then it broke.

reviewText: I purchased the Storkcraft furnature for my daugher's room, after over a year of use I am really disappointed in this furnature. The finsh scratches really easily, the drawer gliders are coming apart, this is just very cheaply made. I wish I would have purchased something else.

Seeing the previous reviews, I wonder if the quality went down. I just got mine and they don't work as advertised. The spots disappear in warm water about 70%. They do not leave "clean" dogs behind. I am not impressed at all. They are cute and are somewhat entertaining to my son, so that is why it has two stars and not one.

Soft exterior edges so it won't hurt baby.  Has a streatchy velcro fastener to attach to various objects.  Can stand up on it's own (but easily knocked over by active baby).  LARGE clear mirror, easy for baby to find. Activity objects are a hit with my baby (little ball rolls inside of ladybug).
summary: A big hit with my 6 month old!

reviewText: I like the plate but it is a little on the small side. This one comes with the lip and the cover. I wish all OXO plates came with a cover.

My daughter had this as an infant and into her first year. She loved it because of the bright colors, crinkly noises and happy face (at least that is my perception - she wasn't talking much at 8 months :-)I have since purchased two more for teachers going on maternity leave. It makes a great gift.Lamaze has a good reputation and the product is well made - no recall worries.Works well for newborns and into the first toddler stages.
summary: A Perfect Baby Gift - Lasting Fun

reviewText: This hads made my pumping at work so much more easier.  I am able to write emails, read, browse the web easily without having to worry about loosing suction if I don't hold both at the same time.  This is one of my top 10 must haves for having a new baby and going back to work.

Seriously, this has been so perfect for when we travel. It's true that it only holds only a certain number of dishes, but when you're traveling with a baby, less is more! There's no reason to cart around a large drying rack if you don't need to. The removable bottle brush sold me on this drying rack's convenience and practicality, and it has proven so useful. Love OXO!

It's small, compact, and convenient.  We picked this product up before taking a trip to Okoboji this past June.  It fit nicely in the backpack, we use as a diaper bag, and the bottle dryer was extremely convenient.  The brush was adequate and dried quickly.I wish it snapped together a little more firmly but that's the only negative I can think of.  I'd buy it again.

I purchased these bottles a month before the birth of my baby.  I was convinced that I would love them, and couldn't wait to start using them.  To my surprise, I hate them and want to throw them in the trash.  I just hate to throw $25 in the trash. So, I am using them as a last resort when my other bottles are dirty or damaged.Cons:1.  They leak like crazy.  They leak from the bottom and the top.  This is a huge disadvantage for breastfeeding moms.2.  There are to many parts (6) to wash and keep up with.  These parts also take up a lot of space when drying them.3.  You can't pump directly into them.4.  It is very difficult to warm milk because of the thick plastic and rubber insert at the bottom.  It takes 3-4x the time it takes for milk to heat up in other bottles.5.  When attempting to heat the bottles, I noticed the water would turn cloudy.  The milk would leak out of the bottle, and I am pretty sure water was being soaked up into the bottle.  This occurred even if the bottle was properly assembled.6.  The holes at the bottom of the bottle is a perfect place for bacteria, mold spores, etc. to enter the bottle when placed on different surfaces (counters, refrigerator shelves, tables, etc).  I am uncomfortable leaving this bottle in the fridge for more than a day because of this, which renders this bottle useless to me.7.  HASSLE!!!!Pros:1. They look nice.2. The cap can be used as a medicine cup.3.  My baby had less gas when I could get these bottles to work.
WAY too big and bulky. It's not very easy to use or clean. It doesn't drain very well and you end up just dumping it out by tipping it over.

These are the best rubber duckies ever. We love almost all Boon products and these are no exception. They're BPA free and they have no holes in the bottom where water would be able to get in. My daughter loves the fun colors and shapes. We even purchased a set for a friend's baby.
I use these to have my 11 month old self-feed yogurt. They work well and don't leak, though I don't store them on the fridge with food. I like that they're dishwasher safe.
summary: I like that they're dishwasher safe

reviewText: This was a fantastic "accidental" discovery of the bamboo collection! I have purchased other swaddling blankets from Aden + Anais and quickly fell in love with their versatility and size to swaddle my growing little one. When I purchased these particular swaddlers, I was more than thrilled at how soft they are. I agree with other reviews that you just can't stop touching them. The prints are also beautiful and vibrant. These are a must have!

This is a great bath thermometer. I use for my son and can tell if it gets too warm easily. Just make sure to put the turtle where it is not in any water when done with bath or it will keep reading. Super cute for him to play with too. He is two.

This is a wonderful help! I use this when I am on my lunch break at work so that I can multi-task and continue to write reports, etc. while I am nursing.  The only downside is that it takes a little longer to set up, so for the times that I am nursing in the morning/afternoon at work it just isn't fast enough to use. But it is wonderful for the times that I have a little longer to nurse.
summary: Great as long as you have some time to set up

reviewText: I did so much research before my purchase and I am very happy with this gate. It wasn't hard at all for my husband to install from wall to banister at an angle. A good looking, sturdy gate! I feel confident that my new walker is safe. I give it 4 out of 5 stars at this time b/c the pieces that screw into the wall are made of plastic, not metal. So far it's worked great and seems durable but it's only been 4 months.
summary: The Best Angle Top Stair Gate

reviewText: I bought this for my 8 month old but it is extremely narrow. She can barely fit when she is all the way on the backrest without feeling too crowded. Also the table doesn t easily fix so the only position I can make it stay it's the maximum so the baby is even more crowded. I wouldn t recommended this product
i got these to go with my manual pump. they are larger so you don't have to replace them mid-pumping session.

It's not that the diaper genie is bad.  It does what it says it will--control odor in your baby's room.  However, after using it for a little over 4 months, we have found that it is a pain in several ways:  1. It is EXPENSIVE to buy the refills.  If we did it again, we would get a diaper disposal system that uses regular trash bags or the plastic grocery bags.  2. The refills are difficult to change.  We've even had trouble with a piece on the top that turns the bag to twist it, breaking.  It's really easy to break something or not put the pieces back in the right way.  3.  It fills up pretty fast.  And you almost never have time to unload it when this happens.  We started off loving this contraption and singing the praises that you've heard from so many, but have since found ourselves grumbling about it more and more.  We'll probably stick with it for a while because we've got it, but if you are considering buying a diaper disposal system, I'd probably go for another one.

This feeding dish is definitely one of the toughest ones out there. Its made of very high quality plastic that's pretty thick and its very easy to clean as well. Its smooth surfaces are easy to wipe and it won't give you a hard time when you scrub off the dried left overs that's stuck on the container.I like the rubber bottom because it makes it easy for me to hold it even if my hands are wet or become sticky from the baby food. And wherever I put the dish down, it stays in place and it doesn't likely to slide away even on a slightly angled surface. The curved edges of the ring really does its job of preventing the food from spilling! I have a 6 month old baby who is very squirmy while eating and she often hits her plate that I'm holding by her playful hands. So this type of feeding dish is really a must for me to keep her from making a lot of mess!One of my favorite things about this dish is its shape. A lot of feeding bowls and dishes are thick and bulky to put in a diaper bag. But this one is not so I really like taking this with me anywhere I go with my baby. The container is non-spill too so even if I put this in my bag sideways with one side filled with baby food (puree/powder), it won't leak.However, there are few things I hope they would add to this container to make it more ideal for traveling.  First, I hope they would put a non-spill divider between the two compartments so even if both sides are filled with pureed baby food or powdered cereal, it won't mix together however you place it inside a diaper bag. Lastly, though its not really of a big deal, it would be nice to include a spoon attached inside our outside the dish just like the other brands' feeding set!Overall, I'm always satisfied and impressed with OXO products so this is still one of the best dishes for babies in the market!
summary: Top notch quality and features but not ideal for traveling

reviewText: In an effort to be more bag in our household, I've been slowly swapping out sandwich bags with reusable containers.  On small errands, carrying a container with kids really isn't practical.  With a plastic "cup type" container, too often do our kids accidentally drop them and all the snacks go flying out in multiple directions.  We've found that "bag type" containers work well to carry Cheerios and small crackers, and if they drop it most of the mess is contained.  Bumkins reusable sandwich bags help serve that purpose.The colors are bright and cheerful on the bag, the zipper top is easy for our kids to open and close themselves, and the size is great - it's big enough to put a sandwich in there.  Because the bag is not truly waterproof like a ziploc bag, we use it primarily for crackers, cereals, and the like.  It's easy to wash in the washer, and it dries about as fast as any other reusable bag (we give ours a day).

I purchased this for my daughter when she began sitting upright in shopping carriages.  I could not stand the thought of her touching anything with all those germs.  I previously had a cheaper version made by Infantino that I purchased from another store, but was not at all happy with it.  It did not cover the entire surface of the carriage and my daughter always managed to touch the one spot that was not protected.  I then purchased the Floppy and could not be happier.  Its generous size covers the entire surface of every carriage I have encountered.  The plush material also makes for a comfy ride.  She is nearly 3 and I still use it all the time.  It washes well and folds up compact.  Well worth it and a must for every baby registry.

I got the reusable snack bag to carry snacks for my 18 month old. It's pretty neat. It's very sturdy and durable (so far..will update if I have any problems with this). The design on it is Cat In The Hat, which make it a lot cuter! You was is by throwing it in the washer inside out. That's nice that you don't have to hand wash it. Overall a nice product.

OOPS! It turns out I ordered this product a little too quickly and before reading all of the product reviews. That's why it pays to read all of the reviews, people! I mistakenly ordered these diapers thinking that they wre diaper covers you put on your baby to prevent the pool or other water they are in from absorbing into the diaper. No. That's not what these are for. You might be able to get away with that, but thatsn't the purpose of these. The purpose of these is to prevent leakage from cloth diapers. For that purpose, these work fine. It just wasn't what  I was hoping to purchase. Let this serve as a warning to othersso you don't makethe same mistake!
summary: This is for covering cloth diapers to prevent leaks, not for taking in the pool!

reviewText: Good deal on a bulk order of baby stuff, however upon consideration its probably more economical just to get this stuff locally.  Now we have enough baby changing stuff to last the better part of a year!  Diaper genie is great, seals off the poopie diaper in a sanitary package.
summary: No fuss, no muss, no poopie.

reviewText: I spend more than an hour trying to get it setup, but had no success.  I'll update hopefully when I get it working!
summary: I wasn't able to get it working

reviewText: The only pacifier our little one would take,  exactly like the ones given at the hospital.  Very happy with the order.  The item arrived on time and I did not have any issues with it.  Very happy.

I was thrilled to receive this maternity pillow because of so many good reviews and claims to alleviate back and body tension. So far it has failed for me in every category and I am very disappointed I wasted the money. List of complaints below:CONS:-Can't lay on your side with it comfortably because the large weight of the pillow cause your arms to fall sleep or go numb. (Needs thinner sections there like the Boppy maternity pillow has)-Causes added pain to my lower back instead of helping-BURNING HOT, causes me too sweat since the fabric is horrible and pillow so large.-ITCHY fabric cover, despite having washed several times with various fabric softeners-no cover available for it, needs to have a soft cover option available because one that comes with it is horrible itchy-bulky and huge, don't recommend for anyone who doesn't have a king size bed. (I have a king so least of my issues with this pillow, but notable for queen or smaller beds)PROSHolds thickness shape.Synopsis, don't waste your money on this pillow. I have honestly yet to find a maternity pillow I really like, but I do think my Boppy maternity body pillow provides far more comfort for side sleeping than this pillow ever could. I can NOT side sleep with this pillow.

Works great in rain. Fits our car seat Chicco. I don't use it from sun, although it has a reflective light cover. I use it only in the rain since the net is not the best thing if you want your child to get fresh air. I cover his car seat by light blankets as Aden and Anais to protect from the sun.
summary: great design, fits Chicco car seat

reviewText: I like losing these bags for snacks better than using plastic bags.  I put cereal snacks in them and toss them in the diaper bag, and they are easier to find than the plastic ones.  The print is lively, the bag is dishwasher safe, and that's all I need.The bag is big enough for a sandwhich, but not anything else much bigger.

All items picture arrived quickly and together. The two piece phlanges are a bit of a pain because there are more pieces to clean (I have bought other parts sets since which have this as one piece). When you pump a lot the more pieces to wash, the more bothersome.

I have had 7 children and wish we had found this infant bather sooner! It's lightweight, easy to keep clean and folds up for storage or traveling. You can set it in the tub or place it in larger sinks. I never liked the plastic tubs because baby ends up sitting in dirty water. With the Summer Infant bather, water flows right through the bottom which is more hygienic. We started using for our 6 month old son and he loved it right away. The seat is very comfortable and the mesh is nice and stretchy so it conforms to his body. After using it for these past 2 months, I would definitely say this bather is ideal for supported sitters and younger (8 months or less).NOTE: This model (18500) has NOT been recalled like the reviewer above has claimed. It does not have any problems with the frame collapsing! I hate to see a good product like this tainted by an inaccurate review.Some other reviewers have mentioned a safety strap, but that could be a good or bad thing. Personally, I would not want to fool with straps while trying to get my baby clean because it would get in the way and might potentially irritate their skin. My suggestion to Summer Infant would be to make the seat a bit "deeper" to help keep wigglers in place better. But honestly, nothing replaces being right there to monitor your baby while bathing!
summary: Comfortable for Baby and Easy to Clean and Store

reviewText: I love the firmness of this mattress. It fits our crib well and our baby seems comfortable on it.If you're looking for some advice on other baby registry essentials, check out AllMomsArePerfect dot com. You'll get the lowdown on what you really need and what you could save to buy later or avoid completely.
summary: Extra firm and fits our crib perfectly

reviewText: Overall its a good product. I have two of these and in one of them, a lot of times the lid gets stuck after refilling it - because the lid comes out of its hinges and we have to reattach that to get it working again.

This changing table pad cover is sooooo soft! It fit our Serta pad cover perfectly. Baby lays comfortably while getting her diaper changed. I will definitely purchase another one of these on the pink and green dots. It's so cute.

reviewerName: Mrs. L.G. "Mama to a bunch of boys!"
reviewText: These are perfect for my toddler's small crackers and cereals he likes to snack on. Better than plastic ziploc...doesn't fall open and he likes to unzip it himself!
summary: Love the little reusable snack bags!

reviewText: I like that all of the re-play items are recycled items.  I love the bright colors and the fact that they are gender neutral.  However, I noticed that it requires a lot of soap to remove any greasy residue from ordinary foods (cheese, chicken, etc.)  Not that much of an issue, but a good swipe of dish soap doesn't cut it.  It really requires a good scrubbing.  Just a little heads up.

I love the concept of this, and was really hoping it would work for us. My little guy had been bathing in a standard lay-down bathtub that fit in our kitchen sink, but once he started rolling over, it was becoming really difficult to keep him in place for his baths. So I thought this would be great since he would be sitting upright. Unfortunately, he's terrified of it. I'm not sure what the problem is, but we gave it about 10 days & it was still making bathtime miserable for us, so we switched to the Munchkin Bath Ducky and now he's happy as can be!I also want to add that it's a very confined space & I found it very difficult to wash him in it. It's also kind of nerve-racking, trying to keep their head above water while you wash... Just something to think about before you order!

I've tried a couple other brands of corner cushioning, and this one seems to stick the best despite baby's efforts to pull it off. (Which it can come off with some force, but it doesn't just fall off on its own like some other brands I've tried.)

I've used amber necklaces before, so I knew I'd like it, but this was no exception.  I like the color of this one and the performance has been great.  I also worked with The Art of Cure to resolve a small issue and they were wonderful.

I only used about 1/2 the double-stick tape I thought I'd need for this, and my Herculean son has gotten it loose in a couple of places.  However I am going to reinforce it with more tape, and I feel pretty sure that this will do the job for as long as we need it.

I love that these pacifiers are all one piece. My baby doesn't take a pacifier too often but when he does hes able to keep it in. He also really loves to just chew on it and I don't have to worry about him hurting himself. Compared to other pacifiers where the plastic is harder. He seems to really enjoy them.

Oh, baby.I love this tub. I didn't get it on Amazon - some poor fool gave it away and it fell into my eager little paws. But I was prepared to pay for it anyways.Let me first say that while I'm no crunchy-granola kinda lady, I do love that this tub uses hardly ANY water compared to other tubs. Time is precious as a mother - I don't want to spend 20 minutes JUST filling the baby's tub. I also love that the water stays warm and my baby's lower body stays submerged. Getting him to sleep soundly on his back is enough of a nightmare, don't make me bathe him that way too. Bathtime takes place in his bedroom, mere steps away from his changing table. The whole experience is quiet, calm, and relaxing for both of us.A lot of people complain that this tub is useless for a full-body scrubdown, but um... are you rolling your infant through the mud? They don't get THAT dirty. Give baby a nice little sponge bath in the nether regions before bathtime, then let them soak in the tub.Others mock the Tummy Tub, pointing out the similarity to its ugly cousin - a regular old bucket. Errr.... bathing your child in a bucket from Lowe's is a really terrible way to save money. The Tummy Tub is only manufactured for one purpose - so you won't find any sharp edges or seams that could scratch your baby.---> One thing I can suggest is that you don't need to fill the tub all the way to the fill line. My son is only 3 months old, so he's squirmy and his head is constantly bobbing around. It makes it easier to maneuver if I stop filling half an inch before the line - that way the water isn't so high when he's in there. I feel a little less freaked out and bathtime lasts a little longer, which leaves both of us far more content with the experience.

My son loves this one just as much as he loves his Eddie the Elephant.  I have left this one hooked onto his playmat and it's one of his favorite ones to pull on. He loves the legs the most that have the rattles at the feet, of course right now it's all about the sounds for him that delight him.  I would definitely like to get a few more of these take a long toys that you can attach to pretty much anything.

So, my daughter slept in a mini crib in our room. Once she started rolling over her arms and legs would get stuck in the slats and she would wake up crying. Since I had another Breathable Baby full size bumper that I loved, I was sure that I would love this. We measured the crib and ordered this and IT DID NOT FIT! It left a 2 1/2 inch gap! Now I know some reviews say people found a way to deal with that gap but I returned it! I didn't pay for it to have a 2 1/2 inch gap!

This product is great! My son's dr suggested TriViSol drops by Enfamil. After picking up the box and reading the ingredients i said no way am i giving my son this product! There has to be something more pure. Low and behold here it is! With only vitamin D and coconut oil as the ingredients. Plus you only need one small drop and it has NO flavor. (Hubby tasted it) Baby gets his vitamin and I feel better knowing that he isnt getting all the synthetic stuff that Enfamil has in their product.
Really like this, just a little too big for my LO.

This case allows me to carry a great load of wipes at any given time. My toddler is a messy one (who's isn't?!) and the ability to have so many wipes on me in a convenient case is a LIFE SAVER. And they stay moist!

I love this pillow.  I bought this pillow very early on in my pregnancy (1st trimester) because I was having a very difficult time sleeping due to indigestion and nausea.  This pillow is huge!  But it does the trick.  I would prop my upper body on this pillow to decrease the indigestion and nausea and I would sleep/nap propped up.  It has also helped tremendously in preventing hip pain and back pain.  I have been sleeping in it since I received it.  It's like sleeping in your own little cocoon.  It supports my hips, my back, and now that i'm in my third trimester it is also supporting my belly when I lay on my side.  It is awesome and I highly recommend it!  Just keep in mind that it is very big and will take up a large amount of bed space.  My sweetie is confined to the very edge of our bed ever since I've had this pillow.  But he's been a good sport about it and I've actually caught him taking naps in my cocoon pillow every now and then!!
summary: So glad I bought this early on in my pregnancy!!

reviewText: Super easy to use, comfortable, easy to put on and take off. Definitely holds the horns and full bottles of milk without needing hand support.

Nice little basic toy. You pull back on it and it goes forward making the balls pop. It doesn't have any paint on it, so you don't have to worry when your baby starts chewing on it. It is small enough, about 5-6 inches for small hands to manipulate.
summary: good basic toy w/o any paint

reviewText: I debated buying this for a couple weeks because I wasn't sure it'd be worth the money. Now that I have it, I wish I didn't wait so long. When you're pumping around the clock and you're exhausted, it's nice to just be able to relax when you pump and not have to hold the pumps in place and constantly monitor them to make sure you're not reducing the suction by the way you're holding them. Now I'm thinking about buying a second one so that I always have an extra when one goes into the wash.Also, I'm plus size and this fit great. Lots of different ways you can adjust it. It's comfortable too.
summary: Wish I didn't wait so long to buy it

reviewText: We couldn't bear the thought of cutting our baby's fingers on accident with other traditional clippers or scissors, so we read reviews and bought these instead. I can't believe how quickly babies' fingernails grow so I'm glad we have this handy. We use it several times a week when he's sleeping (since he moves so much that we still don't want to risk cutting with all the squirming).The only slight Con: The cover is nice to have and it does have a lip that secures it pretty well, but I still lose it because I put it down when I use the scissors and sometimes I can't find where I put it down!I like writing reviews so I hope this helped in you in your decision to buy or not.
summary: Cross our fingers but no accidents yet!

reviewText: This is by far one of the best! The mirror is large enough to be visible from just about anywhere. The reflection is a real one, not a carnival mirror reflection. The music is soothing for my daughter, and the fact that there are two volume levels is great. And I love the light! She just sits in her seat and stares at herself. And try popping around the seat and surprising you kiddo when momma or poppa show up in the mirror!

Love the design, especially the foldover handles.  One issue I've had is that the handles after a couple months don't stay together so well when folded over so the opening is obscured.  Not too big a deal.  The other issue is the material - a plasticky fabric like you'd find on patio furniture.  The good part about the fabric is that you could hose it off to clean it.  The downside is the smell - mine aired off in a couple days, but wow out of the box it stank.
summary: Cute, useful, easy to clean - couple issues

reviewText: I love this hamper! I really didn't want to spend $25 on something that was going to hold dirty clothes, but I love the design of it. I like that there's a hole in the top that's easy for my son to throw his dirty clothes in, but it also isn't a wide open top, so it looks neater. The material is also very sturdy, and it's larger than I expected. My 2 year old loves to drag it to the washing machine by the handles. I bought it for his 2nd birthday because he loves roaring like a lion...I hope he doesn't grow out of that stage too fast!

Levana Astra features the pricey Oma sensor, which clips onto the diaper, monitors baby's movements, and is not necessarily wanted by everyone nor compensates for a lack of Wi-Fi, but is unique and fills a market niche. However, the Oma would doubtfully prevent sudden infant death syndrome, which cause is unknown, whereas remote viewing through Wi-Fi may certainly show an abuse sometimes misdiagnosed as SIDS due to a lack of evidence.The Astra without considering the Oma is inferior to cheaper Lorex BB3525, LB315 and LW2450, LW2451 (playing lullabies and monitoring temperature + sound-activated recording + allowing outdoor camera LW2401AC2 respectively), which unlike the Astra allow to connect to the Internet for remote viewing on smartphones and tablets using Skype.  However, remote viewing on BB3521, LB311 requires Lorex ACCWIFI1 WiFi Remote Connection Cradle (charging monitor) sold separately God knows where.  The Astra is solid, its functions work properly, the camera supports two-way talk with the child, but the handheld's and camera's speakers face back and right respectively.
summary: Unique, inferior to cheaper Lorex BB3525, LB315, LW2450, LW2451

reviewText: Love this. Plastic liner so no worries on wet baby clothes. Great to transport by top hole/handles. Easy for use in parents bed room when cosleeping.

Cute and keeps our baby's head safe. We were concerned because our shower diverter is on the back of the spout, but it went on okay and doesn't obstruct use of the shower. The little fins are the adjuster to tighten it, nice product design.

This will be my husbands 1st father's day and I thought this would be a touching gift! :) ....I love the idea and it is very easy to follow the instructions, but I will say since my daughter's just a baby, I had to repeat the process a few times and it did take a lot of patience. Do not do this project if you don't have the time to take.When I did the prints they came out just ok so I had to push down a lot harder then expected and also I had to press all around the prints to make them stand out a lot better. I also had to put a few drops of water afterwards to smooth out lines and cracks with my finger followed by a damp paper towel to wipe off any excess clay on frame.It took longer then I had envisioned but it looks pretty cute!
Even in frigid temperatures my newborn is toasty warm. He wears a light jacket and hat, no bulky snowsuit required.

This is the first toy that my daughter actually grasped in her hand (hence the high educational rating).  I think that was approaching 3 mo?  Can't quite remember.  By 4 mo, she had discovered that she could make the little worm click.The toy is a worm made of a bunch of wooden beads and disks strung along a nylon-coated red elastic (much like a hair elastic).  It's stretchy enough for a baby to pull on, and tight enough that it all goes back together when you let go, but not so tight as to risk pinching fingers.I have it hanging from her car seat handle bar (which, by the way, is totally against the rules, so you shouldn't do it... I'm just a bad mom that way) and it makes my daughter really happy when we go out with the stroller wheels.  The little handle is just the perfect size for her little grip, and she gets a kick out of making noise.  She also appears to love the texture on her gums, because she chews and slobbers on the ring all the time.This is definitely a favorite toy and the premium price is totally worth it to me because it is non-toxic and very high in quality.

This "bra" is a must have for using a double pump!I first bought the Medela one in the store with the pump, and it was completely useless.  It didn't fit right, had no support for my somewhat large chest, and you had to separate the flanges from the bottles to remove them which resulted in milk everywhere.The Simple Wishes is adjustable to a huge range of size, including an optional panel in the middle to space out the holes.  It includes straps which I use in a halter configuration for added support.  And most importantly, you can insert and remove the flanges while keeping the bra on and the flanges attached to the bottles, so no milk is spilled.Make sure you check the size chart - I was skeptical buying the small/medium (I'm a 38D) but it does really fit.

This is on my list of things I considered to be right up there with the wipe warmer, but I was so wrong!  This made ALL the difference with my pumping experience at work... I was able to relax, read, do some work, and wasn't so focused on the clock.  I recommend this to all of my to-be mom friends!!

With my first daughter I got the diaper dekkor (I think that's what it is called) then I got the arm and hammer munchkin one with my recent baby and I really didn't like that one at all.  But I finally put some money down for this one and was not disappointed!  It's easy to use and keeps out the smells.  It does fill fast and that means more special bags to buy so you have to figure out if that's something you want to commit to.  For now since we live in a single story we've decided to now switch to using the kitchen garbage and plastic bags for the stinky ones, but if we move into a 2 story house this will be used again!
must have if u have to do a lot of traveling or visits to the doctors. always better to put it higher to make sure it gets warm enough
summary: in love, so happy with it.

reviewText: This stroller is visually appealing and fits nicely through doors ways as long as the child is walking strait forward. I like that there are some rubber stops on the under side that impede movement on bumps or edges to keep the tike from tumbling down the abyss.The tiny little tray is annoying. Although the toy is removable, you have to flip the walker and use a screw driver or butter knife to pop the toy out. It's not a click off and go situation like it's implied.The construction is sturdy and the colors are tolerable.  It promotes forward motion which is helpful because your kid doesn't get the idea that they can walk like some side winding snake.
summary: Good walker with annoying toy feature

reviewText: When I saw the pictures posted, I liked it and thought it would be bigger like a little blanket as 2 of pictures showing babies open the book like they open the newspapers. When I got it, it is just a little book.
summary: Like it but wish it's bigger like the pictures posted

reviewText: Easy to use and heats up quickly. But when I use it according to the chart timings provided, it seems the milk is not warm enough. So I end up extending the recommended warming time. Not sure if anyone else encounters the same issue.

Most of the crib sets are too cutesy and cartoonish. This set is great because it is not over-the-top cutesy or some bizarre cartoon like animal. The colors on this are great. My wife and I loved the four piece set so much that we bought all the rest of the items to match. The dark brown background really makes the other colors pop and they look great! Too bad it looks like it is being discontinued. Buy it before it is no longer available!

After lots of research, we pretty much decided that no diaper Pail is perfect. I think it's motivation to toilet train your child. I should mention that a diaper pail was not a necessity for us until our baby started solids and his poop started smelling. Anyway, this diaper genie contains odors well and doesn't look bad in the baby's room. The foot pedal is great for hands free opening. The refills are a little pricey and I hear you can make your own bags but that sounds like too much work for me. When it starts filling up, you have to push down the diapers which can be a little icky. I'd get this again however because it does such a great job containing smells.

My daughter is now starting to feed herself with her own utensils. We started with spoons and I saw these and my daughter has been using them with ease. They are made very well and they are easy for her to handle. I love watching my daughter use these.

We use it for our newborn and prop it in a way so it doesn't fall out, but I guess it will be much more userul once he can grab it and hold onto it himself. Another plus is that for us it's always easy to locate, unlike small pacifiers.

While I thought this shade had only four soft suction cups at the corners, I was wrong. This sun shade has four plastic corners that are made of hard plastic. That means that in an accident, these corners could harm occupants when this shade becomes a projectile in the car.The hard plastic corners contain a blue "push here to secure" button that is supposed to help keep the shade on the window by better securing the suction cups.  Unfortunately, they don't work very well, and the shade still falls off the window, especially if they get very hot or very cold (which is hard to prevent unless you live in a very temperate climate!).The size of this shade is good for standard car windows, but it is a bit large for compact cars' windows.  Trying to make it smaller by placing the suction cups closer together doesn't work because then the gaps cause it to be difficult to see through the shade (a safety issue).This shade has FAR less hard plastic than those "roller shades" that are made for car windows, and thus is probably not AS dangerous, but hard plastic is NOT good to have a in a car, especially near the delicate heads of children. Instead of choosing a shade with hard plastic, choose one that is made of soft materials only. Soft fabric and vinyl are fine, but hard plastic (or metal) is not. Think-- if you wouldn't be okay with the item hitting your child's head, you don't want it in your car!
summary: Hard plastic corners, doesn't stay on window

reviewText: Our daughter is two months old and she tolerated the swing when she was smaller. She would nap in it here and there, but she didn't care to be in it for long. Now that her vision is good, she loves it! She absolutely loves the mobile and it makes for a good place for her to doze off if you're trying to get a few things done around the house! I like how it plugs into the wall, I seem to think the battery opperated ones are a waste of money. Overall we love this swing! The only thing I would change about it was that the swing vibrated as well, but that's only because our little girl is a "soothing vibrations" junkie! :) Great swing!

We are expecting parents. My husband wants to have Dr Seuss fitted crib sheets and I want one alphabets sheet. This one meets all our requirements.We have a soy foam crib mattress and this fitted sheet fits perfectly. I'm about to wash it with other baby stuff a month before my due date. Hopefully it won't shrink in dryer.

We first bought this cover for our son's car seat (Chicco Keyfit 30), which seemed like a must for our Minnesota winters. (Note: we did purchase this through Amazon, but my review does not have an Amazon Verified Purchase because we ordered it under my husband's account.) I wanted to get one that had a "shower cap" style that fit snugly over the top of the car seat instead of one that fit underneath the straps, since I heard types that fit the latter style could interfere with the safety of the straps.The good: It fits great on the Keyfit 30, almost as if it was designed for this particular car seat. I also think it's a very warm and toasty cover, and had no concerns that it was keeping him warm enough regardless of the outside temperature. I would actually recommend unzipping the front panel for car rides with the heat on, since I would often find him sweaty after having kept it closed while in the car.The bad: The problem with the "shower cap" style is that, when installed, the height of the face hole is fixed. This means that if your baby is taller/older, his or her face will be offset towards the top of the hole, which will make it hard to get the baby in and out of the car seat. When we first started using it, our baby seemed like he was starting to get a little tall for the face hole, since he was about 4 1/2 months old. After using it for about two months, I finally had to take it off and stop using it because it was very difficult to not to catch his head on the fabric above the face hole when putting him in or taking him out, which usually resulted in crying. Our baby is on the smaller side for height and especially weight, so I would guess most babies would be too big for this by about 6 months of age. We now use a blanket, which is much less convenient, so I am considering trying our nephew's hand me down JJ Cole for the rest of the winter.In summary, I can highly recommend this car seat cover for babies born in late fall or winter, especially for those with the Chicco Keyfit 30. If, however, your baby will be older than 6 months by the time you expect to stop using the cover, I would recommend going with a different cover, or expecting you will have to stop using it by then.
summary: Great warm cover for Chicco Keyfit 30, but works best for smaller babies

reviewText: I REALLY wish I had read the other reviews here before I bought this thing. But I didn't. It is in no way a rattle, it's way too heavy for my baby, and will be way too heavy until he's over one year old, most likely. There is actually no rattle to this thing at all (as others have mentioned) and although there are speaker holes in the back of the gorilla head, almost no sound will come out unless you shake it very hard, and in a specific way. I doubt kids will get any of the tiny squeaks out of this thing at all, because it's not fun to try and try to get a noise that sounds nothing like a giggle, and is too quiet to really be of any use at all. My husband thinks it's bright and pretty and he told me I shouldn't return it, but I learned my lesson, to read reviews of even the "simplest" things before I buy them.It is suggested below that "teether" and "teething toys" are tags I might want to use. There is nothing on here that a baby would want to use as a teether, and "rattles" also suggested, is part of the name of the toy that so badly mislead me in the first place. No giggles, no rattles, not much of a toy.
summary: No Giggles, No Rattle: False advertising!!!

reviewText: This was much easier (and safer) to use than a bulky coat or snow suit.  Our baby was born in November in Michigan, so it was totally necessary to keep him warm in the car seat.  This was easy to put on and off the car seat, but stayed on when you wanted it to.  The flap with velcro was good for walking outside in the snow, and the zippers were nice for letting the baby breath once in the warm car.I think you are supposed to be able to easily get your baby in and out of the seat without removing this cover, but we did not find that to be the case.  Our baby was over 10 lbs when he was born, so that might have been part of the problem, but we definitely found it easiest to just pull the cover off, put the baby in, then re-install the cover.  Luckily, that was all super easy to do.  This thing saved us a lot of hassle and money (baby snow gear is so expensive!).

We used these to send purees with my baby to daycare. They freeze well and don't take up much room in the freezer. My only wish was that there was a combo pack available with some larger containers. When my baby started needing more food, we had to send him with lots of small containers rather than one larger container. That was really minor. Otherwise we loved these.
summary: Great size for homemade purees, wish it came with a few 4 ounce containers

reviewText: I'm on my 3rd baby and have had 2 different models of this item. BOTH lids have broken, and that is with light use. It also does pathetically little to keep the smell down. My current model is pretty much a paperweight in the corner of the nursery and we have been using grocery bags to dispose of the diapers.I just got the Munchkin Arm and Hammer diaper pail to evaluate before its release next month and I tossed my old Diaper Genie right in the trash. ;) I figure it can't be any worse, LOL!
summary: Went in the garbage with the diapers

reviewText: These are the cutest dishes I've ever seen. I can't wait until my daughter is a bit older so she can use them!
My Baby loved this when she was a newborn. We have now switched to a differenrt brand of binkis but This is the cutest product ever!

Perfect solution to storing soiled diapers before taking out to trash every week. The inserts can get a little costly, but it's worth it in our opinion. There are also DIY solutions to using other bags for the insert bags if you look around on the internet.
summary: Great solution to disposing of dirty diapers

reviewText: Same as the set of 4, but great for smaller babies..or feedings. Easy to clean, closes easily, sturdy, easy to stack
I love this car seat cover, it fits perfectly around my baby's britax B-Safe carseat. I like the fact that I can get the baby out without taking the whole cover off. Great product.
This is a super cute frame, and very nice quality. It looks really nice in my daughters room with her white furniture. I only deducted a point because I thought it was a bit overpriced.
This is a great crib sheet.  It protects the crib mattress and is easy to remove when it's time to wash!  Great product for any new parents!
Super helpful when rinsing a baby/toddler! Works great & is very sturdy, yet not too rigid that its uncomfortable when rinsing off their head :)

This is my sons favorite toy and mine. It's beautifully hand crafted and fun for him to play with. He's 6 months old and loves to shake it, eat it and spin the little men. This is something I will be saving for the next baby..
I bought this to keep my pets out of the downstairs/basement. There is a bi-fold door there. They are unable to get the door open. This item served its purpose perfectly.
summary: Works great to keep pets out

reviewText: I had bought Sticky Bellies for my grand daughter's progress so with the next pregnancy in the family - I had to get the ones for Moms to Be.  We have had such fun tracking her progress! What a great idea!

My daughter LOVES this sound machine. I was using my cell phone with a noise app to keep her asleep and this works so much better. I love that it does not turn off unless you set the timer and they projection is adorable!

Update 10-27-13:The projector part died a few weeks ago but the rest of the system has been working flawlessly. Took a star off my first rating since I thought it would last longer. Still a 4-star product since my daughter loves all the sounds and instantly seems to fall asleep when the rain is on (or it's actually raining outside. YES!)Original Review:The projector part has three different disks you can change out (very easily) to give your baby variety. Each disk has several different pictures on it and they all rotate constantly! The projector itself is moveable, giving you a ceiling to wall option for your baby to view. The music options are fantastic from a Mozart lullaby to the sound of rain falling. There are 6 different sound buttons in total (Mozart, rain, heartbeat, white noise, ocean, and lullabies). It has a timer you can set from 15, 30, 60 minutes, or just leave it on constantly. It has a small nightlight that does the job when you are entering a dark room to check on your little one. I would definitely recommend this product!
They're just the perfect size, and super-super convenient to keep on the diaper bag, or even on my purse! And most important, the box does not leak, nor open while on the go.
summary: Perfect size, and super-super convenient. Box do not leak nor open.

reviewText: These things tend to be more sturdy than the wooden ones.  My children kick them repeatedly and run into them as they wail for us to let them out, and yet they've held up.  My first child is now 5, so I'd say these things WORK! And we didn't even bother to screw them into the wall.

This bouncy is great. My son is now 8 weeks old and has been enjoying his bouncy since his 1st week of life.The cover is soft & comfy. The music and noise levels are great, Lights are amazing to baby.The only reason I gave it a 4 out of 5 stars is that the vibration is LOUD! Very loud so loud in fact you cant hear the music over the rattling if the seat. When we put more weight/pressure on the seat the noise lessens so Im thinking that when Baby weighs more it wont be so loud.

I bbsolutely love this thing. It has 6 sounds, Heartbeat, Rain, White Noise, Mozart, Ocean, and Lullabies. The projector has 3 slides, ocean animals, jungle animals, and rainforest. It works as a night light, you can turn the projector off and have the music on, or just the projector or both music and projector. The projector angles so you can have it on the wall or the ceiling and the unit itself acts as a night light. Wish I would of known about this sooner.

I bought this as I really liked the idea of the timer/ voice activation and projection combination. Genius putting those together.As it happens I leave the sound on all night rather than use the timer/activation. I also have yet to use the projection as the couple of times I've tried it, it upset my baby more than soothed him. I'll try it again.I don't love the overall quality of this product. The sound isn't great and the light illuminating the nightlight button (not the nightlight itself) has stopped working.Also, with the comments on how well this travels, I assumed it could run off batteries (my bad for not double checking) but it doesn't. And I find it bulky for traveling, but don't have an alternative.

Great quality, great price. Graco is a wonderful brand - I have really liked all the products I have bought in that brand so far. This is a great pack n play and I haven't been able to find it anywhere for close to this price. Thanks Amazon!
We bought this because we have a horrible sleeper and thought that this would help...... unfortunately it did not work for us.Like the idea, but our baby did not care for it!

Great idea, but what toilet does this fit?  I bought this with high hopes and it would have been great if I could actually use it. I've tried both toilets at home and two public restrooms and it doesn't fit any of them. It's going back.

I researched and researched and after reading a bunch of reviews chose this as a replacement porta-crib mattress.  It is not to hard or soft so as Goldilocks stated, "it is just right".  Worth the money and cannot beat free shipping.

Bought this at Kohl's during their Black Friday sale to give to my toddler for Christmas.  He's obsessed with it because he thinks he's "super frog" but after very little use and maybe two washes it started unraveling.  It also continued shedding after the first wash.  For what I paid on Black Friday, I won't complain much.  I wouldn't pay $26 (what it's currently listed at) for it--ever.
Convenient spoon with container for transportation. Safe for young children. Conveniently feed on the road and at home. Buy this item!

I thought this would be a terrific, reusable alternative to the squeeze pouches of fruits. It ended up being a big, messy mistake. The silicone is floppy, and the shape makes it hard to squeeze everything out of the pouch. Nice idea, but poor construction.
Only complaint: attracts lint and hair, and dust like no other material, so looks dirly, and constantly has to be cleaned up.

I really really like this gate. My 19 year old grandson put it up for me as a means of keeping our dog limited to a certain area of our house, and to keep the grandkids in a more controlled area as well. It was easy to install and so far seems to be holding up very well. My only concern is whether it will last over time because we get so much traffic in our house and you do have to use a good bit of "push" to release and open the gate each time.  But overall, at this point, we love it!

Got these for my niece for Christmas.  She was almost 2 and a very picky eater. Her parents got her a little kitchen. Shortly after she was doing much better with trying fruits and veggies. (I got the fruit basket too). She still plays with them and her mom just puts them in the washer. Over a year and they look new. Although the leek is a little wierd.
summary: great addition to a kid's kitchen

reviewText: Works really well for us. My daughter (27 mo) wouldn't use public toilets, and this has changed everything.
