(The blanket is designed with special spots for this) Otherwise it will stick to and create pulls on anything else washed with it.
summary: Love these! Great design for middle of the night diaper changes too.

reviewText: I ordered this mattress because the one already in the port-a-crib was too thin. When I received this one, it was just what I was looking for, good thickness, and fit perfect!

This wet bag is cute. It has a zipper. It's big enough to hold a day's wet diapers. But, it's kinda pricey.I need to have at least 5. One for my diaper bag. One for my car and at least 3 to rotate between home and daycare. That can get pretty expensive.If you aren't too attached to the idea of cutesy prints, check out ditty bags.Outdoor Products Ditty Bag 3-Pack (Colors May Vary)They are the same concept. Only much cheaper. You can get multiple sizes. Some are even big enough to be a pail liner.
summary: Save the Money. Buy "Ditty Bags" instead.

reviewText: I bought these for our little one, who is about to arrive.  I pre-washed them, and have been so incredibly disappointed, that I ended up just donating them to Goodwill.  First off, the tag is horrible, so I cut them all off.  They need to make these tag-less.  Also, once they were washed they rolled up into little rolls (image a taquitos).  Now, I could easily, wash them and lay them out to air dry, but what a hassle, and with a newborn on the way, who has that kind of time.  Don't waste your money, buy another brand.

I bought a different one previously thinking they were small but was happy to see that they hold a lot. I have stuffed toys in the fox bin and baby toys in the owl. I'm glad I purchased them and am very happy with these products.

reviewText: This is a trendy yet very practical swing. Smooth in operation, comfortable and almost soundless. Babies love it and so do moms.I wish it came in more variety of colors.Recommended.

I followed the directions to the letter but it leaks. No matter what I do it leaks. I can't even begin to use it because it leaks out of the bottom. Plus when trying to push out the air bubbles from formula its hard to get them out which causes my baby spit up and gassy.

I love the Lamaze toys and have bought several of the different varieties.  Each is great and interactive for baby to play with and learn at the same time.  They are well made, hold up well, come with rings to easily attach to strollers/car seats.  I would recommend several of these toys to any parents with young babies.The only thing that would make these better is if they could find a way to make them machine washable for when they get dirty!  That would be soooo helpful!This elephant version is cute and contains a teether that baby loves and some rings to play with.  This is not my favorite of the Lamaze toys, but is definitely one to consider.

I registered for these wipes and the Thirsties wipes, and I like each for different reasons. The Thirsties wipes are much softer and thicker; however, the Babykicks wipes have a textured surface that helps during some messy diaper changes. I only gave them four stars because the serged stitching has been coming undone on many of the wipes. They aren't completely coming undone, but there are loose strings that I need to cut off. Also, I can only use one side of the wipe it seems, the other side seems too rough for use. The Thirsties wipes are the same fabric on both sides. I am glad I registered for both wipes, but if I need more wipes I will be getting more Thirsties or maybe some itti bitt wipes because I hear good reviews for those as well.

I don't know about everyone else, but I find this bag way to small to tote around everything needed for baby.  You can pack it for a trip to the mall or grocery store, but for spending the night at grandmas or overnight trips this bag is way to small.Pros:Cute designEasy to clean (just wipe down with damp rag)Lots of pocketsStroller strapsMatching changing padLong and short handlesCan buy additional matching add-ons.  wipe holder, pacifier holder, and so on..)Cons:To smallSide bottle pockets barely fit a bottle.Overall, I like the way the bag looks, but it is unpractical.  If I am going to lug around a huge bag I should at least be happy about how it preforms.

I have another soother that I love, but I really wanted one that had more options.  I love that this has four different options and that the child can select which song to play by turning the "pages" of the book.  My toddler likes to carry his soothers around with him and place them on the floor, and I wish this one had a stable base that would allow it to stand upright so you could place it on the floor or table.  The base is rounded off, so it just falls, which means that you have to hold it if you want your child to be able to see the projection on the ceiling.
summary: Great options, but wish it had stable base so you could rest it on table or floor.

reviewText: I feel weird saying that it's only three-stars for education, because at four-months, isn't everything educational to a baby?Anyway, this toy is very cute, but it is small, so check the dimensions before you order if you're expecting something bigger.  It's a little expensive, but worth it to me. like the design and the bright colors.  My daughter enjoys chewing on wood, and I enjoy knowing that she's chewing on something made to EU standards, so it isn't nearly as likely to be toxic as her plastic toys from China.

I bought cotton insulin sleepsack because the material might be the most suitable one for the summer. But that huge piece of Velcro... though I get the idea that it wrap the baby tightly, it's so hard! When my baby is wearing it, she feels very uncomfortable when being held upright. Finally I took that piece off.Quality is good.
summary: The Velcro part is very hard, and too hot for summer

reviewText: Really good how you can clip this to many things - stroller, carseat, bouncers, etc. Looks great. The only letdown is that you can't replace the batteries in the lion, so once they run out, it won't make noises anymore. I guess this is for safety reasons, but it's still a bummer.
summary: Great little toy for good price

reviewText: I bought my son both Nuby teething pacifier thingies and he'll chew on both but this one is little too big at this point. He'll chew on the handle but it takes some coaxing to get him to chew on the bristle end. I'm sure he'll use it more once he can hold it himself, and stop sucking his fingers...
summary: Kiddo prefers the handle end of it...

reviewText: We had to remove the inside bracket to get these to fit our bi-fold doors. The fit is now a bit loose but the lock does what we want it to do, keeps the kids out!

Having read tons of reviews on this kit, I was very careful ordering.  I didn't go through Amazon since I know the white caps set will come instead of blue caps, so I went to Drugstore.com instead.  They had the blue caps picture shown, but then the title says "One Step".  I ordered 2 sets cause I didn't know what will actually show up, because "One Step"-labelled boxes have only 1 pump adaptor.  But other types boxes have 2 adaptors.  I called Drugstore.com before I ordered but they didn't know either.Well, guess what, the red/yellow box with white caps showed up, with 2 adaptors.  I promptly tested ALL caps, 1/2 of them leaked.  A nerd in nature, I carefully inspected them & compared to my blue caps from a gift set.  So this is the reason why the new white caps leak:1. Old blue caps have 3 parts: liner ring (insert liner into it), sealer cap ring, sealer pad.  The "sealer pad" is soft & rubbery, which you insert into the sealer cap ring.  The sealer pad has a flat, wide lip that'll press against the entire liner rim.  When twisted close, because the pad is so soft, it's easy to get a tight seal.  I twisted the blue "soft sealer pad + sealer cap ring" combo onto all leaking white liner rings, none leaked.  So the sealer cap structure is key.2. New white caps fused the "sealer pad" & the "seal cap ring" together into one.  Now you have basically a hard plastic cap with a rim protruding along the inner base.  When you twist the cap & the liner ring together by themselves, you can see that thin rim comes through into the liner ring.  So that means the liner must be held precisely in between the tiny gap between the rim & the cap itself.  Now that takes some work.  Also, because the whole thing now is a hard plastic piece, it's automatically harder to get a tight seal than with soft, rubbery, more press-able material.  I've had incidents where I found out that 1/4 of liner actually wasn't twisted in.  So when I did my 10-sec shaking over the sink test, water literally squirted all over the countertops.  Thank goodness it's only water, not pumped breast milk.  Also, to get the precise seal, you almost have to spend an extra minute or 2 or even longer to make sure you line up all the grooves & twist & re-twist the cap until you finally, hopefully, get the right twist, before you apprehensively turn it upside down to test, hoping, "oh, please God, please don't leak".  While with the blue caps, it takes 2 seconds, you don't even have to think about it.I wonder what on earth was Playtex thinking:1. When something (the blue cap system) is highly rated & works well, why mess with it?2. Especially, why messing with a storage kit for pumped BREASTMILK? The most precious thing to a mother other than her baby?3. Which mother with a newborn has that kind of time just to twist & retwist & test these bloody caps AFTER PUMPING??!! which is exhausting to begin with?  & AT WORK for God's sake??Shame on Playtex.  First comes those stupid expandable 8oz liners, now this.  They need to fire the product development head immediately.  By the way I called Playtex - they changed the packaging starting January 2012.  So it's almost 99% certain that from this point on, ANYTHING you order from Playtex baby will be in these new, ugly, red/yellow boxes with dumbed down products.  DO NOT take that chance.  I will not buy anything from them until they improve their design.  What a shame indeed.  Something that worked well for years & years & they have to ruin it.I will be returning these promptly.  Shame on Drugstore.com too for false advertising the product - sending me something that look completely different from their picture/description of the item.With all that said, however, you COULD avoid the whole leaking issue by storing them standing up in a tupperware - which I read is a good way to re-use the caps anyway for mass milk production & storage.  I tested it & I found 4-oz liners worked better - they are straight,  don't tip as easily, & they thaw faster.  So if you really like the drop in system, that might be a way to salvage it...  But still, shame on Playtex...
summary: Reason why white caps LEAK - comparison to blue caps

reviewText: I have a GREAT supply, so pumping, then pouring into these, freezing them and then storing them into freezer bags was a GENIUS idea. I filled a deep freezer within 4 months and was able to quit pumping. My husband stays at home and these are TOO easy for him to prepare. I LOVE YOU PLAYTEX
summary: BEST PRODUCT I HAVE EVER BOUGHT!

reviewText: It was HUGE!!! LOVE IT!!!!!!!!! Right now we are using it for blankets until we get our newborn his collection of toys. So happy we purchased this!

I purchased this inflatable tub for travel.  My family is constantly on the move, my four month old has already stayed in 3 hotels!  I read through other reviews before purchasing because overall it was a great item.After using it I would definitely say its a must have.ProsThe cubbies/pockets were great for holding the shampoo and wash cloth while bathing.Deflates quickly for travel.Suction on rear was great to hang dry in the hotel bathrooms.ConsThe only con I found was the difficulty level of blowing it up.  I had to pinch the valve at just the right places to get air to go in.  Once I found the right spots I blew the whole thing up easily.  There are four valves to fully inflate the tub.Some people complain that it is slippery, however I would never leave my infant or young child in a bathtub unassisted.  Personally I think that is asking for trouble!  Holding my 4 month old (he was 2 months the first time we used it) up was not difficult.  There is a backrest that I held him against rather easily.I would buy this again.

I am sooo glad I bought these swaddle blankets. Life savers. And you do need all three, because YOU WILL NEED THEM ALL THE TIME. My son is 2 months now and he is a big boy, so I bought a large size swaddle which he also loves. This is a must have.
summary: I don't know what we would do without them

reviewText: We started using this activity mat when my son was a few weeks old.  He's now 3 months and still LOVES it.  I put him on it after his first feeding in the morning and he'll play for 20+ minutes at a time.  So happy I purchased this item. We have been getting A LOT of use out of it.

Super cute play mat. I bought this item for a baby shower so I can't rate it's functionality, but it was a super cute buy!! I will definitely put this on a favorite list for my children in the future. Love it!!

These swaddles are awesome! Very lightweight for summer! My LO is a little Houdini and these keep her snug and tight, plus she loves it and sleeps so much better! As for other people's comments about the cotton shrinking....don't dry in the dryer! It's cotton and will shrink.

This product seems excellent so far; we have only had them for about a month, now.We decided to get the extra tall based on user reviews of the regular height that said the children began to climb the gates as they got older.  We have these blocking our stairs so our 15 month old daughter can't fall down them.She has figured out that the latch needs to slide in order to open the gate, but can't open it due to the safety feature of having to lift the gate slightly to open it. Make sure you position it correctly or the swing closed feature will not work properly, but when you have it correctly aligned and tightened this is a great feature for the gate and has been really helpful!We got this set with the extensions because the width of our stairwell measures 35.5" so we thought the gate with the 3.5" extension would be a perfect fit.  However, when we received the gate and set it up as such it seemed less sturdy than we had hoped because the buffer pads we extended near their full length. So we switched to the 7" extensions which was a closer fit to the opening but make for a much tighter/safer fit all around!
I have swaddled all three of my kids. The only con to these are that my son outgrew them at 1 1/2 months. He was 11 pounds and was about 23 inches long. He was too long to wear these any more.

This was the only chair that fits my baby girls chunky thighs. It's very sturdy so my twins can't tip over while on it and I love that it's cushioned (as compared to the hard plastic backing and seat with most other chairs). Was definitely great to have around when my babies were still unsteady with sitting up. Now at seven months, they're definitely stronger so we use this chair to keep them in one place while we're running errands. I also love the neutral brown color of this chair (since it was for my twin boy and girl).
My preemie is 12 mos corrected age and loves these!  The bright colors and relatively small size of the cups make these ideal for small hands.  Definitely recommend these.
I have several Boppy covers and both my daughter and I love this one the best.  The animals are really cute and my 5 month old is always smiling at them.  :)
summary: Best graphic for a Boppy cover

reviewText: This bag is great! My son is a little over 7 months. We had continued to swaddle him b/c w/o swaddle he would wake himself up every hour or so. Pedi recommended eventually tring a sleep sack. After reading numerous reviews, I decided to try this one. The 1st night he got up 1x. The 2nd night he slept 9.5hours. I was sold! Other nights he has been up 1 to 2.times each night, but he is sleeping and no longer swaddled. I think he was so used to being swaddled, sleeping w/o anything was impossible. My son is about 22lbs, almost 30inches long and the medium s perfect, plenty long.i find the sizing generous. Hope it holds up well, we r gonna need this for awhile! Super soft. Plenty wars w/ long or short sleeved onesie ynderneath for Nor Cal cool evenings. Baby boy is suEr happy sleeping unswaddled! Yippee! I had been dreading this day!
summary: Awesome! Great to transition from swaddlers

reviewText: I bought this to replace my son's infant car seat. I am extremely pleased with it. I did a lot of research on different ones online but found this one to meet all of my standards.
Great diaper bag - love the pockets and that this bag is a simple design that Dad isn't embarrassed to carry around.
summary: Simple bag for both parents to use

reviewText: We have Halo, Summer Infant & Baby Deedee. We preferred the Halo over the Summer Infant because it was nice to have a separate piece for the arms since our baby din't like having his arms swaddled after he was about 2 months old. The Halo is nice because you can swaddle their arms, keeping them warmer. However, we found the Halo to just not be warm enough. With the Baby Deedee Sleep Nest, my son's hands are FINALLY warm at night. I do dress him in a long-sleeve onsie and/or fleece pajamas on top of that before putting him in the Baby Deedee. At night our place is between 66 - 68 degrees. We try not to run the heat too much since it gets so dry.Another thing I really like about the Baby Deedee is that the arm holes are small (there are snaps, so you never have a problem putting it on). I feel it keeps my little babe warmer. The Halo arm holes are quite large (which is necessary so that you can get their arms in and out!). And, the Halo's fleece is just NOT as warm as this.I am incredibly happy with this purchase and would buy it again in a heartbeat! Don't let the price deter you -- it's worth it.
summary: Baby sleeping bag! Warmer & better than Halo & Summer Infant!

reviewText: Love this butterfly pattern- very stylish, yet still girly, and it is soft! The design is SO wonderful ! 2 way zippers mean that no matter where you are changing your child in the middle of the night, it is EASY to unzip and get to their diaper! No fumbling, trying to remember which side the zipper is on when you're 3/4 asleep still! And the zipper is covered with fabric, so no pulling on it by baby! I love that it actually covers your child's upper arms too, to help keep drafts from hitting their bodies! Only washed a couple of times, but seems to be holding up very well. This is a great baby shower present and I would recommend getting the small versus newborn, as newborns still need to be swaddled as much as possible, and I think this would be a great transitional piece from swaddling!
summary: Stylish, modern and works so well!

reviewText: I read the previous reviews on these pacifiers and bought a dozen of them.  Word of advice- don't.My son will NOT use them.  In fact, he hates them.  He only likes the MAM pacifiers.

I chose this activity/ wall fence as it doesn't resemble as 'compound'. Several of the options available look like they mean to put the baby in a camp atmosphere.This is colorful, has fun noise panel, a gate that swings open.We use the wall flat, to fit across the entertainment center and other danger zones. We just fit in around our living room bending as we needed to fit. It works great, looks like a kid area and contains the toys.Since it it flat in the area, parents can still easily come in or out, making it larger, you can have playmates inside
summary: Doesn't look like an animal corral

reviewText: I use this to store milk for when I'm not home. Not for "freezing" milk as others have done (I think it is just easier to freeze bags by laying them flat in the freezer). I like it a lot because the milk is contained in one area and its easy to find in the fridge. Yeah it can be a pain to have to shuffle the milk as you add new milk, but I don't let it upset me. Sure it only holds 12 bags of milk, but exactly how much milk should it hold? Would there ever be a # that satisfied everyone, I doubt it. Breastmilk only lasts up to 8 days in the refrigerator and with constant rotation 12 bags works just fine. Don't be discouraged by some other reviews, it works just fine as long as you're not expecting it to feed the baby for you.
I love this and my little girl dose also. Every night she knows i will turn it on for her to go to sleep with. Sometimes she wakes up and kicks the star to turn it on herself.
The bag is nice and sturdy, but could be a little more spacious for the size.  The pockets are pretty small, although we manage to stuff a bottle in two of the pockets and maybe a bib in the other.

Very roomy and buckles easy to use. Easy to assemble as I have used many Gracos before.I like the new strap guides in the back so they don't get caught or tangled. I could assemble without directions! Went with this silver color to save money but my 2 year old daughter loves it and so will her baby sister coming up. Graco is great value!

reviewText: •Roomy main compartment•Insulated pouch for snacks•Adjustable mesh bottle pocket•Padded, adjustable comfy straps•Write on nametag insideThe Zoo Pack is the little kid backpack where fun meets function. Whimsical details and durable materials make this the perfect on the go pack for kids on the go.
summary: Skip Hop Zoo Pack Little Kid Backpack

reviewText: We tried lots of things to keep our son occupied as he didn't like being put down and left alone.  We got this for him when he was only 4 and half months old.  He was pretty tall for his age, but was still way too short for this, but since his neck stability was good, we felt he was ready for it.  Since he was too short, we put a few folded up towels underneath so his feet would reach.  For the first couple weeks, he just sat and played with the toys.  He gradually figured out he could jump in it and has since been in love with it. He circles around and plays with all the toys as well as jumping like crazy.  The leg holes are a little tight, as he has pretty chunky thighs, but seems OK for now (he is now 6 months old).  Highly recommended.
These were too small, and did not fit my Bosch stove gas handles. =(  Sad I couldn't use these, but the concept is great.
summary: Did not fit my Bosch stove handles

reviewText: satisfactory, good fabric and good combo for the price the color is nice and easy to wash fulfill its function well can take advantage of good prices offered by the brand

I love the size of these burp cloths. Makes great coverage for both of my big spit up kids. Plus the more you wash them the softer they get. A must have on my baby shower list & this gender neutral print is adorable!
summary: my favorite burpcloth, great gender neutral design

reviewText: One did break eventually, but I got quite a bit of use out of them. They're the first stove knob covers that I've found to work. I also cut the backs of them a bit and use them over door knobs. They work well that way too.

This monitor works for me for the time being. My biggest complaint is the limited battery life, it only seems to last about an hour off the charger. When the battery runs out on the monitor is beeps very loudly, and is quite annoying. Recently it has started having signal issues for what seems like no reason. I will be buying a different monitor very shortly.Update- I decreased my rating to one star.... this monitor is constantly dying now, the battery life has become worse. The signal issues are now worse as well. I also failed to mention in my intial review that this monitor has a very cheap "plasticky" feel to it.
The design is very cute and the colors are great. Just a perfect size for a toddler. Lots of space for toddlers stuff
Excellent bottle caps for mixing formula! Very durable easy to clean and they already come with your purchase of the glass Lifefactory baby bottles.
summary: Excellent bottle caps for mixing formula!

reviewText: I want to say that I love this stroller.  There are many things that I consider perfect about it.  However, as others have mentioned, it is tippy.  My 25 lb daughter simply laid back when it was fully reclined and it tipped over backwards.  I was right next to it, purchasing something at an outdoor swap meet/flea market.  We were on asphalt, but thankfully she wasn't injured.  Everyone around us was concerned.That is the major drawback, in my opinion.  You have to make sure you're holding onto it or standing directly behind it.  I love the huge canopy, the full recline, the padded seats, the U-shaped bar for easy access to storage, the way it turns on a dime, the one hand lock, ease of fold... but if you're not super careful it does pose a danger to your child.
summary: I really want to love this, but it can be very tippy

reviewText: Never had any problems.  Highly recommend this for cloth diapering since it helps gets your diapers cleaner before going in the wash.  Very high powered spray, but adjustable to your needs.

Purchased this rocker to keep in our playroom- I really like it to use when my baby is awake and wanting to interact.  I would say the incline of the seat is not really conducive to sleep as some of the other seats are, but this one is perfect for when he is awake.  I also love the fact that you can switch it to a toddler seat.  With so much of the baby equipment off limits to my toddler, he really appreciates that he can sit in this one too!
i needed something to put my keys and a cup holder while toting my gran-babies around in my city mini double stroller .  it fit well and seems durable. so far I am happy with it.
summary: works great on city mini double stroller

reviewText: we had the summer infant for a year with our son and decided to upgrade before we had our baby girl. we chose the motorola 3.5 inch screen. we absolutely love it. what a brilliant product. wouldn't go back to another monitor and couldn't live with out this baby item.

This was the perfect size the hold 1 bottle and some cold packs but it didn't last long. Just after a few months the inside foil-like liner started ripping. It's pretty cheap material inside and doesn't look very durable. The outside is plastic and wipes clean well.

We use the GroVia Hybrid diapering system and love it!  I have almost nothing poor to say about Grovia...except maybe about these bags.  They are the only GroVia item I have not been perfectly happy with.  I'm not even sure what it was about them that they just didn't live up to what I was expecting.  They were very small and I wasn't sure I would trust the draw string to dirty diapers.  I have ended up with Plant Wise bags instead.  A couple different small sizes for the diaper bag and two large ones with elastic for the diaper bins.  --  I still love GroVia just not this product.

reviewText: We just got this for our daughter's second birthday and it is a prefect fit. For me, the little details make it worth it.  And my daughter loves it too!

reviewText: Used on our gas stove. So far they are toddler proof! They look good too and not to bothersome to use.

Bought this because it had better reviews than other changing pads and I was not dissapointed. I didn't think it had a strange odor like some others did, so I was pleased with that. The material used to cover it does sound a little trash-baggish because of the waterproofing, but the cover I bought for it covers the sound too. The only thing I wasn't excited about was that the pad covering was bent at one time or another, and will not lie flat & contoured like the picture. I'm sure it will work itself out once I put a baby on it every day, but it's not something I was expecting in a brand new pad. It looks like baby has plenty of room to grow with it also.
I really love it! beautifull product, great materials and children fall in loe with it!christmas present! My Baby son love it

I actually orderd the blue and brown ties but was shipped these instead. I like these and didn't wanna deal with the headache of a return, so I used them and I love them! They aren't that hard to peel off like everyone says. You do have to cut them out yourself but it's not like that's a hard thing to do. They stick great and I love being able to snap a picture of my baby every month to mark his monthly birthday.

reviewText: Love it, love it, love it!  Easy to clean, easy to fold up, easy to use period.  The small size is perfect, and I love simple.  I can also take the tray off and sit my son right at the kitchen table.  The price was right.  I found older ones that were similar and used for the same price - or more!VERY highly recommended!
this is a cute potty for training, i love how it converts into a set stool then my kids can push it up to sink to wash hands, i highly recommend

So I like this product overall but I do have one problem with it and its kind of a big one. If you forget to hang it up to dry after bath time... IT SMELLS! It has only happened a couple times but now I feel like the dirty smell came from mildew settling into the bath stuffing and so it must be ruined inside, i just cant see it.... Threw it away and went with a blow up bath I can see, clean, and sanitize.

reviewText: liners are perfect for both young and older children. we worried they would be too tough and rough on our young sons bottom but they are not and they hold up to our 2 1/2 year olds "movements"
summary: great liners! will buy over and over again

reviewText: Bought this for our Graco Pack n Play and it fits perfectly. The material is very soft and comfortable, and so far it's washing well (washed it probably 3 times already). I'm back to order another one! Great price, great product.

Bought this unit because of the safety reviews. We love the fit in the car, however make no mistake, the parts that click into the seat, leave a lot to be desired. Instead of a buckle, they are just metal hooks, which can be a royal pain to remove. I recommend this to the parents that will be installing it in the car, and not taking it out and playing the car seat swap game every day.

I am a first time Mom to a colic (due to silent reflux) 2 month baby boy.  As a first time mom I was hesitant to purchase this because it wasn't like all the other fancy "bassinets" out there but I absolutely love this sleeper. I especially like how it is inclined which I feel is not only much safer as apposed to baby laying flat on their back in the middle of the night but also great for babies digestive system with even with out reflux problems. My little guys still likes to be swaddled at night & sleeps safe & snugly in this Sleeper. I only use it as a 'night time' sleeper so he doesn't get confused, at 2 months he sleeps a 6 hour stretch, eats, & rite back to sleep for another 4 hours. He is still very small (premature) I still don't need to use the straps yet & put a folded receiving blanket down so he's not sitting on the buckle (absolutely no way any newborn could get them self out). No flat head. The cover comes off & is machine washable. Great price! Great product, would recommend to any new mother! Best thing we purchased as new parents before he was here!

I'm one of those parents who don't want my child bombarded with too many synthetic and obnoxious toys. This one however is so great. I always set the music to the lowest volume (there's two levels) and would set the center part to rotate instead of lights flashing to enhance my baby's motor skills of trying to reach out for objects. These days, passive learning is changing the way our kids' brains develop that as a parent you have to conscious as to how your child will interact or if they'll interact with a toy instead of just laying there hypnotized by its sounds, lights, and visuals. The rattle/hanging pieces are fun and encouraging for my baby to reach out and the elephant cushion is so useful for tummy time or for her to just reach out and grab its ears. The mirror was especially fun. I'd put her on her tummy and hang the mirror in front of her and look at her through it and make funny faces at her from behind her. She got such a kick out of it. And yes, from time to time when I needed downtime especially at the beginning of my baby's life I'd let her lay under there for 10 minutes and just sit next to her and send a few text messages to friends or comments on Facebook. This is a must have because it's simple, effective, engaging, and interactive.

My wife and I received the Motorola MBP36 Baby Monitor as a shower gift before our son was born and have been using it for almost four months. In that time this baby monitor has become an indispensable part of our lives and daily routine. By and large this is an excellent baby monitor though there are some shortcomings and curious design choices that hamper the device.--------------------LCD & Camera:The baby monitor consists of two major components, the LCD screen and the camera. In our nursery I wall mounted the camera using an appropriately sized screw directly into a wall stud above our child's crib and within easy access to a power outlet. The AC power cord is long, approximately 3m, and is needed to power the camera. Unlike the LCD screen the camera contains no internal battery and thus cannot be used without the AC power adapter. The camera features a built-in wall mount bracket for just such applications.The LCD screen is the other primary component and features a fantastic 3.5" color LCD screen. To the left of the LCD are the four directional buttons that control the camera's movements. To the right of the screen are four more buttons that control (top-down) menu access; "OK" aka "enter"; display on/off toggle; and microphone. The menu access button brings up the on-screen menu and the directional buttons provide navigation with the "OK" button serving as the 'enter' key. On-screen commands control everything from volume adjustment to lullaby's that you can choose to play via the camera's on-board speaker. The power button is located along the top-left of the base unit.--------------------Installation:Thanks to the base unit and camera communicating via 2.4GHz wireless setup is extremely easy. The most difficult portion of our installation was finding suitable placement for the camera. Because of our nursery design we didn't have a shelf that afforded a good enough vantage of our crib and ultimately decided that wall mounting was the best option. In this configuration the AC power adapter and cord are hidden behind our child's crib so that is a bonus as well. The initial pairing of the camera and base unit is guided and extremely easy and very quick.--------------------Use:Powering on the base unit also turns the camera on and is impressively fast. I'd estimate that from a powered-off state to a completely operational state takes less than two seconds. After that you're set and ready to adjust the camera, volume, etc. as needed. Range is as impressive as Motorola claims. I was dubious about the range before using this baby monitor but I can attest that it lives up to and surpasses my expectations. In my home (single-story + basement) my entire home is completely covered. Video and audio is high quality and without any distortion. I've even used this unit on our patio, in our yard and immediate surrounding area of our home with the baby monitor in my pocket and the video feed is great. The unit does alert you when you're taking it too far out of range.The camera video feed quality is very good as well. Being first time parents we were initially very nervous about every little noise and movement from our baby and constantly monitoring him for any potential problems. That said, the quality of the video feed is enough that you can see a baby's chest rise and fall with their breathing. Audio is equally impressive and picks up on very minute noises. Funny as it might be but we can hear our little boy's burps and flatulence through the monitor. I suspect that this is in part to the proximity of the camera unit to our son and crib. I'm not sure if this unit would pick up those noises if the camera was mounted further away.--------------------What I like about this baby monitor:(+) Very easy setup and operation.(+) Unit powers on and is usable almost instantaneously.(+) Great quality video and audio to include the night vision mode.(+) Construction quality seems adequate given the price point.(+) Expandable with more cameras for folks with more than one baby. Scanning mode to automatically switch between cameras.(+) Attractive design.--------------------What I don't like about this baby monitor:(-) The power button is tiny and sits flush with the top of the unit. This may be a conscious design decision to make the unit harder to accidentally turn off for tired parents.(-) The volume controls require entering the menu to adjust. It is the very first option on the on-screen menu but it's still a paint to adjust in a dark room.(-) The microphone button (allows you to talk through the cameras speaker) is located directly below the video on/off toggle and is in a horrible place! It's very easy to inadvertently hit the microphone button in a dark room or when sleepy instead of the video button if you're just trying to check on your baby.(-) If I had been paying the bill I probably would go with a cheaper baby monitor. This is a very nice monitor but expensive.(-) The zoom function is very limited and only goes to 2x. Again not a huge issue for our application but worth noting.--------------------Technical issues:Only once, but the base unit after being on all day failed to power on (was connected to the charger). Letting the base unit sit unplugged for an hour and then trying to power on again solved the issue. Seemed like it was an overheating issue. Again only happened once but something worth mentioning.--------------------Closing:If you can stomach the price and some odd button placement then this is a very nice baby monitor. Some of the features seem like add-on gimmicks (playing lullaby's for instance) rather than practical options for a baby monitor. Recommended.
summary: Excellent in Many Ways; A Few Shortcomings

reviewText: We have two of these baskets and I don't know how I lived without them for so long. With twin baby girls, washing bottles by hand was incredibly time consuming. I was skeptical of how well the bottle parts would be cleaned, especially because we use Dr. Brown's, but I have had no concerns whatsoever since I started using these baskets. We go through eight bottles a day, and two baskets leaves plenty of room for all parts plus extras like pacifiers. The baskets have held up in the wash like champs-even after daily use for over 7 months. Munchkin makes great products, and this one did not disappoint.

I don't get all the good reviews of this product. I really don't like it. It's too big to fit comfortably in my standard size sink,and doesn't keep babies head inclined and out of the water in the tub.  It does seem comfy for baby,but she does easily get cold in it. There is n o way for baby to stay submerged in some water to stay warm. I much prefer the first years safety tub. There is a reason it's design has been around for years! It just works!
this is extremely soft, just as stated it is velour.  will be perfect for warmth in the winter for baby!

My daughter loved this swing! she just recently grew out of it a 9 months but up until then it was a life saver when she was cranky and didn't want to nap. this swing would put her to sleep in minutes, and the tray with toys was a great addition to it when she was willing to just sit there and play
So far, these bottle have never leaked. Plus they don't easily tip over. We have tried a lot of bottles and are most happy with these. We have the small and large size.
This is a very helpful accessory for my stroller. I have two as I feel two hold my shopping bags more steadily.

I love this fabric and am crazy about the pattern and colors, however be super careful because the fabric is so delicate that if it comes into contact in the washer with velcro from a bib or a jacket, it will tear into it!

Looks and feels safe.  I got this for our second car, our other one has the Britax Advocate.  We have extra seat covers and it is great because the covers fit both models. No need to purchase extra for each.
This cover was exactly how I expected it would be -- cute! It washed well, and fits the Mombo as it should.

I have had a rediculous time trying to put my 6 month old to sleep. He doesnt ever want to nap. Until I bought this. It plays such calming music, and is such a great mobile that he's now out after 5 mins. I like that it comes with a remote too. Then if he is still awake and the mobile turns off I can click it on from afar and he wont see me. Such a great purchase!!

The nipple shape on this bottle is sooo different from all other bottles out there. I have tried so many bottles with my baby girl. Tommee Tippee, Playtex Ventiair and drop ins, Prince Lionheart, Born free, Breastflow, como tomo, dr. browns wideneck and non wide neck, medela, avent, Similac's new bottle, as well as many other bottles. NONE of those worked until we found this one. I am so glad I did, I just wish I had found it when my now 2 year old was an infant, as she too was a picky breastfed baby who NEVER did end up taking a bottle.
summary: Only bottle my breastfed baby will take!

reviewText: My son enjoys the flashing lights and as he gets older I think he'll enjoy the other sound mode where you can add in and remove certain instrument sections of the music.  he has figured out at 14 weeks to push the buttons and start the music.
My 16 month old daughter loves to dance to this and has for months, the classical music isn't annoying. Enough said.

We have been using a spinning bottle rack and a dish towel or two to dry bottles & parts for the past 5 months.  The spinning rack was always full so we oveflowed everything onto dish towels to dry.  I was tired of the dishtowels which inevitably would catch crumbs from around the kitchen.We just got a Boon Grass countertop rack last week and it's awesome!  It's great for the Dr. Brown's bottles and also great for odd-shaped or small items like spoons, baby gum brush, boon spoon, etc.  It is a little small, so we ended up going and getting a 2nd grass drying rack.  Definitely easy to use, easy to clean and allows the bottles and parts to dry without a mess.
Fits all tables that I have tried it on. My LO isn't sitting up unassisted yet, but this chair works wonderfully! I am purchasing a second one for travel!
This is perfect. I bought it for a baby who wouldn't sleep in his crib. Don't know if it's helped him sleep, but it is soft and fits the crib matress perfectly with a waterproof pad underneath.

This was in the hospital nursery when my grandson was there.  Calling this a soother is right on. The music selections are musical with a choice of loudness.  The tunes are nursery rhymes to classical. The projection element was just right to sooth a baby

They're medium flow nipples.  I had the five ounce bottles and liked them.  I am nervous about using plastic for baby bottles, but am hopeful that these are okay since they're made by a German company.  Not many options if you have to use bottles--the glass ones were too heavy.
Love the look. It's very comfy and cushioned compared to most car seats. Reinforced frame is what sold this to me.

This wasn't exactly what I was hoping for but it's still soft and has washed well so far with no pilling. Our boy was really obsessed with our throw blankets so we got this for him to have that softness in his crib.

I got these to bottle feed by normally breastfed 2 month old while I am at work.  I was previously using Dr. Brown's #1 nipples.  The flow from these nipples is too fast.  My baby kept gasping from too much milk.  It is also a little annoying that they have a wide mouth because you can't interchange the tops with the other bottles.  I think I'll stick with what I already have.
When we tried to put this under our gate it came up to high and you couldn't open the gate with it in place.

This bath pad is perfect for bathing a newborn. It dries easily and is convenient to store (there's a hook for you to hang the bath pad). It is thick and soft and feels comfy. I did put this in the washing machine, which I shouldn't have because after that one time machine wash, it started showing wear as if the bath pad has been used for a long time.

I just used this bather for the first time last night and I must say that I love it!!  My now 4 month old daughter has just outgrown her infant tub, and since she doesn't have her own bathroom yet, I wanted to get something that was easy to store.  This was our answer!  I just fill the tub of with warm water and let it lay in it, in order for it to absorb the water, while I undress her.  I lay her in it and wala, she doesn't move!!!  She can still splash her feet which is great!  After bathtime, just wring and hang on the shower rod.  How easy is that?!  Of course, since I've only used it once I haven't had any problems with mold, but I plan on washing it everyweek, so I hope that helps.  If it becomes a problem, I will update this review!Update:Well I have been using this product for about two months now and it DOES have mildew! EW!! (Reduced to 3 stars) It is not stink however, but the mildew is very obvious! I have washed it weekly and dried it after every bath but still mildew! I do think that it was fine for the transitional period, but my now 6.5 month old daughter will be using an inflatable tub and this will be tossed!

Very nice purchase but we preferred "infant car seat" when baby is less than 2-3 months old.Hospital staff did not even knew about "Convertible Car Seat"....Have to buy new infant car seat from store at the day of delivery..(not have too...but we did as we also though infant car seat will be better).After 2/3 months now we use this though. Very comfy expect the buckle at the bottom center is not soft enough on strap.....
summary: Very good purchase but prefer infant seat for baby < 2 months

reviewText: I purchased this used so not sure if maybe that's why it didn't come with the temperature strip but otherwise this is a great tub. I think it's better than the First Year's version that has a two-seat setup. I prefer this one because we can lean baby back or have her sit up but not feel confined. Our girl is a bit feisty and wants to do what she wants to do so it helps her to feel like she's choosing to sit up.It's a challenge now at 7 months to get her to lean back in the tub at all. But before she was sitting on her own the reclining position with the wedge in place worked really well. There was only once or twice that she kind of arched her back and ended up "floating" on top of the wedge, which she didn't like and I could see being dangerous. (minus 1 star) If she hadn't been able to reach the other end with her feet she could have easily slid under the water. But that's why you can't leave them alone for a second in the water.Now that she sits up she wants to stay sitting up. We had left the wedge in and were still using the reclining side with her legs over the wedge although she sat forward. The wedge kept her from moving around too much but then she learned how to use the wedge while grabbing the opposite side of the tub to leverage herself into a bent over and/or standing position. Fun to watch her stand up but not fun to wrangle a slippery baby while she's trying to stand up (and MUST. STAND. UP.). So we removed the wedge and now she can sit in the tub with plenty of room to splash and move a bit without having anything to help her get out.And that's what's nice about the tub, it can be modified to create a variety of environments for baby's bath time. I also appreciate the hook to hang it up to dry. We have an extra shower rod in the middle of the shower so we hang it on that when we're not using the tub. You just have to go knock out the bit of water that doesn't slide all the way out so that it will dry.  So far (4 months), despite a bathroom that's a mold/mildew magnet, we haven't had any problems with the stopper getting mildewy and it holds the water - no leaks.(Although we have the sling I got the tub when baby girl was already too big to use it so can't comment on it.)Update 5/20/14:We're still using this tub and our girl is now 18 months old. She's comfortable in it and it uses less water than if we were using the entire bathtub for her. We did put the wedge back in though because without it there were times that she slipped despite being sitting down. She's fine with the wedge and will now sometimes lean back so her toes are under the water from the faucet and wait for us to pour water on her - the wedge keeps her from sliding all the way down. It's like a spa for her. We also still have no issues with leaks or mold/mildew.
summary: Great for a variety of bathing baby stages

reviewText: I agree with the reviewer to gave 2 stars. It was a little difficult to pour our all the powder at once. My nanny has bad eyes and she couldn't see there was powder caught around the hole. I have to pour several time to get the formula powder out. Not the best dispenser but it is a nice to have it in the diaper bag.
summary: nice to have it in the diaper bag

reviewText: Sturdy construction. Enough give for tiny hands to grasp hold. Brightly colored. Definitely a good product for babies to play with. One jingles with a little bell, which seems to make it the favorite.

My little guy was never happy out of my arms until we got this swing. He naps in here during the day so I can finally have a shower!!! The plug in is a must, batteries are expensive! The rain sound is more present then his rain maker we use in his room at nighttime when he sleeps in his crib. I do wish the rain wouldn't time out after 15 min though. That's the only down side.

I don't know what I'd do without this swing! My daughter absolutely loves it and so do I. Be aware, it is quite large and takes up a good chunk of space in the living room. The swing says it features 3 positions but really it's just 2 -- front to back swinging and side to side swinging. There are 6 speed settings and 4 song options as well as a cute bird mobile. I noticed that the swing has slowed down quite a bit since she first started using it. Level 1 speed used to be fast but now we have to go up to Level 4 speed just to get it moving. I have a feeling the swing is starting to die so now we give it a little push when we turn it on to get the swing moving.Pros:Battery or wall plug inMobile with mirror4 Sound Settings and 6 SpeedsCan swing side to side or front to backComfortable, padded seatCons:Slows down over timeTakes up a lot of spaceSeat is supposed to fit up to 25lbs but is already getting tight for my 8 week old
summary: Great swing but it slows down over time

reviewText: You can buy 5 spoons for $4 from another brand and think you are clever and smart for not paying more money for these Beaba spoons OR you can remind yourself that those other plastic spoons, while they may be BPA free, aren't one solid piece of construction. And what happens when multiple pieces are molded together after hundreds of dishwasher abuse and doubling as a teething toy? yeah, it splits apart. and guess what ends up in those cracks? Germs. Mold. Bacteria. Yuck. Not worth it.These Beaba spoons are one piece of silicone. They don't get plastic "splinters" and they don't separate. These are worth the money. Save yourself the trouble and get these spoons for your wee ones. They will last longer than the other brand(cough cough Munchkin cough).

This bumper fits my Oeuf crib perfectly. Its is crazy soft - the type of soft you think of when you think of baby things. The white is really bright, brighter than my sheets and crib. I think (and I may be projecting) that it keeps my baby more comfortable, like in a little nest. Changing the crib sheets was WAY more of a chore with these on (and untying all the bumper ties to change the sheets with a 15 month old running around is not feasible) so between that and the fact that I don't love the look of all the ties, I gave this 4 stars. But that is just knit picking a little - overall this is a great bumper.
I ordered this for my sons crib to match everything else in his nursery. It is SO soft and Just what I wanted!! I love it and would order again!

These little brushes are fantastic! We used them for the Dr. Brown's bottles and then kept on using them for sippy cups and especially the straws for straw cups. They fit inside perfectly and clean out all the gunk in case you forget to rinse them immediately. They hold up pretty well, too. We have only just started using  a second one and the first one lasted for at least 8 months. We always propped it up with the cleaning part at the top in a little cup so it would dry completely, and we washed it regularly with soap and water. I think these are a little smaller than some of the other cleaning brushes, so you do need them for the Dr. Brown bottles (The bottles come with a couple, so don't buy these until you need more).

This is one of the best purchases we have made.  I can't imagine having to take the whole sheet out of the crib everytime we change it, which is every week.  This is super, super easy.  Not to be mean, but the people who struggled with this must have a problem with all zippers.  I can't imagine life without this product!!  And the color (yellow gingham) is pretty too.
summary: Don't know why anyone is not using this!!!

reviewText: I've tried several straw cups for my 1 year old and most of them have had some leaking problems but this one has been good.  No leaks.  It's also very durable and has survived numerous throw downs with my son.That being said, I can't say I love it because of a few issues.  Its supposed to pop back up if it's laid on it's side.  It doesn't always tilt upright automatically.  Something to consider, it doesn't fit in cup holders or in most diaper bag's small pockets designed to hold bottles.  It's plastic and it's made in China.  Not much choice in getting a non-plastic straw cup for your toddler.  I've searched everywhere.  But the fact that it's made in China makes me nervous.  I know it's supposed to be BPA-free, etc... but I still question anything that's made in a country that condones toxic chemicals to be allowed in baby formula and pet food!But until they make a break-proof glass that can survive 2 story falls or a company that manufactures plastics in the good ole USA or at least in Europe, there is no other choice. Wouldn't it be great to see Amazon have a section for items that are manufactured in the U.S.?
summary: Doesn't leak but there are other issues

reviewText: These use to be sold in packs of 3, which made much more sense because the bottles are sold in packs of 3. Product is good, just wish they would go back to the way they use to be packaged.
summary: Why don't these come in 3 packs?

reviewText: These are great.  We've been using them for 4 years to clean out Dr. Brown bottle pieces as well as any other cup that has a straw.
summary: These are great. We've been using them for 4 years to ...

reviewText: I highly recommend this product for a kid that hates wearing a bib..my son (11 months) couldn't take it off like all the other tens of bibs we tried and he actually treats it as of it's t-shirt or sth :D
Cute. Wasn't the material I was expecting it to be. It's more fabric ish than plastic, so I'm not too sure how waterproof it really is but it serves its purpose at preK I guess!
Bought this quilted padded fitted sheet for my new grandbaby when she comes to visit. Fits perfectly on the Playard I previously purchased. Very pleased with these items.
summary: review of Graco Square Playard sheet white quilted

reviewText: We purchased this mobile after seeing all the rave reviews on Amazon. Unfortunately, I guess we're in the minority. When the mobile arrived the music worked but the motor did not. We had to take it apart and fix it before we could get it to turn. Then, one of the leaves wouldn't work correctly (it stayed stuck in the up position unless you manually tapped on it). I also agree with other reviews about the music being a little too quiet. It's too bad because our daughter did seem to enjoy watching it turn. Anyway, this was a return item for us.
My 3 month old loved these and got way less frustrated while eating with these. He did have to go up to level 3 when he was 5 months old though.
My 3-yr old loves his new alligator travel pillow! Can't wait to put it to the real test this upcoming 4-day weekend!

These clamps enabled us to put a gate at the top of our staircase, which has a pedestal on BOTH sides.  I was very skeptical about this product, but I was desperate to find something for our stairs after my husband's research yielded nothing that looked good.  The reviews on this were pretty good and I felt the price was not a rip-off like a couple of other products I'd seen, so I took a chance, and I'm so glad I did.  I followed the instructions in the PDF file and ordered 3 round clamps and 1 square, and it worked out great.  We purchased a cardinal gate once we were able to install all 4 clamps.  I'm so relieved I have a top-of-the-stairs gate!

We have 3 because they work well and the price is right.  I have to say that better, easier to use products do exist.  One handed operation is a stretch.  Yes, you can, but you have to learn the trick.  That said, ours have held up well (one even spent 2 months in the elements and never looked worse for it).  The fact that I have ordered the same product each time we've needed a new one should tell you that I like the product, even if it isn't the easiest one on the planet.
summary: Price is good but better products exist

reviewText: I babysit my 16 month old grandson and wanted something to protect him from the stairs to our basement/familyroom. This is a great gate and very attractive as well. Now he can play without danger of falling.

I love this bumper because it is sturdy AND soft, without being too "pillowy" and posing a huge suffocation hazard like some other fluffy bumpers do. The color pink is so perfect for a shabby chic look. It is very pretty. My favorite part about this bumper is the little textured dots on the inside of the bumper. They are adorable and I'm sure baby will love to touch and feel them.A side note: some other reviews on this item say that it doesn't fit the crib right because the ties are too short. I have to strongly disagree and tell those people to TURN IT AROUND. If your ties are "too short" then you have it facing the wrong direction--it almost happened to me until I realized my mistake. The bumper ties should be facing the outside of the crib. The textured dots will be on the inside of the crib. I had no problems whatsoever, in fact I found that this bumper fit better than many other bumpers I tried from Target.

We also have the Stella model from Levana, and we like both units, though obviously the Stella has a lot more features for almost twice the cost.This Sophia model has a stationary camera, so it's more appropriate for a cribbed baby monitor.  That's about as much viewing area you'll have in a small room where you can have the camera 6-8 feet away.  If you have a toddler you may want one of the models with a camera that's controllable from the remote.The Sophia camera CAN be mounted, there are screw slides on the base.The remote viewing screen has very excellent resolution, impressively so.  It's almost clearer than the screen on the Stella which is 4x as large.You can talk to the baby through the monitor, however, I dislike the quality of the speaker on the camera (this is also true of the Stella) as my voice comes out as invisible booming scary monster on the other end, no matter how soft and sweet I try to inflect it.  My voice coming out of my wife's cheap cell speakerphone is leagues better, i don't really get it.Range is great, house is very long and there are no reception issues, even out to the mailbox.

I took the booster seat out of the box & put the strap over my should & the strap broke loose from the base. Looks like the thread used to seal the strap into the base broke free. I had to redo the strap & secure it.Poor quality to have it break 5 mins out of the box.

This swing is neat - watch the video because it swings very differently than a typical swing. My son seems to like it ok - he's 3 months old now and uses it a few times a week. I do wish it reclined a bit more flat for when he's snoozing.

They almost got the design right on this one.  The mouthpiece is too soft.  I need to be able to bite down a little to hold it in place and it collapses as soon as I do.This has the best shaped tip of all the aspirators of any kind, including bulb syringe, battery powered.  It doesn't go up in the nose hardly all and this is perfect.  It just forms a seal against the nose so you can suck it out.Using a tissue for a filter is clever, and makes it easy to find replacements.If you use the mouthpiece from the NasaKleen aspirator with this one you have a really good snotsucker.
summary: has the best tip for the nose

reviewText: Nice, I like how I can write on them with a dry erase marker.  However, they don't work too well on my gerber bottles. I put a piece of Saran wrap on before the cap and that solves the problem.
summary: Nice - don't work too well on Gerber

reviewText: My grandson loves these. They are learning blocks and each block does something different. Some have rattles in them and some crinkle, some have tags, etc. He loves them.

It's well made, looks great, still looks new after all the washes. I'm not a hook-n-loop fan, I prefer snaps, but this style doesn't ever roll in at the top and scratch baby. If you prefer this over snaps, I recommend it! Well made all over, at the legs and waist especially.
My baby had a lot of trouble getting anything out of the cup. I ended up breaking a small piece off just so she could drink out of it. I sure does no leak.

I love the Moby wrap hard. My baby loves the Moby wrap hard.We live in New York City, and it's so easy to just pop her in the wrap and take her for a walk, or to the doctor. Yes, it's tough to get her into the sling when she's fussing, but if she's calm, she goes in like a dream and is out like a light within minutes. She loves how cozy it makes her.It takes a few tries to get used to how it works, but once you understand the physics of it, it's really a terrific tool.
summary: Carry your baby and keep your hands free!

reviewText: A friend recommended a wipe warmer after he got one for his 4th child.  Since the Especially For Baby one seemed a reasonable price, we experimented with it.  Unfortunately, it doesn't work well with either of the wipes we tried - Pampers or Huggies.  And the extra storage just didn't provide much "storage".  So we've taken it back and our daughter doesn't seem to mind the room temperature wipes that clean her cute tushie.

Worked great on our old historic house's narrow staircase with our young son (up to 11 months).Our new house has wider staircases (making it less secure) and our now 14 month old is much stronger. We used to let him bang on the gate, but now it seems much less secure. It's hard to teach him this new rule, especially because he likes the noise it makes.
summary: Works great in narrow spaces with young children.

reviewText: If you are debating if you should get one or not, just get it! Here's why:1. Good quality2. Very cute3. Excellent coverage4. Doubles as a burp cloths5. Great bibs for when your child starts teething and they become drool monsters6. Also great for when your baby starts eating purees7. Gives you peace of mind if you have to take your little one out shortly after you feed them. Since it covers their  entire shoulders and chest, you don't have change their clothes 10 times a day!8. This is the best option out there so farI only gave it 4 starts because after 7 months of use and washing, the fabric on top of the trim is ripping. It's not a big deal, just a little disappointing. I bought a different kind of bib for when my son starts finger foods since those have a pocket at the bottom to catch the finger foods. Overall, you get a lot of use out of these and they are super cute!

We love this stroller. We purchased this when our newborn arrived, so that we could have our 2 yr old ride along with the baby.PROS:High quality construction (extremely durable)Tray and shade are easy to install/remove (but don't fall off unintentionally)Light WeightEasy to SteerSmooth Rideworks great for the standing and baby seat configurationEasy to fold and stowCONS:The space for the sitting child (when also carrying a car seat) is limited. It is very doable to have the larger child sit, but not for long periods, as there isn't much space.When stowing in a car, and having the baby seat extension/holder installed, the product is very long (understandably) so you may have to remove the extension to fit into your vehicle. this is not a hassle, just one extra step.
I find it very useful when I have to take milk or liquid with me that I don't need right away. Fits gerber bottles too.

First off, if you are considering this baby bath be aware of the dimensions (26.8 x 19.9 x 7.5 inches). I didn't pay attention before ordering and if didn't have a large enough counter area in my bathroom I would have been disappointed.  I mention the size because it won't fit inside a sink so keep that in mind.The newborn sling attaches easily and securely to the sides of the tub.  I would prefer a bit more room on the sides of the sling to reach the water below but it works fine as is.  As I mentioned, I use this on my long countertop in my bathroom but I find that it is more convenient to also use the faucet sprayer I found here at AmazonHomz Shampoo Spray.  When my Grandson outgrows the sling I will just put the Sassy Tub in my regular tub and attach a tub sprayer like this onePlumb Craft 7653700B Versa-Bath Spray.The plug drain is convenient but while I am using the tub on the counter it is easier (and faster) to just dump the water directly into the sink to empty.The included toys are a nice bonus!  I also love that it has the tray to hold the baby wash products.I really like that I can use this product now through toddlerhood.  And I figure after my grandson grows out of it completely I can always use it to wash my little dogs in the backyard.  :)I give this product 4 stars but would have given it 5 if there had been little suction cup feet on the bottom to make it more secure to a countertop.  I understand that the water and the weight of the baby should keep the tub steady but as a Grandma I am just more of a Cautious Connie.
summary: Larger than I thought but a Nice Value

reviewText: My husband says that the day our baby outgrows this swing it will be doomsday. Thats says it all!The max. Weight is 25 lbs so we still have some months of swing love :)I set it up all by myself one morning in my 39th week of pregnancy. I still found it easy, it was hard for me to be in that bent position, but it was ok.I love how cute and comfy it looks. And my baby loves it immensely :) whenever he is fussy, we put him there, strap him up, start the motion, start the lullaby or nature sounds, and most times the baby is already happy by the time we start the mobile :) if not, when the birds catch his eye, it is like hypnosis, he looks at them peacefully for minutes and minutes, some times not even falling asleep, just being happy.I had read the complaints about the feet being to wide apart and you trip over it, so I was aware and only tripped a couple if times, but my mom tripped the first time she passed by the swing with the baby and warned us. We still trip from time to time (you may think it is silly, but if it has been rotated or moved some inches without you noticing, chances are you will trip). That being said, i have never felt close to falling, and i understand that a swing that moves so much and can hold so much weight must have a big base... Just be real careful!! Because it is tooootally worth it!!
summary: The best baby thing we have

reviewText: We extend the time to rear face our kids and the Diona RadianRXT gives us the best/safest option to do that with. It's a plus that my kids love it (my son picked this color out himself) and find it comfortable. It was easy to install (I used LATCH... and am quite pregnant FWIW. I just needed my husband to heft it into the car since it's quite a heavy seat.) I  love that it's not super wide and taking up a lot of room that way. We bought the Diono Radian Angle Adjuster to go along with it and that truly helps save room for the seat in front of the carseat.Overall, highly recommend! We now own 3. :)
summary: Just about everything we need/want in a car seat.

reviewText: This is the second time I bought this product, from this company, and both products stop working. The timers are off on the different sounds. I do not recommend this product.

I just received two of these sheets in blue as a shower gift.  I threw both in the wash on cold and dried them on low and they shrunk considerably.  They still fit the mattress but barely, and I really had to fight with them.  I can see one end coming off as soon as I lay a baby in the crib....not a good thing.  In my opinion, crib sheets should be pre-shrunk and highly washable.  What new parent has time to give special attention to washing sheets?  It's a shame because they are very soft and appear to be well made.  Time will tell if they will continue to shrink, especially if I ever need to wash them in hot water because of a diaper mess.  I will not be asking for/buying any more of these.
summary: Very soft but shrinks a ton

reviewText: I bought this for the baby to grow with because the head rest for 0-4 months and the other things for when baby is older.

I am still waiting for the product to arrive (I made an order on Amazon months ago). However, I have gotten one previously as a part of a Green Sprouts set and found it to be VERY useful. You can connect it to any water bottle and feed the baby. So I don't always have to bring a separate sippy cup. It's also very small, so very portable and easy to take on trips.
These caps fit medela bottles but are significantly cheaper than the medela replacement parts. A great buy if you have medela kits.

I was so looking forward to getting this pillow and enjoying a better night's sleep. Well I did not get that with this pillow. It is way too over-stuffed and stiff to be comfortable and the cover is itchy. I prefer more than less when it comes to pillows but this one is just ridiculous how big it is. It's hard to climb out of it for frequent nightly trips to the bathroom. The first night I got a terrible pain in my neck and ended up throwing it off the bed. I tried it again last night and after struggling to find a comfy position where my neck wasn't at some weird angle, I threw it off the bed again. Also, it is too short for my long legs; I am 5'9. My lower legs and feet hang awkwardly off the end of the pillow. The back support felt nice but the pillow bulge in my belly was not comfy. I felt like my baby was getting smooshed as my belly does not exactly sit on top of the pillow bulge so maybe I am not big enough for it at 19 weeks. I will stick to my body pillow for now and pass this pillow along to my 6'4 230lbs husband to use hoping it will keep his head elevated so he will snore less. And maybe his big body can flatten it some for me so I can try it again in the future when baby is bigger.Update- I am now 32 weeks and the pillow still sucks. After it just sat in a spare bedroom for months I decided to give it another try because my belly is definitely much bigger. The belly support is a little stiff, not very giving so it doesn't cradle my belly like my softer body pillow. And the pillow is still not comfortable for my neck (no surprise) and I have shoulders a bit broader than most women. The thing is just too big and stuffed to be comfortable unless maybe you are an 'amazon' woman. Save your money and buy a cheaper one with a softer review.

Usually with these "organic" sheets and mattress pads, they are much stiffer than the others.  This one was surprisingly soft - both the sheet and the topper.  As others have noted, it is manufactured in China - sometimes that can be of concern - but it seems to be good quality.  Not sure if it's truly 100% organic, but so few things actually are.

I received a pair of these as a gift and ordered several more sets after seeing how useful they are. The size is perfect for the dual use as a bib and burpy cloth, and it is great for wiping spit-ups. The material is absorbent, the prints are cute and stylish, and they have held up very well wash after wash.

I got this stroller even though I already have a Maclaren double stroller. This one feels lighter and easier to maneuver through store aisles, but the Maclaren is somewhat easier to get up and down curbs. My girls (petite sized) were about aged 2 and 4 when I used this stroller the most for mall shopping trips and park outings; however, after I learned I was expecting my third baby, I've stopped pushing them around because of the combined weight being quite heavy and hard on my hips! Now the girls are close to 3 and 5 so I just make them walk or just use shopping trolleys, but with a baby on the way I expect to be able to make use of this stroller again very soon especially with the car seat attachment for the new born stage. We had this shipped internationally to us in the UK for a great rate and found it quite easy to put together. It smelled really strongly at first, so we left it outside to air out before we used it. Also we don't particularly make use of the tray cup holder or parent organizer, but they seem to work ok and be of reasonable quality.Things we like: kids can get on and off the stroller easily; can potentially have 3 children riding it on/off for longer outings; fits infant carseat.Not so great: the front seat isn't very deep, so larger children will not be as comfortable sitting there; the basket can be hard to access, tray cup holder is really hard to take on and off (we usually just leave it off)*UPDATE - DEC, 1, 2013*I've been able to use this stroller to push a toddler, a 4 year old, and a 6 year old at the same time. The total weight is almost as much as me, so I do get a pretty good workout especially on any type of incline. My two older girls share the back by squeezing in on the seat or standing up together, but usually only for short stretches (e.g. 10-15 minutes max). They can get on and off when they want easily. And amazingly, the stroller looks almost brand new. This was definitely a good investment for us.

This is a good car seat.  I like all the features and how it looks.  It is easy enough to install and convert.  What I don't like is that my toddler can unclip the top clip and have arms out of the straps.  It isn't safe if it doesn't stay clipped, so I have to pull over to clip it back together.  The top clip should be harder to unclip so my toddler can't do it.  The bottom clip is very strong and only an adult can do it, which is good.
summary: Good carseat, but top clip should be stronger.

reviewText: Ok.  As new dad, I can tell you this is great.  I'm not metrosexual enough for a diaper bag, even one that is somewhat masculine.  I do keep one in the trunk for emergencies.Having said that, I love this thing.  It's easy to pack essentials for changing, and my wife and I have used it so many times - back seat of our car, in a courtyard, on a family member's bed.  Plenty of room to store newborn or size 1 diapers.  Plenty of room for wipes, hand cleaner and diaper creme.There's a stap to attach it to your stroller, if you don't want to put it in the basket.
summary: Hopping up and down with excitement

reviewText: I don't care what any other review says. This swing is a lifesaver. It works wonderfully and my daughter loves it. Her dad and grandpa love the sturdy design and plug in capability. It's cute, quiet, and SAFE.  Compared to what I have seen in stores, this is by far the best design. Also pretty easy to pack up to bring to grandma's house.  Worth every dime.  I recommend it to all my friends who are expecting.

I tried all the main baby bottle brands and the ones I used are all BPA free. My favorite was Gerber because it was the easiest for my babies to latch onto. These nipples are a lot like the Gerber ones except that they accommodate the baby more by moving with the baby. This means the bottle doesn't have to be held with utter precision.
summary: Design is great to enable latching

reviewText: this is just what we needed, a booster for our 4 year old because she just needs a little height to easily eat at the table. at 42" and 43 lbs, she is tall enough to go without a booster, but it really helps so more of the food makes it to her mouth :) this will fit her with room to spare. i wish i had gotten it sooner!also the color is slightly different from how it appears on our monitor. it is not very shiny, and more of a subdued, pale lime sherbet color- on our monitor the picture looks like a dull light green. frankly the color it came in is more pleasant.the straps are adjustable to a wide range, although our chairs are on the smaller size, i would think that it would fit large chairs. we took the buckles off, but if you needed those to buckle your kid down, i think it would fit even the chunkiest tot.rounded edges means easy to clean! it is light weight and small and would travel easy.may or may not jive with your decor, but we didn't really care. not like it's covered in obnoxious cartoon characters.
summary: just what we needed for our sprawling 4 year old

reviewText: We bought this for my step son when he was 11 mos old and he loved it!  He enjoyed putting the balls in the basket and of course throwing them but this toy is very loud.  It has 2 volume settings and it is still loud on the soft setting.  I was pregnant at the time and it could've just been me but it became very irratating with how loud and how sensitive it was.  You could be walking in another room and this toy could be by itself and it would start playing the music.  The versatility of this toy though is great being a walker and a ride on toy as well it could be a money saver.  Just beware of the volume.

We use these at the hinges instead of on top of the door. Our daughter likes to slam doors and now she can't since we ordered these. Easy to use and durable. When you are not using them, they can sit on the door handle.
summary: We use these at the hinges

reviewText: Very glad we got this stroller. We received Graco travel system as a gift but the stroller was huge... This one is small, easy and light, so depends on what we do, we use this stroller. It is not for long walk, hiking, etc since the wheels are small and not easy to maneuver sometimes.

We got one of these at the baby shower for my daughter.  I thought it would be great at first but it just seemed to distract her and keep her up longer than a dark room and a soothing CD.  Also, after a few months (sealed back up and stored in the original box inside the house, no less) all the water in the fish/bubble compartment evaporated.
