For the amount you pay for this item, this seems like a serious flaw.  I expect more from an item that costs that much.

The design of this stroller is impressive, indeed! The set-up was extremely simple and took less than 10 minutes, it's simply a matter of attaching the wheels. The directions were clear and easy to understand, the stroller also came well packaged.I can't stop thinking what a perfect stroller this would be for a family with twins. While, sadly/gladly, we did not have twins we still get a great deal of use out of this stroller with our two daughters, who are 2 years apart. This stroller fits an infant up to a 4-year-old (in our case) with ease. The versatility is awesome! Your kids can face any direction: both out, both in, both facing each other, or both facing away from each other. If you don't see the beauty in this, then you obviously don't have two children yet! Sometimes siblings play and interact in a lovely manner and it's a great distraction to have them facing each other. Other times, siblings push each other's buttons and all you want is to turn them away from each other. Any variation that suits you works with this stroller!The basket under the seats is the largest we've seen in a stroller thus far, and we've owned quite a few strollers. Also, the cup holder!!! LOVE the cup holder! GREAT addition. The visors work well and function perfectly for both children no matter which directions they are facing.Finally, this isn't the first double stroller we've owned or used, so I have to say I'm impressed with this stroller's maneuvering. Double strollers are long and so they are always harder to steer by nature, it's just the way it is. This stroller seems to have looser, more freely moving and pivoting front wheels which makes it better at maneuvering. One thing to note is there is not bar at the bottom to put your foot on in order to prop it up onto a curb, you have to lift it onto a curb by pushing down on the handle bar pretty hard, so there is my only complaint. I can live with this, however. Also, the handle bar is padded nicely, but thick!All things considered, I think this stroller is a great choice. It's well designed, it folds up with TWO seats in it. It's sturdy and looks good, too. I would absolutely recommend it to expecting parents or experienced parents of twins. But also, it makes for a great double stroller for families with two young children. Our four-year-old happily rides in it and fits just fine.Love it!
summary: Perfect for twins, but also great for two small non-twin siblings!

reviewText: I used these for my first days of nursing.  They made life livable those few days, allowing me to put my bra back on without wincing after I fed my baby. That cold, wet feeling was so soothing, and these gels completely eliminated chafing in my bra.On the down side, I had to use the hospital-issue breast pads with them, because all other breast pads dried the hydrogels out and shortened their lifespan.Also, anything that keeps your nipple area moist can help candida (yeast) infections thrive if you happen to get unlucky enough to contract one.If you think your pain is caused by candida, discontinue use, air dry your nipples, and see your doctor for a swab and culture ASAP.  Also, I highly recommend "all purpose nipple ointment" for those first few weeks of breast feeding.I had a particularly difficult time breastfeeding, and tried just about everything to be pain free.  These gels helped me for a while, but did not cure my problems the way they do for some women.  I recommend them with the caveat that they are not appropriate if you get a yeast infection, and that you really need to see a doctor if your nipple pain lasts more than two weeks.  Good luck with the nursing!  It gets easier, I promise!  I never thought it would, but now it's a cinch.  I'm so glad I stuck with it!
summary: Excellent product, with one small caution

reviewText: I needed extra hangers to go with the organization kit I bought. these were the same model, and are very good quality, I just wish they kept the same pattern they had in the kit so they would have matched perfectly. But all in all it is a very good product.

I first saw my neighbor using them and I was amazed at it's feel and touch. Her baby was very content while swaddled in this blanket.It took me a while to finally find them. And now it becomes my baby's security blanket. She must have the blanket touching her face to fee secure enough to fall asleep. I also love the fact that it's very breathable so you don't need to worry too much about SID even if the baby's face is covered by it. My baby covers her face completely with this blanket and is fine.I love the fact that it is large enouge to swaddle a bigger baby. Also since it's light weight, it deosn't slip down from baby's body like most other blankets do.All and all, these by far are my baby's favorite blankies. I and my baby can't live without them.
summary: Absolutely the best multi purpose blankets

reviewText: This swing is working great. We started using it when our baby was around 6 months and he loves it! I have no complaints.
THE MATTRESS IS SUPER  WORKS GREAT FOR THE BABY  GREAT SUPER SOFT/ I WOULD RECOMEND THIS TO ALL WITH NEW BABYS  FOR SURE
i get so many complements because of the little pillows on the side. This is a perfect cover. She lays her head down on the side when she's tired.

I have a nursing baby who I supplement with, so I thought I'd try these bottles and I'm completely impressed. As advertised the air flow is minimal reducing the need to even burp the baby. The nipple has a unique bendable construction that more closely mimics the breast than any bottle we've ever used. The seal for on the go is also a great addition.

It is a great design for a breast fed baby, but I tried all the different stages of nipples and my son collapsed the nipple on all of them. He wasn't getting enough milk out of the bottle no matter what nipple I put on the bottle. The nipple design is great for breast fed babies. It moves from left to right and up and down which is great. But the flow of the nipple just isn't enough.
summary: Good but my baby colapsed the nipple.

reviewText: I think this is going to work perfectly in my car, which is currently a disaster area with toys and fruit snack wrappers and snack containers all over the place.The one thing I don't like is how smelly this was as soon as I took it out of the box.  It's a really awful smell and we're currently airing the thing out, hoping it'll go away.

I had originally purchase a pack from  Safety 1st and they were way too short. However these kind are actually longer and you can flip them to the side if you no longer want the cabinets locked or if you are baby proofing early. Easy to install, you do have to drill into the cabinets; but isn't your child's safety priceless compared to some drilled holes? =) I loved these and do recommend them.
This product serves its purpose.  But I now just use the masher because cleaning the bowl can be a pain because of all the grooves.

Our 6 (now 9) month old really loves this.  The amount of fluff inside makes it perfect for little hands to grab and manipulate.  It's squishy without being too squishy.  I see her really growing up with this little doll.
summary: Perfect for little hands to grab!

reviewText: This is not my favorite brand of diaper cover, but I have ordered the lavender thirsties size two cover twice from amazon now and each time I get sent a size 1, so I decided to try a different brand just for the sake of not dealing with the mistake again.  These hold in the moisture very well.  The snap system is adequate.
summary: Quality diaper covers and very cute fit

reviewText: For a quick fix, like banana, avocado or a mix of both, this is a great product to mash and serve.  Good for in house use.  You can simply use a fork but it's so inexpensive why not have it for your baby?

We love these cloths! We have the pink "I love mommy" and " I love daddy" ones and they work better than any other burp cloths {our other ones just soak right through} we have bought and they are very very cute! Very happy with them and at $4 for a 3 pack they are perfect!

This is our second set of Baby Banz earmuffs. I purchased a set for my first son when he was about 12 months old. We needed something to protect his hearing when he was outside and we were mowing, using the leaf blower, etc. I had no idea just how much we would use these. Hearing loss runs in my family as nerve deafness, so we understand and know the importance of protecting your hearing. Once damaged it doesn't come back and will only get worse (in our case). We use these for any outdoor activity such as using the shop vac in the garage, the neighbors mowing while we are outside, to fireworks at a public event on 4th of July. My son also likes to wear them when he rides his power wheel vehicles...it's cute. So when baby #2 arrived, we got him a set too. We use these more than we don't, since both of my boys love to be outside. My youngest, now 18 months, likes to put them on when I vacuum, as he is afraid of the vacuum cleaner. :) These protect my babies hearing and allow them to participate in activities that could potentially damage their hearing over time. I highly recommend these for any child that is around anything even remotely loud. Do them a favor and protect their precious hearing. These are adjustable and will work for years to come (infant to age 10 or so)! A great investment for your child's future hearing capabilities.

I know the whole point of using these is to reduce the amount of air your baby gets from the bottle, but I hated trying to squeeze out the air from the liners without "popping" them.  We burp our son after every ounce to prevent spit-up issues, and with these you can't tell how much he is drinking without stopping, letting the air back into the insert, and then pushing it back out again.  Plus, you really can't mix formula in the bottle, so it's a pain to try to take these somewhere without having a separate container to mix in.  I guess they would work best if you use the pre-mixed formula so you can just pop a couple cans of that in your diaper bag.  Even so, that takes up extra room in the diaper bag.  Even though the bottles are easy to disassemble and wash, unlike some other bottles on the market, and have limited parts, you still have a bottle, a nipple, and a lid to wash.  As for cost, the bottles themselves are inexpensive, but you must continue to purchase the liners, and even buying the store brand it's just another cost and ultimately more stuff to throw away.  I find it's easier and cheaper to invest in other bottles that you can just wash and reuse all the parts.Pros:Baby gets less air during a feedingEasy to washInexpensive start-up costs for just the bottlesWide nipplesCons:Can't mix in the bottle so they don't travel wellCan't tell how much baby is getting unless you let the air back into the linerHave to buy liners, so continued cost after purchaseJust as many parts as other bottles so you're not saving timeOverall, I'll stick with Avent.  Less waste, easy to assemble, and no hassling with the stupid liners.
These are perfect for our Mini-Crib, they are soft and cozy and have held up really well in the washer and dryer.

I got these as a gift off of my giggle.com baby registry.I don't think they get softer with every wash, they just create a really big bunch of lint in the dryer filter....There's so much you could save it and stuff a freakin pillow with it all..
summary: These are cute.. I love them.

reviewText: I bought these because with a 2 month old daughter, I go through burp rags like CRAZY. These are very durable and a good size too.

I got this for my Granddaughter's baby. She loves it, and baby loves it.The ERGO Baby carrier is comfortable.You can have the baby on your back facing forward, on your hip, on yourChest facing you, or facing forward.As it says, 0 to 4 months,(&older;) baby is in front toward you..So this can be used right away.This Carrier does not hurt your back. It is Very Comfortable in any position.This is a bit pricy, but worth the money, its made to last for a few more children.
summary: There is not another one like this, It's Awesome,

reviewText: My father kept breaking these.  They are really easy to break, apparently, and were pretty annoying in general.  I've just started training my daughter to stay out of the cabinets.
These swaddle blankets are simply the best. Great for gifts. Always appreciated. We live in So Cal and it is great for a lightweightblanket for crib or stroller. Love a+a!

I had a mirror before that was half the cost, and none of the value.  It slid around and I could never see the baby.  This one is designed exactly how it should be if you or I were to do it.  There are two straps to keep it tightly in place, and it rotates on a snug ball bearing-type mount to position the mirror.  It's perfect.  I have been driving around with it - and bumping it when I put the infant car seat in and out of the car - and it hasn't required adjusting.  Should have spent the money the first time.  Worth it.

I actually purchased these as a gift, but I am a huge fan of these swaddle blankets. They are very large, very stretchy and super light. In the winter months, I used these to swaddle my daughter over top of a warmer blanket. After about a year they do become a little fragile in the wash if you use them often. But I now purchase them for every new mom because I was such a huge fan!

I love these bottles though a little more timely to clean they really help with gas. I have used the natural shape nipple  as a transition between breast and bottle because it most resembled my nipple shape and my son did great.
summary: Chose a bottle that resembles your nipple shape

reviewText: Blah.  I wanted to like this pail so much.  We are exclusive GroVia diaper users and I had to have this pail, the concept was perfect for our needs.  However, the plastic boning wore a hole in the material and fell out after about 2-3 months.  Customer service was awesome.  They acknowledged there was an issue with some pails and sent a new one right away and I returned the old one.  Unfortunately the same thing happened with the replacement.  This time they offered to send another or give me store credit.  I took the store credit and they let me keep the pail.  I've only had the second one a few months and along with the fraying hole from the plastic boning, the zipper is a really inferior quality for something I use so regularly.  I really liked the concept, but the quality is severely lacking compared to their diapers.  A high quality zipper and a fix for that plastic boning issue and I'd buy another one.  Until then, I'm sticking with the Planet Wise hanging diaper bag.
summary: Not up to normal GroVia standards

reviewText: I liked using this for making quick mashed food without having to drag out all the parts of our baby bullet.  But the food needed to be really soft and without a lot of fibers for this to be effective.
summary: Quick way to mash baby food

reviewText: I've been using this pail for 1 month now and it has been wonderful. We are going to buy another one for the upper floor. It contains odor really well (I realize breasted newborns don't stink). The pail looks great too, I bought the sage color. It is really easy to use, you only need one hand which is necessary. Great buy!
These are so comfy and soft blankets. You have a great choice of colors and patterns here on Amazon. Usual quality, cute, affordable, these are a good buy. Very pleased.

We bought two. It's a great sippy. It does leak a bit here and there but nothing major. I have experienced what others experienced with the random bubbling up when cap cover is on - that's odd and at times annoying when the cap fills with water but since its just water I don't mind but if it was juice that would be a super inconvenience but I don't plan to give my child juice for a long time but may try milk in it eventually but we'll see.

These are kind of weird.  One of the blankets is soft and the other 3 are stiff - not really sure what's going on with them.  They seem to be a nice quality and I'm sure I'll use them for things, but just know that they really are not very soft.
Great for keeping an eye on little one. I've had no problem with it sliding off the headrest. It's so nice to be able to see my son and sometimes catch him smiling :)

When you have a baby, it seems like every company on the face of the planet wants to sell you some gadget designed to make your life easier. Baby food warmers, baby food makers, baby food processors...it's a racket. This is one of the few things that turned out to be worth it: just 2 pieces, easy to clean, and you can mash up your own food for your baby in a matter of seconds, without plugging anything in.

We're fans of this sippy and have two.  It's super durable - great for a toddler who likes to throw things everywhere.  It is easy to clean. The options on this (sippy, straw, cup) are pretty genius and easy to transition and use.  A few minor issues - first, the silicone is necessary, but makes it very difficult to put into the cupholder/bottle holder in diaper bags.  The silicone "sticks" to the fabric.  We find ourselves just setting it in the diaper bag rather than the designated holders - it doesn't leak so even if its jostled, it's not a huge problem - just something to keep in mind.  Also, I wish the packaging was "whole" - the box it comes in has a cutout to show off the product color - so then when the cup is removed for use, the box is then not usable.  Normally I toss boxes anyway, but because there are interchangeable parts and instructions, I would have liked to put them back in the box for later use. I expect to misplace everything - which isn't the manufacturer's fault - but something that I noticed and would have liked.

I bought one Weegoamigo muslin swaddle blanket for my baby to see if he likes being swaddled or not. He sleeps so well when swaddled so I went ahead and bought 4 pack star light Aden+Anais. It's just as big as Weegoamigo blanket 47 to 47 inches but it's not as good. As I washed them there was so much lint That I had to rewash other stuff that was washed with it.My son's pacifier collect so much lint from it too. I should have read other reviews about lint and just bought another Weegoamigo blanket instead. I had it for 2 weeks and I had no lint, it's nice and soft and so lightweight. My baby first thing first wiggled his arms out of swaddle with Aden+Anais blanket which hadn't happened with Weegoamigo since I learned how to swaddle well. Anyways I recommend to buy one of each and see which one you like before buying a whole pack.

It fits some high chairs, but probably less than half of the ones at the restaurants we go to. This is one of those things us "first time parents" get, use a couple times, and then realize it's just another thing we have to carry around and it's really not all that important anyway. We stopped using this after a couple months and just wipe down the high chair before we put our kid in it. He's still living, so it appears it's ok to not use a protective barrier on everything.
summary: This thing is ok, but I wouldn't buy it again

reviewText: I've been looking everywhere for a straw cup that doesn't leak and this is it! Ok we'll once in a very rare instance does it leak but since I only put water in it I don't care. I love that first it isn't plastic, secondly, it can convert from a zippy cup to a straw cup and thirdly it is super easy to clean. I know it's a little pricey but it is totally worth it!

Initially I registered for a "rock n play sleeper" but didn't realise until after I got it that it only rocked when someone was rocking it. I saw this Fisher-Price rocker online and it was cheaper and did more than I needed it to!
summary: Inexpensive but still rocks, vibrates, and plays music

reviewText: My baby had a respiratory infection and the bulb aspirator was no help as we could only access mucus already in her nose. Seeing her struggling with the mucus rattling around in her throat and cry in frustration was heartbreaking. Then a friend told us about the BabyComfyNose Nasal Aspirator and the difference was night and day. Suddenly we could easily access all of that mucus making it easier for her to breathe and rest. Sure the concept is gross but the mucus is never anywhere near your mouth. And the fact is I'd be willing to do just about anything to make her more comfortable. The aspirator is easy to use although sometimes the tubing gets a kink in it which reduces the suction power until you straighten it out. The aspirator requires no additional filter purchases; just use regular tissue. And cleaning is a cinch. Disassemble, run soap and hot water through the four parts, air dry and reassemble. It doesn't get easier than that. I'm a fan.

Small enough to fit in a diaper bag, and very easy to throw on a high chair.  The fact that it serves as it's own stuff sack is brilliant.  Easy to wash and clean.  And wonderful for the price paid.My only minor complaint is that there are no straps to restraint my little one, and the cover doesn't make it easy for the typical high chair straps to restrain him easily.

I was on a quest to find the best stainless steel sippy cup - all the reviews of the three cups I tried, the Safe Sippy, the Eco Vessel, and the Foogo with the hard spout without the handles, were mixed as to which leaked and which didn't. This particular cup was in the middle in terms of leaks. It doesn't just leak from the spout when shaken by my toddlers, but it also leaks from where you screw the lid on. Unlike the other products, this lid has a silicon ring that helps make a seal to keep the liquid in - in the week that I had these cups at least two of them had issues with the ring coming off the 'track' and thus resulting in liquid leaking everywhere. And sometimes once I got it back in place and I'd go to screw the lid on, if I screwed it too tight, it'd make the ring come off track again. So frustrating. It leaks even more if you use the straw attachment. If you have a 4 year old who doesn't throw their cup down as soon as they're done with it for the moment, or who won't shake it, this would be a fine cup. But for the vast majority of us who use this as a sippy for a younger child, this is a leaky mess.If you're looking for leak proof, your best bet is to go with the Foogo. It's not 100% but it's by far the best out of all the ones I tried.

Admittedly my little one isn't old enough to be feeding himself so he hasn't attempted to really grab them. But for right now they are working perfect for us. I love that they have lids because I measure out rice cereal in the bowl snap on the lid and stick it in the diaper bag. It does suction to our high chair and table and I had to put my fingers on the suction part to pull it off but maybe that fades in time.

I don't understand people who use those plushy cart covers as a double for high chairs. Personally, my child gets food EVERY where. This high chair cover is super light, easy to throw into a diaper bag, unfold onto a chair, throw into the wash and fold back into a little pouch. Plus, it's really affordable. I'm thinking about getting another one just incase I haven't done laundry, or just to place in our other vehicle!
My daughter loves these Medela products.  She needed  a larger size to fit her hand pump and they fit perfectly.

I bought this because none of the other bouncers seemed to 'cradle' a newborn. The little lamb bouncer is almost identical to this in appearance and comfort but does not bounce - it's stationary. This is the best of both worlds because it is very cozy for a new baby yet has the ability to actually bounce (you have to use your hand to make it bounce - it's not automatic). Also, while both the little lamb bouncer and this bouncer have a vibrate feature, the little lamb shuts off after 10 minutes. This bouncer's vibrate stays on until you turn it off. My daughter loves to be bounced on a yoga ball and it was killing my back and I can bounce this aggressively enough where it simulates me bouncing her on the ball.

I was surprised at the size of this item when it arrived. I guess I thought it would be bigger, but I am really glad it isn't. The size is actually perfect to mash up a 1/2 banana or pear and feed right away to my little one. It is just the right size to mash an avocado which my baby really enjoys. It turned out to be better than I expected. Definitely recommend.
summary: Thought it would be bigger, Glad it wasn't

reviewText: Bought this for my teething infant, he seems to really like all the textured sections on his sensitive gums.  Nicely sized, easy to hold and is a nice texture.  He doesn't have teeth yet, so I hope it will hold up to him gnawing at it with those razor sharp teeth once they come in
My 5-month-old loved gnawing the different nubs on this soft teether. Good size for gripping & waving around. Made in the USA!!
They are nice breathable blankets but they fall apart in the wash more with every use. They are too expensive for what they are.

We received this for our son & used it every day for 3 months until we transitioned him to his crib.  We didnt find the changing table all that useful but all of the other bells & whistles we used.  The height adjustment was great as our bed is very high & we wanted our son level with us in bed.  The light was nice at night when he woke up and the heartbeat was a great way to soothe him when we first arrived home from the hospital.  Will definitely use again for my next child.

We shopped around quite a bit for a lightweight stroller for our little one for travel/short trips. She's 7 months old, 16 pounds, so on the lower end of the size spectrum for an umbrella stroller.Use: She likes sitting in the stroller just fine. Up until now we've been using the b-safe car seat in her b-ready stroller and she hasn't been forward facing so riding in this is a whole new world of things to see :)Recline: The recline feature is great, she fell asleep on her first outing.Color - The color is nice, unisex for a boy or girl (we got the green)Height - I'm 5' 5" and I raise the handles up as far as they can go, so not sure if i'm just weird and like tall handles, or if a taller person might have a problem. Husband 5' 7" and has the same issue. They are fine for us, but I wouldn't think it would be comfy for someone taller.Walking - I do kick the wheels slightly when I walk - not sure if this is just me or if everyone would have this problem. It's not that bad, I just have to be a conscious about it.Opening - says "one handed" but I need two... maybe after a while of using it I'll figure out the one handed opening trick. Also it opens easily but the bottom part never locks into place automatically - I have to click each side manually. Not a big deal, but one time I put the baby in it and it wasn't locked right, and when I started walking it was all wobbly and off.Closing - very easy. It also stand up on it's own when folded which is great.Weight - very lightweight, we won't have a problem carrying it.Brakes- independent - you have to do each wheel separately.Accessories - it came with a cup holder which honestly I think popped off already and is lost somewhere.Storage - Awful - I do understand that umbrella strollers are smaller than full size and I fully expected it to be less storage area. The space is not that bad, however, the opening to put stuff into the area is really small. I can't even fit a handbag (13" x 9" or so) in the opening.  What would fit? I would say a small wristlet type thing, or individual items -- diapers, wipes, etc. Don't plan on using it for anything substantial.All in all , a solid 4-stars for this.

The SleepSack Swaddle Blanket is a light covering that keeps baby swaddled without overheating.  The SleepSack is also versatile to where SleepSack can be partially unzipped to change diapers without necessarily unswaddling the baby.  SleepSack can also be used when the child wants to have their arms/hands free by using the swaddling section below the arms instead of over the arms.

Easy to fold and unfold. Stands nicely on its own. Nice and compact. LOVE the roomy seat, baby has room to grow, and she is soo comfortable in it too. Love the deep recline. LOVE the big canopy. Love the fabric and print. Pushes nicely. Very good quality.  I did buy this stroller to take in car and use at the malls and stores etc. I use an all terrains for long neighborhood walks and parks etc. I probably wouldn't use this one on rougher terrain.
We are very happy with these muslins and get much use out of them BUT not as swaddles. Just as covers, blankets, towels, burp cloths. nice, comfy material.
This product I like, the quality is good but for now my baby does not like because it is very hunched, I recommend it for bigger babies, not for newborns.

These blankets are large and soft just like the hype it has. We use them daily as normal blankets, drool removers, car seat canopy, stroller cover, crib sheet, play yard sheet and more.My 3 year old son loves them as much as my 4 month old. Washing them frequently will fade the colors a bit but the feel quality remains unchanged. Love them!

reviewerName: Tara E. "Mommy to 3 boys: Cole, Hunter & Owen"
reviewText: i dint have a leaking issue with these but they didn't stay in place well. the one little strip of adhesive was not enough to keep them in place. Maybe it is b/c I am big breasted but these did not work (loved the Avent ones though)

This is a fantastic, very cute bouncer.  Our grandson, who is 8 weeks old, loves this bouncer.  Specifically, the incline seat which he is comfortable in and the calming vibrations which you activate with just a flick of the switch (product takes 1 D battery).  The toy bar is very easy to take out and switch around.  We have not used the colorful side of it yet due to his age.  The chair cover is machine washable and fits in any standard or even small washing machine.Thankfully, Fisher Price did not make a product where the noises go continuously.  That can grow quite annoying when it’s on a small 5 second loop.  To make sounds (assuming the music is turned off) the baby must be active to produce the music and motion.  I would remove only .5 starts if I could due to the price of the product at the time of the review ($55) which is slightly more expensive than other products which have similarly great reviews - something to consider for the price contentious buyer.
The colors in this were more blue less blue-green.  Definitely only for a boy in my opinion.  I sent them back.

First, I bought the Sage Stripe pattern in conjunction withCarters Easy Fit Printed Crib Fitted Sheet, Ecru/Brown CirclesandCarters Everyday Easy Printed Boa Blanket, Ecru/Brown. I was hoping that the green was the same color green, even though the description was "ecru and brown" on the other products. It is the same color green, so they all matched.I have a son, but I want something that is pretty enough to be gender neutral in case we have a girl in the future. Most of my baby gear (stroller, car seat, high chair) are all green, and brown with hints of blue, and this fits right in with everything.I had concerns about this fitting my mattress, because I know there are sometimes issues when all descriptions read "standard size", but it fits the mattress perfectly,Kolcraft Pure Sleep Therapeutic 150 Crib Mattress.I love the way it looks, it washed well the first time, and its smooth and soft.

My son got this toy for Christmas. He wasn't even crawling yet but loved to put the balls in the basket to make the music start. Once he started pulling up it was a great walking toy. He loves to dance to the music now. It is a little difficult to change from the walking to riding position but my son isn't that interested in riding right now.
summary: Lots of fun for beginner walker.

reviewText: We've been using this stroller for over 5 months now.  I LOVE, LOVE, LOVE this stroller.  It's SUPER light and I can carry it and put it away with ONE hand.  It folds up nicely (super easy!!) and compact in my Honda Accord and takes up LITTLE room.  It's easy to steer and it very durable!  It also has a GREAT size basket for an umbrella type stroller.  People stop and ask us about this stroller all the time.  It's great looking, affordable and I'm able to take it on LONG walks, up and down hills with no problems.  I love that it fully reclines - such a great, extra feature!One of the best gifts we've recieved for our son and family!

Great for mashing everything, even slightly "crisp" veggies!  I like not having to prepare special meals for our LO.  I just mash what we are having.  He hasn't started on meats yet, but I'd imagine we won't have any issues for tender cuts and chicken.

From the vibrating chair, blinking lights and silly music, my baby loves it all! Very solid base and softly comfy chair. Batteries for the chair go a long way suprisingly. I constantly forget the vibrating feature on all the time and have only had to change the batteries out once so far in 3 months. I highly recomend this for purchase!

I read the reviews on this product before buying it.  It seems it worked for some wonderfully and not so great for others or not at all.  The sound worked great but I could never get a picture at all.  I took it back to the store and they said certain brands dont work in certain homes.  I thought about exchanging it for another just like it but figured it wouldnt work.  I saw the safety first one and it was slightly higher in price but i knew my other regular monitor was safety first and it worked so I bought it and got it home and it worked fine.  If you want this monitor I suggest trying it out for yourself in your home instead of just reading these reviews because it does depend on how your house is set up just dont get your hopes up and be prepared to run back to the store to exchange just in case.
summary: Did not work but might work in other homes.

reviewText: These sleep sacks are perfect for your babies and fit them as they grow. Safest way to keep them warm.
I bought these for my 2 month old and love them. Much better quality than alot of cheaper ones i found online.
summary: A little expensive, but worth it

reviewText: The mixed reviews encouraged me to go check out this stroller in person. It was on sale at Babies-R-Us... so it made sense, plus I wanted to return (lucky they gave me store credit) a cheapy "umbrella" stroller we got- it was a bit better than the super cheap ones, but horrible and didn't work well at all. Very unstable and not very compact. The chicco was more compact width wise- but yes, longer in the length. No biggie for my SUV though or any car I've ever owned. The chicco was sterdier and could actually hold the diaper bag without tipping over. It's very easy to push- even one handed. And fits my 8mos old well- she's a bit short, and so she'll get plenty of use out of this one. It's nothing too fancy- but cute and works well. The folding option is a bit of a pain- I miss the one hand push to fold- but hey, it works. So far so good... I'll update my review after some use if there are any issues. I do see what some people are talking about with the canapy window and no cover for it- but pretty much all the lightweight strollers I saw at the store were the same way- unless you upgraded to one twice the price. I can make a cover easy peasy if needed- so it's fine. Also, the canopy some complained about it great! It covers a lot- least from my perspective. Others barely covered the top of my LO's head! So this one is perfect and I have a canopy cover if/when needed for all my strollers.

My 3 month old son loves this its a tummy time fix, and meal time fun. With all the textures and sizes of these three toys he has a blast the ball itself is a must have the other 2 teethers/rattles are a bonus.
Baby likes it a lot and I like that it's silicone and easy to clean.  The yellow and the green are pretty colors for a girl or a boy.  This is a nice gift.

Got one of these for my four month old grandson. He is enjoying putting everything in his mouth right now, which is developmentally appropriate, so I choose this because it has several surface textures for him to explore, and the unit is small enough for him to grasp and hold and for it to fit in his little mouth. He loves it! It is very squishy and he has a blast chomping on it. I just ordered this set of two more so he can have one everywhere he goes. This is also the best price on this item at this time.
summary: chewable fun for your little one

reviewText: I like the design of this toy and especially the music function which plays single tones when you tough a single flower. It is a great feature. The fabrics is soft and the flower are made of different textures. Great toy. It has quite a large base to but in batteries.
summary: Great musical toy even without the music

reviewText: The banana flavour is not over whelming. I tried it myself.Will for sure buy again and try another flavour.

A friend of mine got an Avent breast pump and loved it.  The only down side she found was if you were going somewhere or in a rush you'd have to transfer milk quickly.  She ended up getting this conversion kit after a short time to make things more convenient.
I bought this for the book only. the containers are rather cheap but again i wanted the book. Good deal...

This is a great mattress. It fits perfectly is my daughters crib and it is plenty firm for a newborn. Thank you everyone that said don't take off the large sheep sticker! I kept that in mind but still peeled back the corner to see if it would come off. They were all right. Don't take it off, it is uber-sticky! It doesn't mess with quality, I still highly recommend it.
Bought this for my goddaughter and so far she is loving it ..  or at least it looks like, altho I would like to see some method to adjust the light output up or down.

At $12-$14 for a pack of 2, this is not the cheapest teether out there. But it's clear the maker of this product paid attention to details and wanted to build a quality product. The product is well designed and the packaging has very clear instructions and warnings. It's a worthy challenger to Vulli Sophie the Giraffe Teether. The giraffe is cuter and has more visual cues. This has more tactile cues. It makes you wish more baby products out there were made like this. Good job Lifefactory!
summary: High Quality, Made in the USA

reviewText: Since we can't load a crib full of blankets what's a mother to do?  A properly fitted sleep sack is a great solution. It zips closed from the neck first down to the feet, so if you want you can leave a little air hole open at the toes.  Though some might not like that because it won't release at the neck first if there's any sort of breathing problem.I wouldn't put a newborn in it though.  The SMALL sack is too big for a 9 pound or less baby and they worm around in these things.  I don't like that the neck could pinch the baby's throat, and the baby isn't going to be strong enough to get free of that situation yet.  I am holding onto this sleep sack until the small fits my baby's neck and shoulders properly.
summary: Baby stays warm without the possibility of harmful blankets.

reviewText: Our car seat will never be the same!!  I got this product yesterday and the arch is everything and more! Ive attached it to her lil vibrating seat, her swing and her car seat.  It has had no problem attaching to stuff as long as its not too wide. It moves up and down and I can change all the angles so its always fun to look at.  The green flower spins in both directions with a pull cord, the sun and butterfly are both crinkley and the butterfly has a spinning ball with beads in it.  They also have a small crinkly butterfly and a flower w a mirror hanging from the sun which is her favorite.  I recommend this product to anyone who wants something new for there babies to look at.

I like that this wraps into it's own bag, and had compartment to store items. It's functional and works well & you can't beat the price. I do wish the straps were a little easier/better to operate. But overall it's a good product

Our early intervention coordinator brought a product similar to the Wimmer-Ferguson Double-Feature Mirror to our house during a visit with our son when he was 3 months old.  I started looking for one, but it seemed that the only unbreakable mirrors that I could find were the locker mirrors for kids at school.  Those were really small and I wanted a larger one that he could really look at himself in.  I was thrilled when I found this one on Amazon! Our baby is now 1 year old and he continues to play with this daily.  He sits and talks to himself in it, waves to himself and just loves to look at reflections of us behind him.The mirror is unbreakable and has a great reflective surface - looks just like a mirror.  The opposite side is filled with black and white reversing images which are supposed to be stimulating to baby's eyes.  Our baby prefers to look at himself.  It's washable with just soap and water.  We've had it for about 6 months, and it's holding up great!

Our daughter has been using these for a few months now, and they work great for self feeding. They keep the bowl from sliding when she's using the spoon. She hasn't figured out to yank on them yet, so we're loving them. Wished they were microwaveable though, but it hasn't been too much of an inconvenience.
summary: Works great for the beginning eater

reviewText: this product is very comfy and i think will work well for me as i get bigger. I bought it hoping it'd help w/ my lower back/neck issues, but it didn't help too much. I stopped using it for awhile, but will plan to use it again soon.My only complaint is that the part where your legs go seems to go flat quickly throughout the night which causes my legs to ache.
Easy to carry, to install, to move out the toddler, to put him back, to uninstall it and put it away...and it is approved for aircraft.

I like how colorful the stickers are.  They stick well to the wall.  The only issue that I had was that they were not in alphabetical orders, the upper and lower case letters were not even on the same page for the most part.  So, I spent a lot of time trying to match up the upper with lower case letters and then putting them in alphabetical order to place on the wall.

We bought this for our daughter right after she turned 2.  It has worked out great for us.  She loves feeling more like a big kid in this booster.  It's easy to clean and use.  Our daughter can use this and still slide close to the table to eat or do crafts. The adjustable height is wonderful.

I purchased this gym for my 7 week old daughter. So far she loves it. The four toys are cute; her favorite is the one with the "clacking" plastic rings on the bottom of it. I like that there are additional loops to hang new toys. She is particularly interested in the mirror. She loves to stare at the "other baby," and I like that I can move it and attach it to various places on the mat. The small pillow for tummy time is the only thing I don't think is too great. It is slippery and when you put in on the mat it slides easily. It also took me a few minutes to get the "twist and fold" feature, when the toys are all hanging on the loops. Overall I really like this product and I would recommend it.

I was initially concerned about spending so much on a play mat, but it is worth every penny. My 3-month-old daughter loves the rain forest gym and stays absolutely entranced with the brilliant colors, flashing lights and butterflies. This has also helped encourage tummy-time, which she hadn't previously been too keen on. I like the extra loops on varying levels that allow me to attach more of her toys. The only thing that would improve this product would be to have the butterflies spin on their own.

I was a but weary because of those reviews that complain about the quality of this bassinet, but I have nothing negative to say... I assembled it all by myself at 7.5 months pregnant, and I found it very easy. A few steps but nothing hard, no crazy tools needed... And it looks so pretty! I did iron all the textiles first (obviously it was wrinkled!) and find it very pretty. Out bedroom is all in cream/vanilla/champagne colors and I love how it looks great with our own bed! Doesnt look cheap or anything. The toys hanging from the hood are adorable, the pad inside is removable for easy sheet changing, and it is waterproof, easy to wile clean!I love, LOVE, all the functions it has, the light is so very useful for night time feedings! My baby loves the vibration and he likes the nature sounds the most but there are a few, with adjustable volume.The bassinet in itself is easy to pull up from the base, which is the changing station, and I have actually taken it to my neighbor's house one day in case baby wanted to nap during our visit -it is that light and easy!One single complain: the bassinet position is either all the way flat, or very high almost in a 90 degree angle. I would like some position to recline him a little bit without having him sitting up (when they use it, they are too little to be seated). I propped it up by putting a blanket between the base of the bassinet and the changing pad.
I bought this for my wife, who really likes that her hands can be free during pumping.  It holds her Medela shields and bottles up without any problems.

I love the color - unisex and  the quality is second to none.  I bought it for my little guy who was sleeping in pink ones prior to this purchase.  For the spring/summer I will definitely need to purchase a lighter weight sleepsack.  But for the winter months this one really does the job.
I love the bumper, it was a the perfect fit and the colors are absolutely perfect mix. I am so glad I decided to go with the Dena Happi Tree theme. 100% happy with my purchase!
We bought this to hang from my grandson's play gym and it hangs so low it hits him. He doesn't have a chance to reach for them on the gym so we hold this and play with him. He loves the zebra!
summary: only issue is how low this hangs

reviewText: This product seemed perfect when my two year old started escaping his room and getting into things while we were sleeping.  It worked great for about a month until he got wise.  Now he just pops it off and opens the door.  No problema!  I am writing this review as I search for something better that won't just snap off in the hands of a tiny tot.
summary: Two year old just takes it off then escapes

reviewText: These cups do not leak! My one year old learned to drink from them very quickly. We have 6 different sippy cups and these are best ( and are a great value).

While I found this pillow to be sufficiently fluffy, it's really not suitable for those of us that tend to toss a lot during the night. Rolling over with this, especially when under a blanket, is near impossible and I found myself waking up more often to adjust it. I'm 6 months pregnant with twins and it supported my belly nicely but realistically its just not good when you have to change positions. I'm sending it back and getting the smaller one to use with my own pillow for my head.

I had a set of these that came with my JJ Cole diaper bag.  Not only are they a little clunky and not convenient to clip on/off of the bag, but one also broke after only a couple of months.  I also bought the Think King mighty buggy hooks and they are much easier to use and seem much more sturdy.
summary: Broke after a couple of months

reviewText: This is entertaining for everybody. My 3 1/2 month old (18lbs) son loves it! I still have to insert a little pillow behind him and put a little pillow under his feet. He is learning to jump now. He loves all the toys on it, experiencing a little bit by a little bit. Unlike other theme Jumperoo, the toys are hanging buy thicker and flat string instead of regular strings to prevent little ones finger being tangled in them like the previous review mentioned. He would giggles and laugh out loud in it, and it makes everyone in the family laughs even harder by watching him. Its sturdy enough, but I still wouldn't leave him unattended.Only disappointment is the base I got is not a circle like on the picture.

I actually got this to compare against the Avent bottles we had used for our other baby.  My wife is expecting and we just wanted to have all the bottles ready for when the baby comes.When I got the bottles, I took them apart and it has more parts than the Avent.  There are more small parts to clean, but it looks like there is a purpose for the design of the pieces of this bottle.  I believe it is meant so that it prevents the baby from getting gas.  We will find out when the baby is born whether or not this is better than Avent, but I am impressed by the design.

I only wish we would have purchased this chair sooner. My 18 month old daughter is so much happier and comfortable right up at the table with a place to put her feet. She is much less fidgety. This chair is sturdy and clearly made to last a long time. We love it!

The toy bar is styrofoam, so it's not gonna last forever, but my baby loves it! It started leaning forward almost right away, but even at a couple weeks old it really intrigued my baby and at 2 months it helps to distract my fussy baby during her diaper changes. And when she outgrows the toy bar or it breaks the diaper changer works great, is generously sized, cushy, and comes with a soft cover!!

I got those bottles since they fit the Medela pump, and use them for storage only.Good scale visibility, nice bottles, great price. The only thing that could be better is that the top of the bottles below the thread is too curved, so some milk drops stay in the bottle when we move it  to the bottles we actually use for feeding (Dr. Brown).

This chair is expensive but considering that we'll use it at least twice a day for several years, it's worth every penny. We live in a 1946 house with a small dining room and I wanted something that we could pull up to the table. Not a big oversized high chair that would take up space and we'd have to move around from corner to corner. I love that it fits right up against the table like another chair and blends in. My daughter eats at the table with us which I think is nice when we're having dinner together as a family. It's also really easy to clean. No padding that you have to take out and wash. No crevices for food to get trapped. The only other accessory we bought is the baby set. I bought a cushion but returned it because it wasn't necessary. We were also going to get the tray but if your going to pull it up to the table, you don't need that either.I'm also a sucker for great design and this chair is lovely. We'll have it for years and then probably as a lot of others have done, pass it down for the next 10 or 20. It's worth it!!
summary: Expensive but worth every penny in the long run!

reviewText: Poor raw material. The locker system tires the bag straps and it isn't simple to be adjusted in strollers for example.

I highly anticipated these cards, and I'll admit I was still a little surprised at how much my son loves looking at them.  I love to show him a card and watch him study it.  When his eyes finally look away (after 15-20 seconds), I flip the card around, and all the sudden he's interested again!  He's only 3 months old now, and I hope he continues to enjoy them.

This toy is so precious. I love the sweet face and bright colors. Besides, who doesn't like a little sunshine! It has a very soft bell in the back, so the noise is very faint (almost hard to hear, really). It spins like a top, and that is fun for both baby and parents to watch. My son can grab the sun rays and gnaw on the rays a little (they are a little bit wider than most actual teething toys). We got it for him when he was 5 months old, and he will play with it for only a short amount of time before being ready to move on to something else (we've had it about 3 weeks now). I do catch myself spinning it around on the floor while playing with it, so obviously it's pretty mesmerizing for one of us. :) Overall, I probably wouldn't purchase it again because it is a little expensive for how infrequently he plays with it, but it would make a sweet "you are my sunshine" gift for a mom-to-be.
summary: I like it more than my son does

reviewText: I have yet to meet a teething baby who did not love this. The rattle is bright and fun. The different sized sun rays are perfect for chewing on. The rattle part isn't very loud but that doesn't take away from the toy. We love haba products, very well made and hold up!

This seat seems very comfortable for my little girl to ride in. Like the Decathlon Odyssey, it reclines very well for rear facing (we haven't used it forward facing yet) and is also very padded for her comfort. The print is so adorable and super soft. I love that Britax has the "hugs" system because not once have I had to untwist those darn harness straps like in her infant seat. This seat is also a breeze to install. This is definitely one I recommend!!! 5+ stars!!!!

We received a chenille blanket for my son when he was born, and since he turned a year old, he has become quite attached to it.  So, as a backup, we ordered this blanket to ensure that there is always a blanket with him.  He loves it and can not tell the difference between the two.Quick shipping and quality product.
might as well order 2-3 sets of these. Great for playing alone and just attaching toys to everything, carrier, stroller, car seat....
Bright Starts Clack and Slide Activity Ball . I got this for my nephew and he seems to like it. He is 5 months old
summary: Bright Starts Clack and Slide Activity Ball

reviewText: The storage bottles themselves are fine, but they have these weird tops with a circular piece that pops out. Maybe i'm just dumb, but I couldn't figure out how to keep the lid on without the little circle popping out. Other than that, the bag and ice packs are good! I'd get different bottles.
We have a bunch of bathrooms and have tried a few models. This is the most comfy and functional so far. Better than the boon and the prince lionheart ones.

I purchased this product because I was tired of wasting money on disposable nursing pads.  After a few washes this product looses it shape and wrinkles and the wrinkles can be seen through your bra/shirt.  If you iron them that problem is mostly solved.

I bought this based off the reviews and it paid off. I was rather simple to install. Adjusting the shoulder straps is so much easier than on his travel system from Graco. When he squiggles they don't become lose and require tightening. Fits in all our cars ('05 Subaru legacy GT, '09 Mitsubishi Lancer, '10 Toyota Corolla S)

These are lifesavers - I have been experiencing terrible pain/vasospasms/blocked ducts/thrush for the last four months. No one has been able to diagnose exactly what it is, I have gone through multiple therapies, antibiotic rounds, steroid ointments etc. In short, I had come to terms that this pain will continue as long as I try to breastfeed/pump. Everyone had also suggested applying heat. Applying heat usually would take an extra 15 minutes before-after each pumping and feeding session that I did not have the time to dedicate to. I really wish I had found these much sooner, they worked like magic - so easy to use and you can wear them around the house. I have been feeling much better, my pain is 70-75% relieved. I would recommend these to every mom who has any kind of discomfort with breastfeeding.
love these bottles!  They are good quality, and the nipple works well for my son, who is also breastfeeding, no confusion issues.

a bumbo is a waste of money I used it on my 1st and this on my second .. this grows with them a bumbo you will use for a week!! however now my 1st uses it for her babies to sit in while her sister plays in this. buy this its a must have for 1. sitting stage (3+mo) - learning to sit up 2. play safe while mommy does stuff. 3. a booster seat (haven't gotten to that yet)
Best sippycups, unfortunate that they don't have a lid, but I guess you can't expect that for this price, while it's already super quality. Really does not leak.
I hesitated lest this not look as nice as the Bob one... Yes, I do care about looks. It fits perfectly on the Bob handlebar and is a great addition to the stroller. I highly recommend for the price.

Took a while to put together..but the wife and I figured it out.  Product is sturdy and looks more expensive than it is. Really worth it for the price we paid. Can't wait to try it out when our daughter arrives. :)

This has been a great bath mat for our baby who is bathed in the sink for now.  It prevents her from sliding all over and softens the hard and cold surface of the sink.  I really like the temperature feature as it helps me make her bath water exactly to the temperature she prefers (which is much warmer than everyone recommends).  It's starting to turn yellow-ish though and it's only 4 months (or slightly less) old, which may or may not mean it's harboring bacteria, but we wring it out well after each bath and hang dry it some more.  It's a really cheap-priced add-on item though, so I'd buy another one if it begins to look too dingy.
THEY WERE REALLY NICE, GOOD QUALITY, GOOD FOR BABIES 9 MONTHS, BEATYFULL COLOR, THEY ARE SO USEFULL , A GREAT PACK

I had this product listed on my baby registry. I took it out of packaging and washed the item according to the products instructions. I wash all new items before introducing my infant to them. I removed the item from the washer and to my surprise the outer shell was slightly torn. I was very disappointed.  I still use the item due to the winter weather, but want to warn potential buyers.

My baby loves these pacifiers. he rejected the pacifiers that were given in the hospital and that are attached to all the wubanubs (you know which one I'm talking about). He just spits them right out, or tongue thrusts them out. But he loves these and they are easy to keep in his mouth.  I love that they come in a little storage box. We keep one box in the pocket of our baby carrier (ergo) and one in the diaper bag.

My 5 week old just loves this gym! She likes to bat at the toys that hang down. It comes with five adorable rainforest theme toys that dangle down from the gym and can be moved as you wish. The only reason I gave this gym four stars instead of five is because the butterflies that hang from the middle lights do not move on their own as I though they would. You can manually turn them if you like. I would highly recommend this fisher price gym, it's so cute and stimulating for baby!

No complaints on thes!e bibs thus far. They are cute and waterproof.  Our infant has mild reflux and these are some of the only bibs to keep his clothes dry. There aren't gaps around the neck so his skin stays nice and dry, but my son is off the charts in percentiles and pretty chubby so that may be why, too.  All in all I'd recommend them.  They wash easily and do not lose their latch.
summary: Cute and waterproof - does their job

reviewText: My grand daughter loves this set. The colors are bright and fun and just the right size for your hand. Plus, it is durable and the bristles are just right for a 2 year old's head.
You will love this and the price is right. Looks cute in the babys room boy or girl. Washes up nice too.
summary: so cute and soft very good quality

reviewText: Like everyone else, I bought this activity gym because it's the cutest one on the market.  However, the mat is too thin to use directly on hardwood floors.  My baby liked grabbing at the toys for short periods of time, but it didn't keep her entertained for more than 5-10 minutes.  Once my baby outgrew the activity gym, I detached the toys to use in her playpen or as stroller toys.  Today, she was sitting in her bumbo on the hardwood floor playing with the bird toy with the wooden ring.  She was tapping it on the ground, not even with much force, and the wooden ring broke.  Luckily, I saw this happen and could remove the broken pieces before she tried to put them in her mouth.  I imagine this could potentially be dangerous and wanted to warn other parents.  If you purchase this activity gym, I would strongly recommend removing and discarding the wooden ring or at the very least not detaching that toy from the overhead bar.  I have read reviews about this happening with their stroller toys that have similar-looking wooden rings, so I would be careful with any of their products with these rings.  I have posted a photo of the broken toy for your reference.

I really wanted this to work...my toddler HATES our bulb syringe aspirater with a passion. However, this aspirator removed no snot at all. The suction was so low I could barely feel it. If the suction was higher I can see how easy it would be...just hold it up to the child's nose and suck. It would be faster and less tramatic than the evil blue snotsucker monster. I don't know if we got a defective item, but it didn't help at all. I am returning it.
summary: Very poor suction...bulb syringe was more effective

reviewText: We only use Avent bottles because we had invested in so many nipples and accessories and harder plastic bottles. We liked the brand even though we always had small leaks on the bottles and had to open and close a couple of times to get a good grip.We purchased 6 of these from Amazon thinking it will be the same clear hard plastic we had. Instead we received a set of soft white color plastic bottles, that all leak. By leak I don't mean small leaks/drips like before, I mean if you hold the bottle sideways the entire thing will empty in a minute. They're all unusable.The bottles didn't come with any adaptor, and I'm amazed of how Avent and Amazon would sell a junk like this.Don't waste your money and buy these.

These fit perfectly on our Summer Infant changing pad, soft, and brighten up the room.  We also place disposable liners on top but on the few instances when the cover got peed/pooped on, they came off right in the wash.  They hold up well in the wash also.

I purchased the Graco battery-operated nasal aspirator from Walgreens because my daughter needed something right away and I had not received my NoseFrida Snotsucker in the mail yet. So, I was able to try out both systems and do a comparison.Day One: Daughter's "snot" was plentiful but very thin, almost the consistency of saliva. Used the Graco battery-operated aspirator. It worked OK at removing her "snot". I liked the fact that it can be operated with one hand and it plays music to distract the baby. The tip is also very soft and does not irritate the nose. She did not fight me suctioning her at all.Day Two: Daughter's "snot" is much thicker today. Tried the Graco aspirator first. No luck. Found that it only works to remove the thin, watery mucus. It DOES NOT remove anything much thicker than saliva. I then tried out the NoseFrida Snotsucker (available on Amazon.com). The NoseFrida was MUCH more effective at getting out the thicker snot but is difficult to use without another person. It requires two hands to operate, so you need someone to hold the baby still while you suck. You must use it correctly - as another reviewer mentioned start off with just your mouth muscles and make several quick, sharp sucks, then long vacuum-like sucks with your lungs. It really does work well.Summary: The Graco has more "bells and whistles" but when it comes down to effectiveness, it misses the mark. I would not re-purchase. No matter ho "cool" something is, if it does not do the job it was intended to do, then it is worthless.Although a bit more difficult to use, the NoseFrida REALLY WORKS. The fact that it requires two people is the only con. One person could operate it if the child was older and able to hold still, but with a squirmy infant, it requires two sets of hands. If you want a simple product that will get the job done, purchase the NoseFrida Snotsucker.
summary: Lots of "bells & whistles", but does it work? Nope.

reviewText: I used this for most of my pregnancy and I love it.  I will keep it to use next time too.  It is difficult to get out of bed if the pillow is next to the edge of the bed (because you have to get over the pillow), but it is still very helpful and comfy.  The cover is a little bit of a pain to get back on after washing, but not too terrible.  It really helped to keep me comfortably on my side throughout the majority of my pregnancy.  I was a back sleeper prior to pregnancy.

Best umbrella stroller for the price. I was shopping for umbrella stroller for a while, was looking at the more expensive ones like uppa baby or Mclaren... Well, I have to tell I am happy that I did not spend $200 or more for an umbrella when this one is perfect!! It folds perfectly, flat and easy fold. One hand to open!!! Good size storage basket under the seat, I bought additional storage that works great and must have: JL Childress Cup's and Cargo organizer. The stroller is easy to push, my daughter loves it. we already used it for travel and I take this one to the park. The only drawback is, it is not easy to push with one hand (my kid is 28 lbs now) but is not bad. I love this stroller and would recommend it.

Got this pillow for my pregnant wife. She was starting to get really uncomfortable around 4 months. This pillow helped her sleep at night and alleviated pains she was having. This is a much better option then using separate pillows. The Snoogle pillow fits between your legs and underneath your head. Yes this pillow will take up extra space in your bed but it's definitely worth it to have a happy wife.
Quality - 5/5Packaging - 5/5Manual - 5/5Work as described - 5/5Ease of installation - 3/5 (Definitely not for those who doesn't like DIY)
summary: Best lock ever to secure kitchen cabinets door!

reviewText: Time Saver/Great for a person that needs reassurance that the baby's bottles are clean and sanitized/It should come in black to match my kitchen.

I have an oddly shaped faucet where my two young boys use the bathroom and wash their hands, so I didn't think this Faucet Extender would work for us, but it does perfectly.  Because it is so flexible, it really can slide over and be adjusted with any faucet, even one like ours that comes up high and then angles straight down.  My boys love that they can reach the water now just using the stool, whereas before I'd have to pick them up and hold them over the sink.  Plus it comes off so easily.  We store it in the drawer until they need to use it, then dry it off and put it right back, since that's also the bathroom our guests use and it's not the classiest looking thing.

My 11 month old loves these. She never took to a pacifier or thumb and I wanted her to have something that symbolized sleep time so I started placing the blankie near her hand when nursing to sleep. She gets so happy when I hand it to her now and she'll tote it around in the mornings. She doesn't need it to sleep but when she wakes up in the middle of the night she finds it in the crib, so it gives her comfort. I bought one for the grandmas' houses and the sitter's house too. I like how small and light weight it is, which is great for living in the Florida heat and easier to keep it from dragging on the ground.

The absorbency of these flats are fine, it's definitely only a daytime diaper for us. But the shape of them is so weird. They are rectangular and get misshapen after washing and drying, making them really hard to fold into a decent diaper. I recommend just making your own if you're going with flats, or we bought flour sack kitchen towels from Wal-Mart for $1 a piece and they are our absolute favorite cloth diaper. I'm okay with having a few of these in my stash, but I would never buy more. They are overpriced for what they are.

These are great burp rags. They are quite large and have a nice tight weave to the fabric. They are not particularly soft and I've washed them at least 2 dozen times so far. They are also a very then fabric, which is fine for a burp rag, but not at all cushy like the flat cloth diapers I've used in the past or the prefolds I am currently using to diaper. They dry pretty quickly though because of the thin fabric, so again, burp rag worthy.
I like this set but one of the blocks cracked on the top after the first use.  I can still use it but I'm disappointed.

Cute, well-made, idiot-proof to put together (follow the picture on the package), and coordinates well with pretty much any decor. The only reason I took off one star is because it is also very easy to pull apart, as my son has figured out.

I just recently bought this sheet in the solid grey color and love it!!!  It fits myNatural Mat Coco Matperfectly.  The color is absolutely gorgeous and goes with any other decor that you might have in the crib.  The sheet is very soft.  I will definitely get a few more!

I wanted a pump that I didn't have to worry about plugging in and lugging around since I work occasionally at different locations. Although I don't pump as much milk with this manual pump as I do my double electric one, it does exactly what I need it to. I can use it discretely pretty much anywhere that I have some privacy and I don't have to worry about making a lot of noise. I'm very happy with it!

I really wish I could find mats in this color palette that didn't have the annoying little circles in the middle that keep popping out all the time.  I like the look, but my daughter keeps pulling the circles out and chewing on them... and once she fell down and bumped her head right in the middle of one of the circles that she had popped out.  Love the green and brown.  Hate the circles.
summary: Good, but the circles are annoying

reviewText: I bought this for our Dr. Brown bottle accessories and it works great. I can put the nipples and caps no problem. It holds way more than I expected.
I purchased these for my baby girl I have used the other AVENT nipples for younger babies with no issues. Great product, no issues.

Little on the flimsy side, but for a little one who isn't quite yanking yet, this neat gadgets fits great on stroller and infant carseat and keeps your little one busy.  Great item for the price and is best for those who are at the stage of just looking and learning how to reach out and use those tiny fingers.

I had use this for making baby food for my 6 month old baby and I have to say these products are pretty useful but not perfect. First, the Grinder was nice to have for certain foods but some of the foods did not grind very well not really sure why, I might have been doing something wrong at certain times. Love the idea but I guess this was just not one of those things that I really needed. Thought it would make food prep for baby easier then getting then little blender out, but it did not, just as many things to clean and takes more man power to use. It is nice for when we go to restaurants though. I have a feeling the people who said the "grinder is too hard to turn" did not cook the food soft enough and for those reviewers who said "it's wobbly and gets food all over the counter" did not tighten the handle after washing it before the first use. When tightened correctly it locks into place perfectly.I take a frozen veggie or two, heat a few pieces at a time and then add oats and formula. I can grind the whole thing with this product and even serve in the same bowl. Perfect. Yes - this is not a product for someone who wants a very fast feeding. Save your pre-packaged meals for those days. But for fresh, cooked (soft) vegetables ground into easy-to-eat texture for a little one, this is ideal. Buy it, tighten the handle well, and cook the food soft before using it and you'll really love it! As for the tray, I made several combinations of food and liked that I could store individual servings in each compartment in the tray. As other reviewers said, the food doesn't really just pop out but I slid a butter knife in and they came out fine. I'm not sure how airtight it is because there is a bit of frost on the top of the food. I really love the blue color and how it matches all the other products in the set and them stacking on top of each other is helpful for my small freezer. Overall, it serves the purpose I wanted it to.The Chop & Steam gadget is not bad either the Chopper lets you quickly chop food and steam it in your microwave. It's much easier than using knives, especially if you're still sleep deprived. Removing the chopper blade for cleaning is a little tricky, however you need to be careful. With the Mash-After your food is chopped and steamed, you put it in the grinder to make it the desired texture. The grinder is totally hand operated, so it was a little hard for me to use since I have a touch of carpal tunnel in my left hand. Since all of the pieces in the system are sold separately, you could just skip this and use a blender if you wanted. Lastly for the Store area, once you're done, Munchkin has click and lock freezer trays that you can sue for storing your food. They are about the size of ice cube trays, which ends up being the perfect portion size for your little one. They have a wonderful storage lid that prevents freezer burn and covers the entire tray so you can easily stack them in your freezer. You can also buy special storage cups and a device for making freezer popsicles for your baby.If you're serious about making your own baby food, these tools are definitely worth checking out. You'll easily regain your initial investment by not having to buy jars of baby food at the supermarket every week.
summary: These tools are definitely worth checking out

reviewText: This is the third winter I'll be using this humidifier in my sons room. It works great. You do have to make sure you get the cap on tight or the water will leak but that only makes sense and it's not difficult to get it on tight.I've never seen a spec of mold on it or the filter - ever. I do change the filter about once a month because of lime scale.I notice a huge difference in my son's skin when we use this humidifier. It does it's job and it's easy to use and clean.

I would recommend these to anyone considering cloth diapering.  They will fit in nearly any cover, were much more absorbent than the Gerber brand diapers, and were even more absorbent than the inserts that came with some of our covers (and much cheaper).The only times that we have had these leak was when our son was outgrowing a size.  At that point we knew to buy the bigger size.The only con is that the larger sizes get a little bulky,
summary: Most absorbent pre-fold diapers and a great price

reviewText: I bought this nipples after I got the milk bottle from Tommee Tippee and I liked it very much. My son drink his formula smoothly and I have no complaining at all.

I bought this pump to help increase my milk supply when I was having latch issues with my second child. I still use it to pump extra milk because I don't relish breastfeeding in public. Anyhow, it works adequately for the price. But I have recently been thinking of buying a better pump. The issues with this pump are that it only pumps one breast at a time and you must hold the pump in place. It pumps interminably slow! Seriously. I have 2 kids. I do not have time to sit there for 30 minutes PER breast in order to drain them. And the motor is very loud. My husband sitting in the same room with me has to shout in order to be heard over this motor. It is ridiculous.Other people said you must lean forward in order to drain the milk before you detach it from your breast and that is true but it isn't a big deal to me. However, the pump does start to make me feel sore after using it for a while. But I will say this in defense of this pump, I have used it almost every day for over 3 months and it is still going strong.One more word on this product. Do not think you can get away using batteries. I don't know how "simplygo" it is because when I tried the pump with batteries the suction was so weak it didn't draw any milk. And I am a woman with a good, quick, strong letdown and milk flow so that lets you know how weak the pump is with batteries.All in all it has served it's intended purpose and I wasn't expecting much for the price tag.
summary: acceptable but not the best there is

reviewText: We received this as a gift when our daughter was born and now every time I know someone having a baby I get this for them.  The infants love the sounds and I love that there's a timer.  When baby is a little older, the images on the ceiling give them something to stare at.  Genius!!

My son is a chewer and drooler, and this necklace looks pretty and classy, and you'd have no idea it's a chew necklace until he starts chewing it.  I can't tell you how many people have told me that my son is chewing on my necklace and I can say "yes, it's okay, it's a chew necklace".  People are amazed - everyone wants to touch it.  I love that it's something he can chew and stay happy while I'm wearing him or carrying him, and then I can just rinse it clean.  Great product.
summary: You'd never know it's a chew necklace!

reviewText: I have always wanted to get this diaper caddy but in Canada the price was almost double the price of what I paid for and didn't think it was worth paying for that much!  But when this caddy went on sale for about $25, I immediately bought it!  I no longer have to keep going back and forth to my living room for wet naps and baby powder, or whatever it is I forgot!  Everything I need is in one place and it keeps my dresser tidy as well!  The quality is well made and seems very sturdy! The changing pad has plastic sewn to it and makes it leak proof and easy to clean!!  Perfect for a shower gift or any mom who wants to make her life a little easier!!
i put ditry clothes in it, i can carry it to the basement, and its cute, what else can i say?

Just set this up...which could have been done by a toddler!Pros:-Very, Very easy set up-Good size monitor-Lots of featuresLullabyTwo-Way voice-Expandable with extra cameras-Usable night visionCons:-Resolution is surprisingly low, given its size and cost-Heavy camera limits the placement possibilities

This product solves a few of the challenges that we faced with a new baby:1. We didn't have room for a changing table. But this works perfectly as a great alternative - it sits on a shelf right by the bed, keeping all needed supplies handy to grab, and the included changing mat means I can change diapers on the bed without worry of accidents or messes.2. It's portable. When a baby is happy - you want to keep them that way, lol. So, instead of picking up baby to move her to the bedroom for every change, I can just bring the caddy along with us, easy peasy.The one complaint that I've read from others about this product is that the drawer is a little tough to open. I find that to actually be a big positive - the drawer slides open fine, but it takes a little pull. That means that it won't ever fall open while you're carrying the caddy, spilling all of your supplies. Love it.And there are a few concerns listed about the quality - but I think it's amazing. It feels so much heavier and sturdier than expected when you pull it out of the packaging, and has held up perfectly for us. Great product, gorgeous design.
