The bracelet is a darker more fushia-y pink than in the photo. For the price, I was hoping it looked more like a bracelet, as pictured, than a plastic toy. I kind of feel silly wearing it. But my baby seems to like it... not love it... but she'll chew on it. The rubber is a nice hard chewing surface though.
summary: Not bad, kind of expensive though.

reviewText: We keep this downstairs at the pack and play and our mid level diaper changing station which is adjacent to the living room.  We had been using the pockets on the pack and play to store diapers, powder etc and that was OK but this is WAY better.Solidly made, very sturdy and holds about 2 days worth of diapers (for our 6 week old). Allows us to keep the area pulled together and tidy while keeping everything at hand for a quick diaper change.We ordered two and love them!
summary: Perfect to hold wipes warmer and diapering accessories

reviewText: Fits the Boon Lawn Countertop Drying Rack anywhere and is great for all those little pump parts you don't want getting lost in the grass.  I might get a second one because it's so cute and useful!
summary: A great addition to my lawn!

reviewText: We have tried numerous swaddling products and blankets.  This is by far our favorite.  Our son is unable to get his arms out of it and goes right to sleep once he's secure.  It can get a bit warm, but just ensure that your you're not keeping your house too warm as well.  Its easy to check his diaper without undoing the entire swaddle by unzipping from the bottom.  Our baby is now over three weeks old and the small fits him perfectly.  He isn't a large baby, but it looks like we'll be using this size for awhile or for the duration of swaddling time.  We like the versatility of being able to NOT swaddle his arms as well.  Great product.

We use this nightly! It is convieniant to use on those nights when our infant doesn't want to sleep. She can watch/play the pictures until she is tired enough to fall back to sleep. All without me having to stimulate her, by moving her out of bed. It has been great for us. Highly recommend!

This caddy will work well if you just use them for disposables, or washcloths & bibs. I wanted something large enough to store a few cloth diapers, along with bibs and washcloths so I can access them easily. It doesn't hold cloth diapers as well because of the dimensions, and the dividers move around too much. But the material is nice, lots of pockets and pretty handy to keep a few diapers downstairs so I don't have to run up all the time.

I bought this for my toddler son.  He is getting to the point where he wants to do everything including washing his hands at the sink.  The stool I received looks exactly like the one in the picture-- green top blue trim and red base.  It is a fantastic stool.  The surface is no slip and the little animal decal on the front indicates that the stool can support something like 800 lb.

If you're going to swaddle the baby, halo is the way to go. We had the muslin cloths, swaddleMe and halo was the only one she couldn't get out of. Well, she has gotten her arm out a couple of times but that was just bad velcroing at work. I really liked that I could convert to sleep sack when she started to hate being swaddled (week 9 for us).My only gripe about it is that you probably have to go through several sizes. My DD was outgrowing the newborn size within week 3. So we spent a lot of money on these swaddles. My recommendation is to get a newborn size and then transition after month three to something that will work in the long run like the Woolino. They appear cheap ($16.99) but it adds up once you're buying every single size they have.
Great stool for kids to learn how to wash hand,my son use it in front of his indoor trampoline and he loves it

We are using this seat protector with aEvenflo Big Kid Lx High Back Booster Car Seat, Mauiin a 2005 Hyundai Elantra.  It is wide enough side-to-side.  It covers the seat where it hangs down in the front.We don't generally allow snacks in the car, but every once in awhile, it happens.  The seat protect does a decent job of controlling the crumbs that fall into it.  Thankfully we've never had to test whether it holds liquid!Perhaps the most useful feature is preventing the "dents" in the car's upholstery from the car seat.  If you're concerned about keeping the car seats clean and/or undented, this seems to be a useful product.  Quality seems like it should hold up for quite awhile.

I've got a large family and this is the fourth baby I've cloth diapered.  I bought these diapers for my day care providers since they are an AIO (all in one) and user friendly.  They work, but they're bulky.  I expected that to a degree, but wow they're huge.  For reference, my baby is on the lower range at 23 lbs and 14 months old.  The diapers that came were white, but they had a funky red tinge along the edges.  Given what goes in the diaper, I didn't worry, but perhaps for someone that expects to re-sell later then it may be an issue.  The part that I think makes they ho-hum is that they're not very soft and they air dry rather funky.  I always air-dry my diapers.  I'm used to a bit of stiffness, but these just are a bit too wrinkled and stiff when dried this way.  If they didn't have the vinyl cover I'd toss them in the dryer for a few minutes, but I want to protect the integrity of the diaper to make them last.  I like the Thirsties AIO diapers 1,000 times better, but the Kushie brand ones are definitely cheaper.

A cute little set of 5, relatively small (think plum-sized) bath critters. I was pleased to see other reviews calling these out as safe from nasty chemicals - which was my main concern. My daughter loves them - specifically the penguin and the whale - they're soft, smooth and very squishy - like a rubber marshmallow. Great for bathtime!

There is a reason this carrier is way cheaper than others. The comfort and quality just isn't there. It can work fine, but gets very uncomfortable fast. If you're only planning on wearing it for 10 minute stretches then you're fine. And for what ever reason, the waist belt is not attached to the carrier making you have to thread it through the every time (it always comes out when you're taking off or putting it on). The padding on the waist belt also isn't attached to the belt itself and will come off which is even more of a pain. These two features are bad enough it deal with but are exacerbated when also having to deal with a baby at the same time. Then the quality of the rest of the carrier is just way lower than the more expensive carriers. I ended up putting this in the closet, sucking it up and making the more expensive purchase of the Ergobaby. I wish I had just done that to begin with instead of wasting more money trying to take the cheaper route in the beginning.

I've cloth diapered all 3 of my kids and I have to say these are by far my favorite. I've tried expensive $20+ a piece diapers but these just work better! Yeah they aren't as cute but they work and that's all I care about! Never had a leak and I love the natural cotton. Hard to find in an aio diaper. Most are synthetic material which lead to stink and build up issues. The people saying these are bulky....huh!? are you comparing these to disposable diapers or other cloth diapers? nothing is going to be as trim as a disposable, they are paper, these are cloth and these are actually very trim for cloth diapers! I started using the infant size when my youngest was 10lbs and even then they were trim. With that said, these work, are durable and priced right!

This is exactly what I needed to clean up my toy room.  It's easy to install, and we have a TON of stuffed animals of all sizes packed into this thing!  The only downside is my son keeps trying to hang from it, and it can be a pain to get the animal he wants out of it (of course, he always picks one in the back on the bottom.)

My baby boy is a chunk so a baby carrier is a must. This carrier is really comfortable and for someone with back/neck problems that's saying something. The strap that goes around your waist makes all the difference. I was not uncomfortable walking around with my son strapped in compared to how I am when I wear him in my Balboa Baby sling. It's well made, secure and affordable. Can't argue with that! I have yet to find a single bad thing about this carrier. Skip the more expensive versions and go with this one, you won't regret it!
has to be hung pretty accurately for it to hold  good number of toys . If you stretch it to far or too less the toys just fall off . Once set properyl it does its job welll .

I bought these (not on amazon) at the store today. My son is 3 months old and EBF and has never taken a pacifier and all of a sudden yesterday magically started taking the soothie (he always spit them out and made yuck faces before and would prefer breast, his hand, or my hand). I was so excited, but didn't like how it covered his nose, and in my excitement I ran to the store and bought two gumdrop pacifiers. When I got them out of the package though, I started to wonder if they were really just like the soothie like I had been told. They were heavier, thicker, stiffer, and more plastic-y feeling.  My son does take it, but he isn't as willing to take it and it falls out of his mouth A LOT more than the soothie and he won't sleep with it in his mouth.  I must say I am a bit disappointed.

I really like, but you have to apply at warm temp as it may come off in the cold. But overall, the cling stays on for the last two months I have not had to touch it. It fits over the area that needs to be covered and the price wasn't bad compared to other brands. And it was a two pack, not just one as other brands. Overall, I like it a lot and there is no fuss with closing the window or suction cups.
summary: From the shades out there I think this is the best

reviewText: We first purchased this item when our daughter was about 8 months old as a first toothbrush and she got her first tooth.  Fast forward - she is now 26 months old and STILL loves this for her molars. She loves chewing on it to massage her gums.  I just wish they didn't disappear all the time (just bought two 6 weeks ago & they are both missing already). I would suggest buying pink or blue so that it catches your eye when looking for it (vs the clear).

This is a fun toy for toddlers to use in the bath - and it's educational! My son loves to count the fish and read the numbers out loud in the bath. Plus, the net is a little bigger than the size of the fish, so it can scoop up other bath toys.
summary: Great fun for toddlers learning numbers

reviewText: We purchased this for my 4 y/o for a trip where we were visiting many cities with different flights between and different cars at each stop. I am flying alone with her and an infant, so I couldn't carry more than one car seat. I got the Bubble Bum on a recommendation so we could just keep it in our carry-on and use it when we got to our next vehicle. I wanted something I thought would be safer, but really didn't have a choice.I wasn't expecting it to be of good quality and was pleasantly surprised. This thing is heavy-duty. I really love it. It weighs a lot more than I thought it would, but it's still lighter and less bulky than a regular booster. Even the clips are super thick and tough. It doesn't seem so from the photo. The material that it is made from isn't like an inflatable pool raft, it's even heavier than the material used to make inflatable mattresses. There's no way my kiddo could pop it. It's easy to inflate and I can blow it up in about five breaths in just a few seconds. I'm very happy with this product and will be keeping it as a second car seat instead of selling it when I am done like we were planning on doing.
summary: Very surprised and pleased with quality

reviewText: I received this as a gift at my baby shower.  I started using it when my son was 6months old and still use it now that he is a year and a half.  It conserves water by not filling the tub, easy to clean, keeps his safe from slipping, great for traveling, easy to store . . . .A perfect gift for any new parents.  One of the best presents I've ever received!

I got this to replace another one (tan in color) that we got my son when he was 1. (He had a diaper blowout on it & there was no saving it). My son is now 2 & still loves his chair even if it is a replacement. It fits perfectly next to our coffee table for him to eat or do activities. I do recommend using scotch guard on it as it is microfiber & toddlers are extremely messy. He doesn't care much for the ottoman though. Mostly uses it to stand on to get things he's not suppose to. Oh he's also able to take the legs off. I'm sure that's an easy fix though by just tightening them more 😊

My 6 month old son was getting too big for his infant tub.  He wanted to be in deeper water. This tub is great.  It is the perfect size for him and yet has plenty of room for him to grow into.  We have only had it for 2 weeks but it has made a big difference in bath time.  He is having fun in the bath again.  The suction cup is a nice feature.  We use it to hang the tub on the side of the shower to drain and dry. Great tub for the price.  Highly recommend.

This is the perfect infant-to-toddler towel.  Most babies have outgrown their hooded towels by the time they're a year old (some even before). This towel will still be around and useful when your child is 3 or 4 years old.  It's much more practical than the typical hooded towel and has an added feature that allows you to wear it to keep from getting wet when your little one is having fun splashing in the bathtub.  It's a great shower gift.

I liked this when it fit my baby but she has outgrown this much faster than the fleece version. Comparing side to side looks like this is an inch or two shorter. Not sure if it shrank after washing but definitely good to keep in mind especially if you have a long baby.
summary: Runs smaller than the fleece version

reviewText: We returned this product.  I didn't like the fact that you could never really get all the water out of it which led me to believe that over time, mold would grow inside.  Also, the plate part and suction base are not one piece so my child was able to easily pull on it to remove it from the highchair tray and spill all the contents all over herself and the floor.  Not good in my book :-(

This is perfect for my stroller. I have an UPPA baby Vista stroller which does not come with this type of accessory. But this fits so well around the handle and is very sturdy. I fit everything I need in there for the day, keys, wallet, 2 bottles of water, burp cloth etc. Highly recommend.
Our son loves this bath tub! I love that it is his own inflatable tub within our tub. Makes me feel like he is a lot safer bathing.The duck is super cute and fun for him to play in.
summary: Rub a Dub Dub! My son loves this Tub!

reviewText: I bought these mittens for my 5 months old son who has really bad eczema on his face.  My son is constantly rubbing his (day and night) and these mittens come in handy during the time when is is too hot for him to wear his scratchmenot.  I washed them with cold soapy water and tumble dried them before I placed them on my son's hands and they are still soft and I am also happy to report that these mittens didn't shrink or stretch.

I am a huge fan of Lamaze toys. My son's first favorite toy was Morty the Moose (made by Lamaze). :) So of course, I gave this toy a try when he was learning to crawl. This toy is really what got him to army crawl.  He's a year old now and still plays with it. He loves stacking the pieces, and shaking/chewing on the blue piece (it's a rattle). You can also fit the pieces so that the ball becomes a fully functional rolling toy. As is, the red center piece is weighted, so the ball doesn't really go onto it's side.I will say, this is not really a toy for middle-older toddlers. He is beginning to lose interest in it. I recommend buying this toy for babies that can sit up and/or are learning to crawl. We got it for him around 6-7 months old, so I feel like it was definitely worth the money and we are still getting good use out of it.

These bibs are great, we received several as shower gifts and had to get more. I have both these and the more expensive tommy tippee bibs and don't see a big difference in quality. The thicker neck really helps keep spit-up from saturating the babies' clothes.One downside- you're not supposed to put the bibs in the drier, I assume to maintain the integrity of the lining. However, I don't have time or space to air dry bibs so I put them in the drier anyway.  I do see some degradation of the lining from this. So if that's important to you, don't plan on drying them. :)

tried all different types.. music no music lighted etc... This one is big and mirror is very clear.  At night had small flashlight to check baby when stopped at signal if on my own.  Baby can see you clearly as well!
A must have! My 6 month old son can easily put his thumb in the handle and hold on to  it. He also loves it freezing cold!
summary: Even better frozen, must have for teething babies!!

reviewText: This shape sorter is simple and fun for little ones.  The shapes are sized right for small hands, and it's not too confusing.  They also have cute animals on them to make it more interesting.  The shapes can be put around the base in their places or through the top and the doors.

I was excite to get this product and still am, but it certainly wasn't all that I expected. I did not notice any horrifying smell as other stated- nothing more horrific than typical junk everyone buys from China. Ooops- this one is from China too, so there should be no surprise there IF your buggy ended up smelling.I find the main part of buggy organizer pretty well made and sturdy- the wire around the top gives it a nice finish. Red thread and sign looks good- almost gives it a reasonably expensive look. My issue with this product and the main reason why it received 3 out of 5 starts, are straps. The threading from those come off- almost as if it needed a stitch around versus just through and through. Also, these straps obviously wont help you if your stroller has a handle that is at an angle. I have Mamas and Papas Armadillo stroller and the handle is at an angle and its not adjustable. That is not buggy design's fault, but even if the handle was perfectly perpendicular to the ground, the straps seem to be too flimsy to give this organizer a somewhat sturdier placement. It just sort of dangles and looks out of place.
These are the only spoons I've tried and they work pretty well. I like the bright colors and soft tips. It's also very inexpensive.

I have the City Mini and I looked around for a while before getting this holder. I love it!!! It's nice because the drink holders will expand for larger drinks. It holds 2 drinks and I usually put my keys, wallet and cell phone in the center part and there's still room!! When you fold up the City Mini you don't need to take it off the stroller either.

Yes, this is mesh, yes, they don't make light weight cotton sleepsacks at this stage which is too bad. But for what it is, it's perfect.Things to Know:The other reviewers aren't kidding when they say this thing is BIG. Unlike all the other night time clothing you're used to getting, this runs true to size if not a little bit larger. If your child is not both in the correct weight and height category for this item, order a size down.Happily, if you do what I did and not listen to this good advice, the Amazon return policy is wonderful and incredibly easy.Also, here's a tip if it's borderline too big for your child - use socks on the outside of the sleepsack to hold the little leg openings in place. If there's a bunch of loose fabric hanging between the legs you're kind of out of luck but if your main issue is the feet slipping back into the sleepsack - use socks.
This bib is one of the more expensive I've bought, but it's worth it. It's cute, waterproof, and sturdy. My son loves it. The crumb-catcher pocket is a must. And best of all, it's machine washable.
Very cheap compared to other places.  The mittens are very convenient for small babies.  My son grew them in in the 3 week.
Huge hit with our baby. Very easy for him to hold.
summary: Very easy for him to hold

reviewText: Pro: nice design. The pocket is big enough for 3 diapers and a travel wipe.Con: 1) heavy 2) the changing pad is so short that my LO's legs are outside the pad and she is only 24" now.
How impractical is it that you can't put these bibs in the dryer, they have to be line-dried. Ours had the iron-on image in front actually melt and stick together in a wad.

Got this for my Granddaughters new baby.They love it.It is soft, comfortable for you and the baby.You do not get a back ache from wearing this.This is big, and will fit a man also...This come with pictures that shows you how to wrap you and your baby. It does take a little practice, but it is worth the time.Once you get the hang of it, it is a piece of cake.I think this is more for the new born.I also got her the ERGO baby carrier, which is a bit heavier then this one , and is more for a older baby etc.Enjoy...
summary: You, and you Baby will love this wrap/

reviewText: My baby girl likes it for a little while and then throws it. She isn't thrilled she can't use it as a pacifier. The shape tricks her and then she realizes and doesn't want it.

We're at the phase where we start to wenture out without diapers. Instead, I take this seat in the bag. It's flimsy, yes, but I'm there to provide some back support as well. I would not use it every day at home, but it has allowed us to have some freedom while keepin up with her PT progress, and so far, we've never had a bad experience with it. At 28lbs, though, my daughter is probably putting less stress than a bigger kid.

This cat is super cute! I think I bought it too early for my daughter and then sort-of forgot about it when she was in her teething prime.She is playing with it now, though. I'll set it on one side of the couch to coerce her to cruise over. She seems to find it interesting and likes chewing on the ears.Docking one star just because it's not her favorite. Very well-made and I love that it's organic.

I ordered this for my baby when she was about 3 months old because we knew she would be cutting teeth soon.  She finally cut two at once at 5.5 months.  Now that she has developed some manual dexterity skills, she loves to hold this teether and chew on it.
summary: Good starting after 2 teeth came in

reviewText: This masher has been perfect for making soft fruit purees like bananas either at home or on the go. The ridges on the inside are ingenius, the rubberized handle and bottom rim make for easy handling and tabletop use making mashing food fast and easy. LOVE this product! And the price!

I love this mesh bumper. I'm using with the Ikea Gulliver crib. It fits well, but is a smidge too large. Luckily, the excess material doesn't really show, and it's only an aesthetic issue, not a functional one. I was frustrated by the instructions, however, and had to go to the website to try to find help. Luckily, they have a YouTube video posted that helps explain installation: [...]
summary: Great product, but not great installation instructions

reviewText: Exactly as described and the color is perfect! Not too light and not too bright. It's washable too and very cushion-y and soft, has rattle sound in both ears.
too big for my babys mouth. :/ maybe when he get older it will fit better. i hope so. ^^

I bought this to put on the rear windshield of my car to shield the baby when rear-facing.  I thought the picture showed a rear-facing attachment.  After I got it it states not to be used on front or back windshields.  I have a Mustang and the side windows are way too small to attach.  Also, I figured I'd attach to the rear window anyway since there were 2 and it wouldn't affect my view but it doesn't stick.  There are no clips attached.  I'm not giving up yet and I'm sure there must be a way but for now I'm disappointed.  Otherwise, for the price the quality is acceptable and it is nice to have 2.  Just be sure you know that it is not designed for rear window use.
Soft and stretchy, liked it a lot more than my friend's Moby wrap.  Gray color is beautiful.

I love this cover - we just keep it in the car all the time.  It's so nice to not have to worry about nasty germs on grocery carts or public highchairs.  Would totally buy again.  I also love this gender neutral print.  The bottle holder is practical too nice too.

I attached him to her carseat and now we stand a decent chance of actually taking an outing without her screaming in her seat.  She chews on his nose and falls asleep clutching him tightly.  There are lots of different textures and colors for her to explore.  Great toy.

I live in Southern California and this thing just gets so hot. The baby, himself, emits a ton of heat and then there are all these layers of fabric on top of him.  I think when he was a newborn, this was particularly useful because it provided a lot of close bodily contact. Also, he was tinier than other babies and didn't have much head control making a lot of other carriers hard to use. You get the hang of wrapping it pretty quickly but it's long and unwieldy so there is no good way to do it in public without all the fabric dragging on the ground. Because of that, I tend to only use it indoors when I want to keep the baby with me while I'm reading, watching TV, etc. A piece of advice is to wrap it tightly, a lot more tightly than you initially think is necessary.  The fabric is incredibly stretchy. Once you add the weight of the baby, it really sags, so it needs to be snug before you put him in.

I purchased these thinking they would be the same size as the regular Nuk (6-18 mo) pacifier.  They pop out of my (9 mo. old) son's mouth and frustrate him.  Upon inspection, I found the nipple is shorter and much smaller.  Disappointed.
summary: Shorter and smaller nipple than regular Nuk pacifier

reviewText: I love this diaper pail. For my first child, I previously used one that allowed for your own garbage bags until the smell overwhelmed me (odor blocking bags didn't help). Now I will gladly pay for the custom bags as I almost never smell anything unpleasant with this pail.
I was impressed by the small package but after opening and installing I was amazed.easy to install, works perfectly and have a good quality.

My first baby was born in December of 2012.  I was given two Moby wraps as gifts before he was born, and had even given a Moby wrap as a gift to a friend before I had a baby.  A few weeks after he was born I decided to try the Moby, I figured out the wrap part pretty quickly but I couldn't figure out how loose to wrap it to fit my rapidly growing baby.  After a few attempts I finally gave up.  After another few weeks I became really irritated by the fact that I had two perfectly good wraps, but that I didn't want to use them.  I contacted a woman in my town who sells all types of baby carriers (Frogmamma) and went to see her.  She showed me the Boba wrap, I fell in love.  It was the same type of wrap carrier that I wanted, but the material was stretchier (and softer to the touch) compared to the Moby.  You tie it so it is snug against your body and then put baby in, the material stretches to the perfect fit everytime.My son is now 5 months old and 16 pounds.  We still use the Boba wrap (I have two) constantly.  In those first few months it would help to calm him down during his fussy moments, which always happened in the morning.  This wrap allowed me to actually get breakfast while he would sleep.  I bought another Boba wrap and keep it in the center console of my car.  If I know in advance that I will be using it, I will put it on before leaving the house so I don't have to do it in the parking lot.  That is the only con about this type of baby carrier.  It's long and will drag on the ground while you put it on.

Got this set for my son when he was about 2, it took him 2 tries and that was it. Back on the shelf for a LONG time and recently he got them out again to play again - took him maybe 20 seconds to get them stacked accordingly. Too easy if you have kids over 2 year old.

This is a great product. It is built from very high quality pine, and is extremely sturdy. Assembly was straight-forward and the hardware included is excellent quality as well. Our baby moves around quite a bit during sleep, and this crib does not move one bit! As a result, she sleeps very soundly at night. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!!!

The Playtex drop-in bottles makes feeding formula so much easier and these bottles are the perfect set to take with you whenever you travel. Playtex Baby Drop-Ins Premium Nurser Newborn Bottles are great for reducing gas and In my personal opinion and from experience I believe the bottles help reduce the chances of ear infections. The 30 liners that are included in this gift set help provide a clean bottle by just popping in a fresh new liner everytime. The Playtex drop-in bottles makes feeding formula so much easier and these bottles are the perfect set to take with you whenever you travel. The bottles are easy to clean and the nipples are soft but still durable enought to provide a good feeding for your child.These bottles are BPA free and the Bisphenol A chemical that has been known to mimic estrogen hormones and have lead to negative health effects, so any bottle that has less chemicals is a plus for our children.These are great bottles for any mom and will also make an excellent baby gift because they will love them as much as I do.

Bought this in small for my diaper bag, but it really is small - the size of a quart size freezer bag - so it only holds two soiled fitted diapers. If I'm gone for a while, I have to bring two. Would be good for other things (wet infant clothes) but you should opt for a medium if you want to carry more than one or two diapers home with you.
summary: Great bag - small is SMALL though

reviewText: I love this! My son started teething @ 3 months old & didn't want anything to chew on but his fist (which didn't get the job done). I tried wet & frozen washcloths, cold binkies, cold teething rings...he didn't hold or like any of them. Then my mom bought this giraffe for him and he loved it! It's soft to chew on & he can hold it.
i am pleased with this stroller caddy.  it is high quality for the cost of it.  it secures to two handles with velcro tabs.  i put it on my city mini stroller and it fit perfectly.

I ordered "Captain Calamari's Treasure Hunt" and read it to my 6 month old. She is currently playing with the book now.I am pleased with how large the cloth book is, the feel of the cloth, the rhyming of the sentences and how colorful it is. The mirror and the crackling sounds on the back and cover the book are also major pluses. Having accidentally ordered a book meant for 12 month olds, I am now tempted to order the one meant for 6 month olds.

We bought this for our first child for several reasons. First we removed her bumpers that came with her bedding set because she kept burrying her face against them and we were afraid she was going to gave issues breathing.  After that she kept getting her limbs stuck in the crib rails.  This product solved both issues.  It's very soft so when she puts her face against it she is comfortable but can still breath. It also keeps her limbs in. My only negative is that it is not the easiest to put on and off for cleaning but you get used to it.  Highly recommend this.
I had to watch a You Tube video to figure out how to use this wrap. But once I practiced a couple of times I got the hang of it. Baby loves it and so do I.
even though we only used it for a few months, it worked great, much easier than wrapping and she never got out.  She outgrew it before we were done using it, but she is a big baby.  LOVE IT.

I bought this because it was recommended on another site for the Mountain Buggy Urban Jungle. Although it can strap onto the stroller, putting any drinks in the cup-holders would clearly result in a mess on whomever is pushing the stroller. The Organizer itself is fine, just not with this particular stroller
Great for declawing newborns, and then eventually you'll have to both cut and file to keep their nails trim.  I still use on my 18 month old after trimming his nails.

This works like a charm and it is quick to use.  No need to complain about water dripping, what do you think is going to happen when you flip the lid full of water condensation?  And the water that does drip once in a while opening isn't even that bad.  Would recommend for anyone!
We really loved the design, but we tried every method to install it. There are axis parts that are supposed to be clipped together. It just won't push in. We used tools and still wouldn't work.

Love this bag. First when I viewed this bag online I didn't think anything of it but a typical bag. So after I had purchased and it arrived, I was very surprised at how huge this bag really is. It's great for my daughters dirty clothes for on the go. I will definitely purchase another one in a different size.

The quality of this product is fine but we only used it 2 or 3 times and now it's just taking up a lot of space.  It was comfortable for Baby but baby bath tubs in general are a hassle to set up and clean up and store.  We find it easier to simply have Baby bathe with Mommy or Daddy.  This was something we certainly could have done without.  If you're on a budget, we'd recommend asking around for a safe baby bath tub like this one to borrow as we suspect most folks don't use them very long.

I love that this product is rechargeable, and that you can choose between many different colors. My little girl calls it "Dumbo" and won't go to bed unless "Dumbo lights up". We've been using it for a month now, no issues.
It's plush, easy to clean and fits well. As for the color, I'd consider it more of a mint than a sage...

This si my second time to buy this item after I gave the first one away when I weaned my son.  Now I am expecting again and I know that this item is a must-have for all moms who plan to have a milk bank.  My Lansinoh breast milk containers fit perfectly.  The cover can indeed be used as a second storage unit.  I expect this one to be durable like my first one.  I would recommend this as  gift to encourage other moms to breastfeed and store milk especially if they are going back to work while the baby is still breastfeeding.

I would recommend this sucking pads.  My son kept on sucking on the straps and I had to wash the carrier all the time.  I started using the sucking pads and now I only have to wash the pads...i still wash the carrier but not every time I use it.  The picture is a little different from the product as my sucking pads came with 3 snaps instead of velcro.

We bought this seat nearly 3 years ago now.  Wow, it really has been that long, and we loved it from the get go and ever since.  Yes, it is heavy as sin (33 pounds on its own - with the base included so over 32 pounds you can no longer use the LATCH system, you need to use the seat belt), but it is heavy because of it's construction.  After doing extensive research this was what we ended up going with when our daughter outgrew her bucket seat (at 5.5 months).  It wasn't the most expensive, and it wasn't the cheapest.  This had the perfect combination of safety with cost effectiveness.PROS:~ Multiple bases, simple to exchange from car to car.  It is heavy and a bit bulky to do this, but it isn't the pain in the arse fighting with the seatbelt / straps to ensure a TIGHT and proper fit for the car seat installation.  This in and of itself was a big plus for me.  So many people use their seats with improper installation without even knowing it.~ Cup holder -- seems silly when you are talking about a little bitty baby first making the transition to a convertible seat, not so much when you have a toddler.  Just trust me on this.~  Simple to switch from front to rear facing and back again.  I was working as a nanny and taking my infant with me to work.  There was one day where I needed to transport an additional toddler in my car (friend of one of the kids) and I didn't have my little one with me (she was with her daddy) and it was so easy to take my infant's rear facing seat and convert it to forward facing proper strap positioning  for a toddler in the span of under 5 minutes. And it went back to perfect positioning for my infant just as quickly and easily.  Seriously, this was a huge plus for me!~ My 90th percentile moose of a toddler was able to stay rear facing until literally DAYS before her THIRD birthday!  The safest way for anyone to ride in a car is rear facing, followed by a 5 point harness, and then high back booster (belt positioning) followed by just using the seatbelt.  The weight limitations for this are rather high compared to what was on the market when we purchased, which was a big plus for me personally.  If I was spending $300 on a seat ... I wanted it to LAST me for a while.  I won't ever have to buy her another seat (which was a huge plus for my husband!).CONS:~ My daughter is always so warm in this seat.  Like seriously, HOT!  When she was little, she would be sweated wet on her back.  I really wasn't thrilled with this aspect, but I learned to layer her and remove layers so she is dressed in light light clothing in her seat (which is actually a positive because that is safer for strap tightness and placement!)  and just layer her / bundle her up before taking her out of the car.Over all, I am beyond happy with my purchase and highly recommend this seat to anyone asking my opinion.
I love the color and feel of the cover! It is so soft on baby's bottom and skin. When he rolls over he rubs his face against it.

I bought this when my son was born. It fits our single kitchen sink perfectly and he has enjoyed his bath since then. After he could sit up good, I bathed him in a tub but my mom likes it better than a tub because it would use less water and maybe easier for her to wash him that he wouldn't move around too much. (She watches him during day time). So when I bath my son now, he would always brings this tub to me because that's how he is bathed during the weekday so I'm sure he still enjoys it too.I like this product has different bathing positions and an area to put soap/toys. We did use the sling few times when he was born, slightly over 7 lb but he out grew the sling so fast so mostly he was bathed without the sling.Oh, you have to be careful when pulling the plug. My nanny broke it after few use (she is not the most careful person in the world anyway) so it's not so easy to unplug it anymore. My mom just lives with it.
summary: Still using it now my son is 1.5 year old (31/32 inch)

reviewText: I got this because I needed a night light in our infant's room. But because we have an older house, each room only has 2 outlets and they were blocked. I had rigged an extension cord with a night light resting on a shelf but that looked very un-cute in my son's otherwise nice room.Positives:+The blue and green light give enough light so you can see in the room, but enough to easily get and stay asleep for a kid. The red light gives less light so is a good option for a darker room.+The cord that goes into the blue base is about 4 feet long, so good if you need it as I did to extend a night light from a blocked outlet+The base has a circular charger design-- basically you don't have to struggle to match the bear with the base-- you just put the bear back on the blue base in any direction and it connects.+Option for light to stay on all night, or to go for (I think) 20 minutes then turn off+Cute that it is safe for the kid to take it to bedNegatives-- Expensive for a night light.--I would love to have an old fashioned plain white light option. The only options are colors: changing colors, red, blue, green.
summary: Good light when outlet is not easily available

reviewText: First of all, it was hard for me to hit the button and purchase this diaper bag not being able to view it in stores first.  I tried Target and Babies R Us and neither had it in stock.  I had this diaper bag on my baby registry for 7 months before I finally bought it.  Boy was I NOT disappointed.  The bag looks even better in person.  I opened the box and did the "WOW".  The bag is high quality and is very fashionable and has just the right color combination. It also is big enough to hold everything you'll need, but not look over-sized on you.  I've read a few reviews that "short" people thought it was too big for them.  I'm 5'3" and it looks great on my shoulder or on my stroller.  So happy that I purchased this bag!!!

This is one nice mobile (the actual name of it is Fisher-Price Rainforest Friends Musical Mobile) - with all the bells and whistles.It is made out of heavy duty plastic and has a very substantial feel to it. It fastens to the side of baby's crib, with the mobile hanging and spinning above, until baby is big enough to grab hold of it. Then the mobile detaches and a kangaroo musical nightlight is left, playing music or white noise, and serving as a nightlight.The monkey, lion and elephant figures are very cute and brightly colored. One negative - I never did see much use in the "funhouse" mirrors put on children's toys. Are our children supposed to think that's what they look like? Music, white noise, light, movement - all come together for baby's entertainment and help for baby's caregiver.It was easy to put together, very intuitive. I do wish it had come with the three "C" batteries included, at least short-life demo ones. And I'm glad there is a volume control for the music/white noise features.

I feel that its bit noisy but my son is in stiches laughing with this under his feet.  I don't get it but he loves it.  It is a little softer under his toes and it gives him a real laugh.  Good stuff.
works great, but we don't have enough water pressure for the spout to work.  but my kid loves the whales, and it stays put on our faucet.
summary: need a lot of water pressure for "spout" to work

reviewText: My 6-month old really loves this mobile, and it keeps him busy. Last night he watched it until he fell asleep...a parent's dream come true! He's at the reach out and grab stage so he really wants to grab the little toys. This is good inspiration for him to start sitting up on his own, and he's getting there.This is no cheapy make either, it's good thick plastic with good round molding so the baby won't hurt himself. I like the solidness of it, I know I couldn't just bump into it and break it. Well worth it!
This is pretty effective at doing it's job.  I just wish it was a little longer.  It holds all kids of bag, not just First Years.  It does a good job.  Easy to load, and take bags out.

I love the Playtex Nurser bottles! I love that you don't have so many pieces per bottle to wash like the Ventaire bottles. You only need to wash/sterilize the nipples, caps, and rings, which saves a new mom lots of time. The wide nipples do make it a little hard for the baby to latch on at first but they get used to it. I also like the drop ins because I know they are presterilized so I don't worry about the germs for my baby. The fact that the bags help reduce the air the baby intakes is also a bonus. This set is a great starter kit- it came with two sizes of bottles, the 4 oz for now and the 8 oz for when baby can drink larger amounts and also drop in liners.The only reason I gave this 4 stars is because the set only gives you 2 of each bottle size and if you are like me and like to premake a few bottles for convenience, you'll have to buy an additional set to get extra bottles. Also, the drop in liners do have one flaw - the ounce measurements on them are not colored so they blend in and are hard to see; I discovered that they are also inaccurate and are off by 1/2 ounce. I use a Ventaire bottle to measure out her formula and to measure what she didn't drink.Overall these are great bottles and are very convenient.
Love the royal blue color.  Maybe it shrank a little?  I'm not sure, but it's a great fit on our baby's mattress.
It does pretty amazing for it size ..  100% safe for your little one  it's light enough to put everywhere plus the clamp it's pretty stout ..

We bought this extra base for my husbands car. Even though we dont use it that much, it is nice to know that when my husband does have my daughter in his car, she is more secure than just with the seatbelt in the car. If you have a second car, I highly recommend you spend the extra money on an extra base. Not only for safety, but it is so much easier taking either car and not having to take the one base in and out of the other cars.
summary: A must for your second car

reviewText: I just bought a 4 pack of these and will be buying more. So far, I use two for the cabinets on my entertainment center and two on my desk drawers. I followed the directions - clean the area, make sure it is completely dry, apply the double-sided adhesive and stick to the surface. I let it sit for a day or so before my son tried to open a drawer without success.They are incredibly easy to open if you know how - squeeze the top and bottom buttons and the latch is released. But my son won't be able to figure this out for a long time (I hope) and I won't let him see how I do it either.Edit: Does anyone know how to adjust the strap after they have been on for a while? I just want to open one side and make the strap shorter, and have tried prying it open but it doesn't want to give. I don't want to break it if its not meant to be opened again, so I'm just wondering if anyone has any tips on how to get them open?
summary: Effective in keeping my baby out of drawers and cabinets!

reviewText: Oh my word!  I LOVE LOVE LOVE this highchair.  It is stylish, slender, doesn't look kiddie and it is easily cleaned.My 5 month old so loves it, too.Positives are-1) You can put the tray and the tray table in the dishwasher2) Cute orange color3) It looks clean and you can easily wet wipe the whole chair and base down4) It is on rollers so it moves easily.  It also has a brake so you can keep it in one spot.5) It has a height adjustment, so it can fit at your dining room table or at your kitchen counter.Negatives are-1) It is a bit priceySo, I say spend the extra money and buy it.  It's a great product.  I did the 2-day prime shipping and received it the next day.It's super easy to put together.  It maybe took me 6 minutes.

We have used this tub both with and without the hammock feature for our son. We have found that it works great both ways! We love the versatility. It is easy to carry (even with water in it) and empty. It fits on a variety of surfaces from our tub, countertops and kitchen sink. The plastic is easy to clean and the water stays warm for a long time. The handy compartment holds rinse water or supplies. It is easy to position our son and get him bathed quickly. Although it doesn't fold up, it stands easily and fits in our bathroom closet. Overall, you can't beat the product for the price!

This leg extensions are so nice to have and so worth paying the extra money for… They raise the co sleeper up to the level of (2 to 3 inches below) but it is so much easier in the middle of the night when he's not so much lower – I have a very high pillow top- these are a lifesaver!

I love this product! My daughter loves to toss her binky and this helped keep it in. Her little legs always ended up using the standard bumper as a foot rest with her foot hanging out of the slats and this has stopped that so far. She loves to scoot right up to the corner of the crib too and with this bumper I do not worry as much about suffocation. It looks good and was easy to install. We have a slatted crip that does not have a up and down front rail. We lower the mattress as she gets bigger. I attached the long piece bumper to the short piece to make it go all the way around with no gaps and it works great. I would recomend this to all. If you are worried about length, there is enough velcro to stretch or tighten to your desired length.

I was so excited to purchase this toy for my baby when she was about to start crawling around 6 months of age.However, Fiona generated very mild interest.For me as a mom The dog looks great but my baby just wasn't that interested.Fiona plays nice upbeat melodies. It moves at a good pace: slow enough for baby to stay interested and comes to a stop within a couple of feet.Traction issues are a separate story. Initially it worked well on our wall to wall carpet. Then after the carpet was thoroughly shampooed the dog stopped moving. I guess the carpet got too plush for this dog. Mildly frustrating....Overall, Fiona is a good idea but it didn't work well for us because of the surface issues and its inability to keep baby's interest for long.
summary: Nice idea but the Baby doesn't really follow Fiona...

reviewText: This highchair is no good for a younger baby. It does not recline, so it is very hard to feed a young baby, because he is always falling forward. My baby slumps to the side and crys, because he is uncomfortable leaning over the hard wood side of the chair.  The seat pad is very thin, leaving a hard seat for baby to sit on and if your baby throws his head back, he will hit it on the wood. Also, there is very little space for the leg holes, and I find it very hard to get my 17lb 4 1/2 month old in to it. I am glad this high chair was a gift, now I can buy a softer, bigger, reclining highchair, that my baby will like.
summary: Nice to look at, not practical at all!

reviewText: We received this crib fast and in excellent condition.  We wanted a mini crib because we were putting it in our room for the first year and we have a small nursery.  Also, after looking at the specifications for the full size cribs they just seemed massive.  We love this crib it is adorable, sturdy and was easy to assemble (my husband put it together in less than half an hour without help).  Our son is now 15 months old and still has plenty of room for him his pillow pet and his favorite stuffed animals.  He had no problems transitioning from our bed to the crib.  The pad that comes with it is really thin though so we bought the Dream On Me 3" Extra Firm Portable Crib Matress, White which fits perfectly.  I just use regular crib sheets and tuck them under and there is no problem.  Overall Great product for the price!

Awesome for drawers. I haven't tried to remove them yet, so I don't know how difficult that is, but it only takes about a day of getting use to opening these, and the toddler hasn't figured it out yet.

My boy has no trouble getting onto and off the Pourty Flexi-Fit Toilet Trainer and seems comfortable using it. Plus, the splash guard does a good job preventing spills. All in all, the trainer works well but not exactly as stated. When setting up the Pourty Flexi-Fit Toilet Trainer you are suppose to adjust the prongs to be a little further in from the toilet seat edge. This means to put the trainer on the toilet seat you must squeeze the rear of the trainer in slightly. The trainer then stays securely in place because the prongs are pushing against the edge of the toilet seat. However, when I adjust the prongs to be a little further in from the toilet seat edge the rear of the trainer bows up. As a result, I adjusted the prongs on the trainer to be flush with the toilet seat. Setting it up this way, the trainer does wiggle a little but is easy to pull off and put back in place because it just lifts up when taking it off and slides down when putting it back, no flexing necessary. I would have preferred the toilet trainer work as described so it would be very secure on the toilet seat. Still, I'm happy with the purchase as it looks nice, does a good enough job staying in place, and my child has no problem using it.
summary: Works Well But Not Exactly As Described

reviewText: I have a boy who's just getting comfortable going on an adult sized toilet vs his potty seat. This fits our oval seat well, just as well as the Bjorn seat which we have in another bathroom already. The plus is that this seat is way cheaper. The only downside is there's no good way to hang it, so it just sits on top of the toilet.
These are sturdy, cute, and reasonably priced (much better than buying each one separately.) The clip is strong, but designed so it doesn't snag or otherwise damage baby's clothes.

This is a nice placemat. It sticks in place on our glass-topped table and gives our daughter a nice eating area. My only problem with it is that it's tricky to clean. I'll think I've washed it only to find dried stains on it when dried. It's also tricky to hold and wash because it's so floppy.
summary: tricky to clean due to floppiness

reviewText: I picked this up in the store -- at first glance, I thought this was such a great idea! My daughter would very often grab the bowl and fling all the food on the floor (she loves doing that!) But the suction like many other users confirmed -- doesn't work. You would have to keep pushing it (every 30 seconds) to keep it down and it doesn't stick that well on plastic table tops... which most highchairs have. But I still use these bowls because they are the right size and the lid actually snap closed nicely. And the quality of the plastic is very good and it's pretty... So if you are buying it for the suction - don't bother, you will def be disappointed... but if you just want some bowls to keep and feed your kid with... this is nice
summary: cute bowls but the suction doesn't work

reviewText: We bought this because the table top tray for the Stokke highchair is too expensive.  This is even better (I think this is also better than the silicone mat with the food trough and cow decor)!!!! It is smaller, so less obtrusive. The sides are high enough to catch liquids, but easy for my daughter to reach food over (BLW).  She has discovered that if she pulls the food to the edge, she can suck it right off the mat.  The mat sticks to our old metal table like glue-- stays flat and looks nice.  The entire mat is flexible silicone, so can roll, but thick (here is where the cow one would have it beat).  Dishwasher safe (top).

Love this highchair. I did a lot of research for highchairs as my son is only 5 months now but we go this when he was 4 months and just starting solids. He is able to sit up pretty good so we thought we would start getting him used to the highchair. He loves it! He loves being able to see everyone and it is great for him to sit in while I get dinner ready (when he is not on his playmat). It was very easy to put together and the 3 different levels for the chair back is perfect. I can put it all the way back so he is inclined when he is just sitting around and not worry about him falling forward. The middle setting is what we use to feed him right now. He is still too little for the front setting which has him sitting straight up but we are working into that.For the price and the comparison to other high chairs. We love it. It was easy to put together, matches our kitchen so it looks good sitting there.

This item is awesome! It steams everything in 2 minutes and is easy to use. Microwaves are everywhere, so if you need to travel with it you can sterilize your baby's items at any hotel, or guest's house. It also fits small microwaves. For the price you definitely get your money's worth out of it. I highly recommend this product.

I like these pillows because they keep my cloth wipes moist, but after a few days in the wipes warmer, my cloth wipes get a funky smell. I don't know if it's due to the wipes solution, wipes, warmer, or replacement pillows. I no longer use these replacement pillows  - I just put a bottle of wipes solution in the warmer and squirt the solution on dry wipes as needed.
Work great and a must have if you are using cloth wipes in the wipes warmer.  Love the warmer too.
Super cute and comfy kneeler! Makes the awkwardness of bending over the tub a little less awkward. Super comfy kneeler!
No complaints.  Really helps my knees during bath time.  I also like that the hanging loop opens with velcro so that I can hang it on the towel bar, as I don't have a hook for it.
I would recommend this product. I use it in my sons playpen. I wash it a few times a week and it still looks brand new.
The raspberry is basically vibrant pink and not the purple as shown in the images - I'm quite disappointed as it would be too expensive to ship it back from Australia.
summary: Image of colour is very deceiving

reviewText: these car seat strap covers are very soft. i am glad i purchased them from amazon.

The quality is excellent and you cannot beleive the price because it is so low.The only problem that I have encountered is the size and the complication of building it by myself.You will need at least two people to assemble it, and also an automatic driver will be in good use.Other than that everything was magnificant.

This is a good product but you have to be sure you use it on the right kind of tile. I have a matte finish ceramic tile and it does not stick at all. The four suction cups are white opaque plastic and are firm to the touch and do not have much grab to them.Other than that, this organizer is deep and holds a lot of toys. It also has two convenient hooks. It is soft and stores well. It feels well made.
summary: Good, but does not work on matte tile

reviewText: This is a thicker quilted option for playard sheet. Cute prints and washed well. Would be better if cotton was softer feel than others I have seen.

My daughter loves it. Almost an all-in-one toy.1. Peek a boo flap and embroidered details and textures that works like a "book"2. Tuggable leaf shaped teether for her to chew whenever she wants3. Can be easily attached to the stroller with the strapTraining her to read books from young, making it her habit (haha)....Below is another peek-a-boo book that you may want to consider:http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B0043D28B4?ie=UTF8&camp;=213733&creative;=393185&creativeASIN;=B0043D28B4&linkCode;=shr&tag;=swiclu-20&linkId;=PZFCK7ML5RMS4RHBSharing is caring,Cheers!
summary: My daughter loves it. Almost an all-in-one toy.

reviewText: We have an Aprica openair haven playard, and use the bassinet feature for our infant. Our baby refused to sleep in this during the first month, and we wanted to make it work so we wouldn't have to move her crib into our room for a few months and then move it back.We love our playard but didn't like the fact that it doesn't have any crib sheets made just for it. We found a plain cotton cribsheet that fit it okay, but when our newborn refused to sleep in it we thought maybe we needed something more soft and plush.We found this sheet here on amazon, read the reviews, and promptly ordered it in pink.Our baby didn't immediately start sleeping in the playard with this sheet, but after a few more tries, the length of time she'd sleep in there slowly got longer. She has now been consistently sleeping in this for 7-8 hour nights! We are amazed and think this sheet has a lot to do with it.So we highly recommend this sheet- particularly for use with the Aprica playard!
summary: Great fit for Aprica Openair Haven Playard

reviewText: Holds 2-3 loads of laundry for infant/toddler clothes. Hamper is sturdy enough and attractive in my baby's room.  I like this much better than the folding wooden hamper I used for my oldest daughter and will be buying another one of these to replace it.  No real way to clean this, so I just make sure clothes with wet messes go straight to the laundry sink rather than putting them into the hamper.

I move this car seat  ALOT!  I only have this one and one that stays in my mom's car.  She preferred I buy a Safety 1st Air 65 LX because it is what my niece has and what she is familiar with.  That one stays in my mom's car for a reason, it is so hard to get in and out of cars.  The Evenflo is a different story.  It is soooooo easy to switch that I move it between, mine, my husband and my sister's car (my sister watches my son twice a week).  I planned on buying at least one more and I still may when he gets bigger, but for now, we are managing fine with one car seat per three cars.The only cons are (not deal breakers for me)1.  Rear-facing, it definitely needs a towel or something under it to ensure proper recline.  My back seat does not have a big dip; it is an older car, but I still need a large towel underneath it.2.  The loosening of the straps at the bottom, near his rear, is no problem for me, but has proven confusing and difficult for my mom.3.  It is a little difficult to get my son in and out rear facing with the large head wings in the backseat of my 2005 Subaru Forrester and my husbands 2009 Accord.  My husband routinely bonks his head.4.  My husband is 6'2" and cannot sit in front of him.  I am the only one that can sit in front of my son in either car because the son has to be almost all the way forward to fit the seat rear-facing.  In the driver's seat in the Subaru it is all the way forward except for about an inch and 1/2.  In the Accord, the passenger seat is all the way forward except for one notch.It is a great car seat.  I pray that it is as safe as they say it is as it has been convenient.  Hopefully I'll never find out.
and goes with an outfit I hope my son and daughter-in-law will take a picture of my first grandson in while holding this.

I have purchased 3 different toy bags/catchers for the bathtub and was so disapointed with all of them until i found this one.Most of the others are first thin and ugly. This one was eye catching and was that neoprene fabric so it was not thin at all. The bottom is netting so the water escapes and it drains very well.It took us 2 tries to get it to stick to our very old shower fake tile - but it ended up working and has not come down since and its been like 6 months.I would highly suggest this item!

I like the bassinet feature on this so I can have the baby with me when I'm in the living room and have him in his cradle in the bedroom. The one thing I don't like about the bassinet feature is the fabric that seems to collect every piece of dust that flies through the air.  There aren't any sheets you can buy for this.  I also wish the sheets for the pack n play were sold in stores.  It seems they can only be ordered online.

cheap, and gets the done, I keep 1 of these on my stroller at all times to connect the inevitable snack trap to, and a different one with a grip for a cup.  You could also connect a binky or toy for a smaller child, but with my toddler, that's really a non issue these days.  But the cup and snack trap she has to always have near but not in her lap, This makes for one less thing I have to worry about loosing.  We initially got them for a trip to Europe, and it allowed us to fold the stroller for steps, and such, without worrying where the snack trap and cup would end up in the folding process.

Our son requests these cups by color. They are just the perfect size for his hands, and adults are not tempted to overfill them with liquids. We also use them for snacks like Cheerios when we need to eat without hands touching the foods (like in the car).

WE used this changer/sleeper constantly when my son was in the first 5 months of life.  This is where he slept during the day and where we changed him.  It is easy to cleanup when you child has accidents on the changer.  We are still using it when we go on trips with our one-year old.  A very good product! I would highly recommend!
summary: This was a Godsend when my son was an infant.

reviewText: This worked for our Chicco Keyfit when the old adapter wouldn't fit. I just don't like the fact that there is no umbrella shade when the baby seat is on the City Mini.

Rarely write reviews as it takes time away from well... other cool endeavors.  But, my wife and I are totally psyched on day two of use - or night two more specifically.  We have swaddled our little girl from the get go - using swaddle blankets are first, then a woombie infant, a halo sleep sack/swaddle (which we loved up until 3 mo) and then we decided to attempt to transition away from the swaddle at 4mo.  Did not go well!  Unless you think waking up every 2 hours to calm a baby is your thing?  We prefer to visit less at nite with our daughter and this woombie convertible does the trick.  The mega size allows for our 4mo 18lb baby to have some room to stretch but is tight enough to give her the comforting sensation she needs to sleep at night.  And prior to going down for sleep or immediately upon waking up her arms can be freed if she so desires.  Access is easy, the construction is solid, especially the buttons that close the arms holes off.  Overall, this is a great product that will last us another 3 months - the stretchy material allows for some growth.  Our little girl loves to be able to put her hands together while sleeping - and this swaddle allows for it - and also keeps her tightly swaddled.  You can't go wrong with this product.  By the way, my wife and I were not fans of the infant style woombie - just seemed a strange fit to us at the time.  Looking back it probably would have worked fine but we preferred the Halo brand at that stage.  Here's to more sleep!
I like the blanket, it didn't feel like some of the other brands. For the price it is a good deal. I would buy another one if needed.

The color pop's! I have the one for the home but this on the go one is perfect. It comes with a car charger so they still stay warm even in transit. A must have for those who indulge. No cold wipe will touch my little girl bottom....
summary: On the go warm and all

reviewText: This is our second baby, almost five years after our first. And can I just tell you how much the world of cloth diapering has changed in just those five years. We prefer to use prefolds with a plastic cover. With our first we went with pins, after being stuck in the thumb or index finger more times than I can count I was anxious for a solution this time around. These are prefect. No worry of anyone being stuck, user friendly for anyone changing the diaper. Fits on a variety of sized bums too. Would have preferred different colors, but Amazon was out of the pink when I originally ordered. Lets be honest though, its for a diaper, color doesn't really matter!!

This mattress is great.  It's firm and sturdy but not stiff. I laid on it when we got it and it's comfy. It fit our crib very snug too. Since it is waterproof, I also bought a mattress pad to go over it so my daughter didn't sweat from the plastic coating. The mattress pad is not waterproof which is tough to find many choices but you can find them.  I'm really surprised at the quality for the price. Great purchase- super happy.

No that's it assembled, I like it.  The bars are the same height as our bed, so it makes a great "co-sleeper".  We have used an Arm's Reach co-sleeper (clear vue model) for prior baby, but gave it away.  Decided on this for new baby as co-sleeper is more expensive and only useful for very young babies - at least this can be used as a play yard later on, and is portable.  Complaints are that it was very difficult and frustrating to assemble the napper/changer the first time - probably about 45 minutes from start to finish, but very frustrating.  Once assembled it makes sense, but the instructions aren't great.  The napper/changer is not all that reversible - the plastic mechanism does not glide smoothly, the button is hard to push.  When turning it, the metal frame of the napper rubs against the mattress below and you have to apply some pressure to get it past the mattress (we do have a mattress pad and sheet on the play yard mattress, so it may be a bit thicker than the mattress alone, but were not going to put a baby down right on the scratchy play yard mattress).  So, we don't use the reversible feature - it's a napper or a changer but not both, unless your really motivated.  Also the cover of this is not removable or machine washable - spot clean only - so napper/changer requires a separate waterproof pad and sheet or blanket (bassinet size roughly).  Napper side is covered in soft sueded material, changer bottom is white plastic and sides are fabric.I like the color - dark grey and purple.  A nice departure from pink for a girl.  The floral fabric on the long sides, and the toy bar, consist of flowers in shades of purple/deep magenta/lavender/a few light blue and two shades of grey.  Floor of play yard and short sides are a vivid purple/dark magenta color.  Napper is very light grey.Pleased with it now that it is assembled, makes a nice spot next to our bed for a newborn and will grow with her needs, but don't expect to use reversable feature.
summary: Like the napper feature but difficult to assemble first time.

reviewText: I would give this car seat a 5 but it is heavy.  However, the reason it is so heavy is because it is the safest available car seat on the market.  It also came wiht a nice fabric and wipes clean easily. It works very nicely with the B-Agile stroller. Also, if you are purchasing the B-Agile stroller to go with this car seat you should know that you need both the manual for the stroller and the car seat to be able to figure out how they work together.  It is a little annoying but only a slight inconvenience. I would defintely recommend it.
summary: If you're going for safety, this is the car seat to pick

reviewText: Excellent seat! Very happy with its quality, and my 4 year old is safe and comfy in it. I would definitely recommend it!

Perfect size for a young one needing the extra distance. My LO is 1.5 and short and this helps her to wash hands and brush teeth on her own daily. I like that it is longer and has 2 options of how to attach to sink, versus competitor who doesn't (and we have that one too!)
These straps are handy and convenient. We have snapped a toy to one end and the other end to our baby carrier. This makes entertaining the baby easy when we are out and about. Great idea!

We found this pack and play to be very flexible and really like that we can use it as our child grows. It appears that most models don't have the two-level bassinet that this one has.  For the space we have it is a bit larger than expected, so it doesn't easily wheel in and out of rooms as we had hoped it would, but it is still not too much trouble to break-down and set up again. The music box mobile doesn't stay on very long after a full wind-up but that's a minor disappointment. Overall we are very happy with it's quality, ease of use, and functionality.
summary: Great multi-use product, though a bit larger than expected

reviewText: This is a great infant seat. It seems a little heavy, but it also seems very solid and like it would do the best job possible in protecting your baby in a crash.  One down side is the size of the base unit (that stays in your vehicle).  If you have a compact sized vehicle, it probably won't fit.

Supposedly spins, but you have to use both hands and force it.  So far, is working fine for lots of bottles / little parts as well as my pump parts that need washing.  We are currently using 4 oz. glass bottles (and it's fine), but I bet it will be too flimsy to handle 8 oz. glass bottles--which I will be switching to in the next few months.  If that's the case, my rating will need to be downgraded to 1 star.
summary: Not bad--but may not work when I switch to bigger/heavier bottles

reviewText: I love this! I had one when I was little and now my daughter has a lot of stuffed animals. I went in search of one and found this. I have had it for about 6 months and it is still holding up perfectly. The chain is hanging one her door as a swag with her crib shoes on it. I wasn't specifically looking for it, so it was just an added bonus. It does work pretty well for it's current purpose. All in all very happy with my purchase.

There certainly is no shortage of excellent reviews for this item, but thought I'd chime in anyway. Why? Because it really is THAT awesome.First gave this to my son when he was a little under three months old. Already, he was grabbing it and hugging it. We quickly made it part of his bedtime and nap routine. He's sleepy- we put in his binky and hand him this giraffe blanket and he knows it's time for sleep. Now (he's 5 months) he immediately grabs it to his chest and rolls onto his side to pass out. One suggestion, and I believe someone else said the same: ONLY give it when it's nap/sleep time. Probably goes without saying, but it's worth mentioning. Then, it becomes a conditioned response- "Oh, I have my blankie. Must be time to go to sleep."They wash well, and just make sure, if you buy several, to always wash them together so they wear at the same rate. This may not seem important now, but it will in the future.

This product works well, but like the Carter's mattress cover of the same material, one wash in the washing machine and it looks disgusting. I was hoping I could use this to put on top of the mattress, the changing table, or lay it down wherever, but it's all pilled and disgusting looking now. Still effective and waterproof, but pretty unsightly.
summary: One wash and they look gross

reviewText: This works great on our goose-neck faucets! The rubber part stretches to go around the end of the goose neck and stays put when the water is running!

My son will not sleep without Mr. Bunny. I have bought 4 of them as spares and I am so glad I have. They are built really well, soft, and cozy. He loves the silky tags on them. I rotate them so they will all have the same smell. I would definitely buy them again.

This is a nice seat that has lots of growing room. I would not put a 2-year-old in it since I would not forward face a 2-year-old. I might use the seat for a larger 3-year-old. We got this for a 5-year-old after he outgrew his other harness in a smaller seat. We are very pleased!
Avoid having your baby loosing toys from stroler. good product for a fair price. The color options are nice, too.
summary: Simple but a must to have

reviewText: This seat is outstanding.  It is designed to be held in place either with the car's seat belt or with a separate strap.  If you use the car's seat belt, the seat can be installed and uninstalled in a flash, making it very easy to move from one car to another.  To install, just flip up a piece on sitting side of the seat back, pull the seat belt across and fasten it, then snap down the piece of the seat back you had flipped up.  That piece locks down and pulls the seat belt tightly against the seat, holding the seat firmly in place.  There also is a tether strap to put over the back of the seat of the car and snap into the receptacle that is built into all cars nowadays.  To remove the seat, just reverse the steps.  Very easy.  Also, adjusting the height of the shoulder strap attachment points and the length of the shoulder straps (to fit different size children) is quick and easy.  The seat has two positions, one straight up and one slightly reclined.  We have not used the reclined position, but it probably would be useful on a long trip so the child could sleep more easily.

I received two packs of these - one lemon, one lilac or lavender.  I love the scents but they just don't freshen like I need them to.  I put one is the diaper pail, and the rest in his room and I smell nothing.  They don't freshen up anything.  I only gave two stars because I like the scents.
The BumGenius and Flip diapers fit my baby better than the others I've tried (Thirsties and Rumparooz). I love that it has the double row of snaps so you can adjust the waist and thighs separately.
summary: Fits my chubby-thighed baby very well

reviewText: This is a very great sippy cup. My son learned to use sippy cups with the nuk learner cup. He is very picky when it comes to sippy cups. He only likes soft spouts, and nuk is the best. The only downfall is there are on OUNCES markers on the bottles. That makes everything alot harder when measuring milk and juice.
summary: My son loves this sippy but

reviewText: very small- i thought they would be a little larger, but was disappointed by size; also there is no adhesive on the back to stick it anywhere.

My son loves his "hippo" he must sleep with it every night. I love how soft it is and it has stayed soft after several washes. I love that I can order more. We currently have 2 so I can swap one out for washing. I also like that it does not rattle like some loveys do, and the head in the corner instead of the middle is much easier to cuddle with.
This is great for uneaten baby food that needs to be stored in the frig.  If fits great in the storage case.

It's great not to have the extra piece of furniture around the dining table. Chair is comfy and easy to clean.I didn't even try to use the white tray because of the other reviews on how easy it is for the kids to throw it on the floor.Bought an extra one to keep at grandmas.
summary: Great! Bought one for grandma's home too

reviewText: I do not agree with the other reviewers stating that this takes up a lot of room. It really doesn't considering your dishwasher isn't packed with dirty dishes....which it shouldn't be. gross. The bottles themselves do not go inside of this basket, only the parts. I love this product! Thank you Dr. Browns for making my life easier!
these are good, for the diaper pail, you can stick inside or out of pail, it will keep area smelling fresh

We purchased these lap pads to use under our bassinet sheet for any accidents.  They are SO small that you'd have to use all 3 to really cover a decent area.  Even if there was an accident, the material was not at all absorbant, in our opinion.  We have yet to find a use for them.

We live in the city and I thought this would be easier than purchasing a separate stroller, but the wheels on this stroller are plastic and not very shock absorbent.  We had to go very slow so that the baby didn't jostle around so much as he's only 10 days old.  Wish we would have researched if there was something more shock absorbent for infants.I wanted to update my review, my baby is now 6 weeks old.  Be careful of the brakes while walking.  The brakes are not up very high and while crossing the street, my foot hit the brake and the stroller stopped in the middle of the street.  I had the right of way, just wanted to update with the sensitivity of the brakes.
summary: Wish the stroller was a little more shock absorbent

reviewText: My son actually preferred these style bottles for awhile. The nipple is shaped just right for his little mouth, and he has no problems avoiding air bubbles with the big vent on the nipple.
Some of the pegs don't fit snugly so they keep popping off, but aside from that, it works great, spins well and holds all my bottles and stuff, so I've got no complaints.
summary: You spin me right round baby right round....

reviewText: I ordered a brand new thirsties duo wrap and was sent a used duo diaper. The seller gave me a refund but let me keep the diaper. My 2 year old is potty trained but needs a diaper at night and for naps. He is a tiny little stick of a boy, he weighs 23-24 pounds and is 35 inches tall, he's in the 5th% for weight and 10% for height. There is no way this diaper will last until he is 40 pounds, we're on the biggest rise, but its barely enough.
